Kontynuuj rozbudowę swojego zamku w nowej aplikacji! Empire: Four Kingdoms (Polska). Kliknij tutaj, aby pobrać nową aplikację i kontynuować grę od momentu jej zakończenia.

This castle is currently being moved to a new location. You can't dispatch any market barrows, spies, or soldiers to this castle while it's being relocated. Wait until the process is done and then select the castle in its new position.

You will have to start a new game to switch the game server. Your progress on the current server will not be lost. Rubies, resources, and items will remain on your old account, though you can only switch back to the previous server once you have reached level 2 on the new server. Then you can save your new account and change servers again.
You need to be at least level {0} to collect achievements.
You need to be at least level {0} to find equipment items.
This alliance is no longer open. You'll need the leader's approval before you can join the alliance. Please send the alliance a request to join if you'd like to try again.
You can't join this faction right now.
You've been banished from this alliance. You can't become a member using the automatic join feature. You can send a message to the leader or an officer to ask to be invited to join again, however.
All the market barrows from the selected castle are currently on the move. You will only be able to transport resources again once the market barrows have returned.
The contents of this message are no longer available.
This castle lord is protected from attacks.

If you leave the alliance now, you will no longer be able to benefit from the advantages of the capital. If you're recruiting units that require a capital, their recruitment will be canceled in all your castles and the recruitment costs will be refunded. Are you sure you want to leave this alliance?

If you leave this alliance, the other alliance members will no longer have access to your capital. If other members are recruiting units that require a capital, recruitment will be canceled for all members. Are you sure you want to leave this alliance?
You need at least one soldier stationed in this royal tower to keep control of it. Do you want to withdraw all soldiers and surrender the tower? Note: All tools left in the tower will be lost.

You can't control more than one trading metropolis at the same time. In order to capture this trading metropolis, surrender your current trading metropolis or cancel your ongoing attempt to capture another trading metropolis.
There is already a conquering army on its way to a trading metropolis.

If you remove this member, your alliance will lose their capital. If troops that require a capital are currently being recruited, their recruitment will be canceled and the costs refunded. Are you sure you want to remove this member?

If you leave this alliance, its members will lose access to your capital and you will no longer be able to access capitals belonging to other members. The recruitment of certain soldiers may be canceled. Are you sure you want to leave this alliance?
If you leave this alliance, you will lose the advantages of its trading metropolis. This means you will no longer have a bonus on food production. Are you sure you want to leave this alliance?
If you leave this alliance, its members will lose access to your trading metropolis. This means they will no longer have a bonus on food production. Are you sure you want to leave this alliance?

If you remove this member, your alliance will no longer have access to their trading metropolis. This means your alliance will also no longer have a bonus on food production. Are you sure you want to remove this member?

If you leave this alliance, its members will lose access to your trading metropolis. This means they will no longer have a bonus on food production. You will also lose the bonus from trading metropolises that belong to other castle lords. Are you sure you want to leave this alliance?

Hello!
Since the latest update to Android 5.0, many players have been reporting that they can't load different game apps, can't download updates, and are having problems in the in-game shop.
We are currently working closely with Google to find a solution to these problems as soon as possible. Until then, we recommend that you don't update your operating system.
In general, it's always a good idea to save your account so that problems with your device don't make you lose your progress in the game.
Your Empire: Four Kingdoms Team

We would like to apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced over the last few days.
Thank you for your loyalty! We truly appreciate your support.
Unfortunately, a technical issue has resulted in some troops being lost. The emperor would like to apologize by giving you his strongest soldiers and the food necessary to feed them.

We have unfortunately experienced technical problems that have affected our Apple users in particular. Please accept our apologies.

Palace of the Grand Anniversary Party
A palace built for a party... a perfect setting to celebrate 10 years of the Great Empire.
Keep up with all recent developments and special events by signing up to the Empire newsletter. Confirm the registration via e-mail to receive your reward.
The drill master enjoys forcing the soldiers to train on cold and foggy fall mornings.
The need for a strong defense never hibernates, as not even the cold winter will cool the ambitions of your enemies.
It's often said that the best ways to keep your hands warm during the a winter is to keep them busy building siege tools!
This ghoulish estate provides surprisingly comfortable refuge for those willing to ignore its grotesques facade.
The scholars residing in this monstrosity gaze at the unforgiving stars in search of forbidden knowledge.
The grotesque beasts houses in these stables smell of brimstone and decay, yet are swift as death itself.
Houses the royal guardsmen of the Carnival Prince.
Placed directly over the canal to receive gondolas carrying grain.
"Abandon all hope all ye who enter this bastion of despair." - Dante
Put a spring in your step and unwind in the Great Empire's most eggselent tavern.
Premium relic honey storage build item
Life blooms after the slumber of winter. The time for this year's spring planting has arrived.
Premium relic mead storage build item
Serves chilled cider during muggy summer nights, to make tipsy peasant spill their lords' secrets.
Laughter and upbeat music surround this festive estate. Perfect timing, the celebration has just started.
The Great Empire celebrates its anniversary. No costs were held back to make this a memorable occasion.
The confetti cannons pack quite the punch. Friend and foe alike are invited to celebrate together.
Ice-cold fog surrounds this guardhouse, and cries of pain and cruel laughter can be heard from miles away.
In the bakery, preparations for the holidays are in full swing. A scent of gingerbread and cinnamon lures hungry soldiers in from all over the castle.
These guards proudly bear the colors of King Eric. Better stay out of trouble and not draw their attention.
Follow the rainbows to find those magical stables. Owners can consider themselves as lucky as they can wealthy.
When days get longer nature's spirit awakes again, raising the spirits of the soldiers.
This Drillground is the remark of the Lotus King dynasty, truly magnificent by showing their royal colors.
Wildland Hunter Leo used this structure as a base camp when hunting prey in the Tangled Wilderness.
Wilderness beer contains honey-soaked bark of the greenheart tree for extra sweet flavor.
Rebel Pirate Alyssa expected something different when she was seeking the liquid gold of the jungle.
Grain ships are always an easy target. Alyssa's crew used this improvised mill to process their nourishing loot.
Guards and prisoners alike have a good time celebrating the Empire's anniversary.
Premium relic refinery production build item
Premium relic toolsmith production build item
Cheers to innovation! Here the kegs of knowledge ferment and ideas flow freely.
The nomads cherish the rules of hospitality. Guests feast on fermented mare's milk and juicy yak roast.
While the nomads treat defeated foes with honor, saboteurs, spies, and traitors should not expect any mercy.
"Lantern's soft glow - Samurai's sake flows - Old tales of war."
The Sunrise Kingdoms' dreaded Rōshigumi guard force is known for its relentlessness and brutal efficency.

When days get shorter, strong walls and hot drinks keep out the cold, raising the spirits of the soldiers.

Let's trade beers and compliments between traditional dresses!

Your castellan choked under pressure! This pitiful wretch has abused your trust and failed miserably in his task. What a heavy blow.

A sneaky enemy has actually tried to capture your outpost for himself! Of course the spears of your courageous defenders drove off this pathetic attempt.
Your military genius has been betrayed by the incompetence of your treacherous troops! Consider it a blessing that none of those good-for-nothing fools are left.

Your enemy's troops were crushed at your impregnable walls! Your superior defense has quashed this pathetic attempt to defeat you!

By opening your castle gate, you will let your opponents loot your resources without fighting a battle - this includes the resources in the hideout and the Keep. Buildings can't be damaged and you won't lose any units. Nonetheless, your troops will starve if too much food is stolen, and your buildings are still prone to sabotage attacks.
Prevents damage to buildings and loss of troops.

Protects all your castles and outposts against attacks and prevents them from falling to ruin. Keep in mind that while protection mode is active, you can't attack, recruitment of attack units takes longer, and you can't earn your weekly ranking list reward. These restrictions take effect immediately after your purchase! The protection mode has a lead time of {0} hours. You can't build, upgrade, or move anything within your castle while it's being occupied. In addition, you can't recruit units or produce tools. Send units to smash this foreign occupation!
How do I pay for rubies I buy here in the game?
Payment is made through your iTunes account, like for all other purchases you make with your iPhone/iPad/iPod. Please contact Apple directly if you would like to know more about payment.
I bought rubies (and possibly resource packages), but they aren't being displayed. What happened?
You may need to leave the game and restart it so the rubies (and any resources) you bought are displayed correctly. If that doesn't work, the best thing is to turn off your device and restart it.
My storehouse is already full. If I buy rubies that include resources, will I still get the resources?
Yes, when you get resource packages in addition to your rubies, your storehouse will be filled "beyond capacity" and no resources will be lost.
I bought rubies on my iPhone. Can I use them on my iPad as well (and vice versa)?

Yes, as long as you're using the same account on both devices. To do this, save your account and use your player name and password to log into the game on the other device. Then start the game on the device you want to have your new items on.

The defense of each castle is distributed across the front, the left and right flanks, and the courtyard. An attacker must defeat all the defenders on one section of the castle wall before he can advance to the courtyard. If the attacker also defeats the units in the courtyard, he wins the battle.
When defending, every castle lord can decide how to distribute units across the front and the flanks of his castle. As a result, it's always worth spying on an enemy castle before launching an attack – it may be that one section of the castle wall is protected only by a few units. You should then focus your forces on the area where the defense is weakest!

Attack tools give you priceless advantages in attacks on enemy castles. Scaling ladders reduce the enemy's wall protection and battering rams reduce gate protection.
When attacking, you can use your attack tools and units on the front and on the flanks. Using enough of the right kind of tools will ultimately decide whether you emerge as the victor!
You need a siege workshop to produce attack tools.

Every army that you dispatch needs a commander. You can unlock commanders by building an encampment. The higher the level of the encampment, the more commanders you have at your disposal.
The maximum number of commanders is limited however, so plan your attacks wisely.
The encampment can only be built in your main castle, but the commanders are available in all your castles in every kingdom.

There is always a danger of an attack on your castle! Do the following to make sure you are well-defended: -Seek protection in an alliance! Alliance members can send each other support troops, thus providing easy defense, even against powerful players. -Remember to use defense tools to give your warriors a significant bonus on the castle walls. -When the attacker's troops are near, you can see exactly how the enemy's troops are arranged for the attack and adapt your defense accordingly. The best way to counter melee attackers is with melee defenders, the same goes for ranged attackers. -If you think you're not able to withstand the enemy's troops, you can decide to send your men away temporarily, so that they escape the battle.
Please take pity on us and help us rebuild our village! We only ask for a few resources to repair the worst of the damage. In return, I'll teach you how to make our famous olive oil.

Our village has been attacked and plundered. Please help us to rebuild our huts so that we might have a roof over our heads to make it through the freezing nights. In return, I'll show you how we make our charcoal.

Your agent has failed in his mission! The more city guards your target has, the greater the risk that your agent gets caught. You should deploy more agents to reduce the risk, or reduce your targeted accuracy.
What a catastrophe! Our beautiful village has been reduced to rubble. Please give us some resources to help us rebuild it. In return, I'll reveal to you the secret of our glass-making techniques.

Your enemy has dared to sabotage a building at your castle! The best way to protect yourself against enemy agents that sabotage or spy on your castle is to upgrade your guardhouses or build more of them. The more city guards there are, the harder it will be for enemy agents to spy on you.
Interested in making a trade? All of our olive groves have been destroyed, but we have other items we can offer you.
Since the day everything was taken from us, we've been trying to trade to survive. Offer us some of the charcoal you produce and we'll give you something in return.

To make your start in the game easier, you'll regularly be given useful tips to help you become an even wiser ruler. Read the messages carefully and remember the tips and advice.
Do you have any more questions? You can find the game help under "Settings".
Now that you can produce glass yourself, we'd like to offer our services as trade partners. We know the free mercenaries in these lands and can definitely offer you some good bargains.

Collect coins by sending out your tax collector. The more dwellings you have, the more taxes you will collect. However, don't forget that every dwelling decreases the public order in your castle and therefore the productivity of your resource buildings.
You can also loot coins in attacks on robber baron castles or other castle lords. You'll find plenty of opponents on the world map!

The red and green bar at the top of the screen below the resource display shows the public order in your castle. The higher the public order, the faster your resources are produced, your soldiers recruited, and your tools built.
Public order drops if your buildings are damaged by fire or if you increase your population by building or upgrading dwellings. Decorative items will increase the public order again.

Your soldiers can be split up into attack and defense units as well as melee and ranged soldiers. You should organize your attacking armies and defensive forces accordingly. Attack units will help in defensive battles, but they cause considerably less damage.
Whether you send melee or ranged soldiers into battle depends on the configuration of your enemy's army. For instance, ranged attackers are most effective against a defensive force made up of lots of melee defenders. Your own defense, on the other hand, works best with an even balance of melee and ranged soldiers.
By tapping on its picture in the recruitment menu or the attack screen, you can see if a unit is better suited for attack or defense and if it's more effective against melee or ranged soldiers.

Want some tips for perfect marauding? Keep these steps in mind for a successful attack: - Spy on your target to see the formation of the enemy defenders. - Counter the defense of enemy units. For example, the best way to defeat melee defenders such as spearmen is with ranged attackers. On the other hand, the best way to defeat bowmen is with melee attackers. - Don't forget to use tools. The defender's walls and tools give them a strong combat bonus, but you can reduce it to 0% with the right tools! - Pick the parts of the wall with the weakest defense. Attacking only the flanks can often give you a strategic advantage. - Remember the combat bonus in the courtyard! All the soldiers you did not fight on the walls will be waiting for you outside the Keep. - If you only breach one section of the wall, you lose 30% combat strength for the fight in the courtyard. If you breach two sections of the wall, the fight is balanced. If you breach all three parts of the wall, you earn a 30% bonus for the fight!

You should always build enough woodcutters and stone quarries to ensure you have enough building material. Make sure you also have enough farmhouses. If the food supply in one of your castles runs out, you will lose the soldiers you have there.
But watch out! Only a limited number of resource buildings can run at full workload in each castle. After the limit is reached, every subsequent building runs at a reduced workload. You can see how many buildings can run at full workload in a castle by tapping on the resource bar and opening the "Resources" menu.
By tapping on a building, you can see more detailed information on its productivity. The information is displayed in the bottom left of your screen.
The knights in the surrounding countryside haven't failed to notice your quick rise to power. If you can prove to them that you're truly a mighty castle lord, they will bring you gifts in your honor.
You showed the other knights how it's done! Excellent work! All of these gifts are sure to help you gain more power.

The villainous Captain Redbeard and his unwashed band of pirates have overrun my proud kingdom. Listen to the call of a queen and lend your support in my time of need! Your gallantry will not be for nothing. By defeating the pirates, you will plunder valuable pearls which I will give you rich rewards for.
Collect pearls by conquering the pirates' towers and convoys!
My research is easy to recognize by its golden glow.
Upgrade your fleet so it can sail further out to sea and navigate through the thick fog. You can use either resources or rubies to upgrade.

Victory is yours! Queen Namia has presented you with a valuable reward as a token of her gratitude. You can find it in the storehouse of your main castle. You can leave the event world now, or stay here to complete all of the quests!

Would you like to dismantle your camp and leave the event kingdom? Once you leave you can't return! Your soldiers and resources will be sent back to your castle. You'll keep the pearls you've collected until the next event.
We've heard that you are looking for courageous men to help free this land. I gladly offer you the services of my warriors to defeat this darkness. Of course, it will only cost you a small amount!
No room available in this camp.

My home is overrun with the undead armies of the Necromancer! I beg of you, brave and noble lord, help me in my moment of need! If you support me in my struggle you can plunder valuable talismans which I will pay you handsomely for.
Collect talismans by freeing towers and villagers from the Necromancer's control. You will keep the talismans you earn even after the end of the event.
You don't have enough talismans! Attack more towers and villages in the Thorn King kingdom to plunder more talismans.

Do you want to start the move to this location? Outposts will not move to the new location. The move will take {0}. During this time you can't launch attacks from the castle or send resources. Once begun, a move can't be canceled.
You can enter the event kingdom through the navigation menu.
Contains {0} wood and stone each. The resources will be immediately deposited in this castle's storehouse.

While your attack protection is active, you'll be safe from attacks from other castle lords. However, you'll lose your protection if you attack another castle lord. Attacks on robber baron castles don't affect your attack protection though.

Earn honor by winning battles against other castle lords! You can win different rewards according to your place in the honor rankings.
You can collect a reward each week according to your place in the honor rankings! The higher your rank, the bigger the reward will be. The best players can even get extra powerful units!
Your pursuit of honor is praiseworthy. Your weekly rankings reward is now ready for collection!

The empire is under attack! Nomad armies are terrorizing our people and settling camps throughout our lands. It's time to strike back against these invaders and capture their precious Khan tablets!
Defeat nomad camps to earn Khan tablets. Your looted Khan tablets will also earn you Khan points that count towards your individual score.
You can't attack this nomad camp at the moment.
Your troops couldn't fight because the target has currently blocked all attacks. You can attack once the block is lifted.
Would you like to skip the waiting time and attack again?
The morale of your troops affects their combat strength. The more tents you have in your camp, the more morale goes down. Build plenty of decorative items to raise morale again!
So I hear you're having trouble with those wretched nomads? Fear not, brave lord! These tools were designed especially for attacking nomad camps and will bring even the mightiest horde to its knees!
These tools will crush nomad camps. They can't be used against other castles, however.
Travelers from the Far East have established camps throughout the land and are threatening the entire empire!
Fight back the onslaught of nomads and attack their camps!
Defeat the camps to find khan tablets which you can trade with the herald.
Unfortunately you don't have enough rubies. Do you want to buy some more?
Use food or rubies to hold a feast for your citizens! Soldiers will be recruited much more quickly in all of your castles for as long as the feast lasts. The bigger the feast, the greater the effect.

Alliance commander. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Responsible for finances. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Manages relations with other alliances. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Recruits and trains new members. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Right hand of the leader. Can award the rank of general, change the alliance description, assign ranks to members, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Head of the alliance. Can appoint a new leader, award the rank of general, change the alliance description, assign ranks to members, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

On your adventure, you'll have to overcome a variety of obstacles and fight highwaymen. But it will all be worth it when you find the lost treasure at the end. You look like a true adventurer to me! I'm looking for a fearless castle lord to join me on a treacherous expedition into a long-lost underground kingdom. Ancient secrets and precious treasure lie in store. We will write history together!

On my many expeditions I have found myself in all manner of situations. That's why I always make sure I have the right tools to hand. For a few runestones or some rune gold you can help yourself to my collection as you please.

Every month all the monuments will be moved to new places on the world map and reset to their original level. Once they have been relocated, the monuments will be controlled by robber barons again. When a monument is reset, the troops stationed there will return to the castle which they originally came from. Market barrows which were on their way to the monument will automatically turn around once they reach the previous location of the monument.
The enemy troops proved superior! Your men retreated without a fight and suffered no losses. Make sure that the army you send has more combat strength than the enemy defenders.

The attacking army took to their heels and fled before a battle could take place. Neither side had to bear any losses. Keep this up and make sure you always have enough defensive units and tools in your castles.

Your military hospital is full! Your doctors now have to decide which of the wounded they will still admit.
Whenever this happens, stronger units take priority. However, no distinction is made between ranged and melee soldiers or attackers and defenders. For example, spearmen and bowmen count as equal, but the more valuable two-handed swordsman takes priority over both of them. The same rule also applies for weaker units who are already in the military hospital. They will automatically be discharged and then succumb to their wounds if more valuable soldiers need to be admitted.
Treat your wounded as fast as possible to prevent your doctors from having to discharge brave soldiers. As soon as the soldiers are in line for treatment, they no longer require space in the military hospital and therefore open up room for the wounded from the next battle. Wounded units in line for treatment are never discharged automatically: they don't leave until treatment is complete.
Lastly, don't forget to upgrade your military hospital! This lets you increase both how much space you have for the wounded and the number of slots available for soldiers in line for treatment.

We take the security of your account very seriously. Therefore we have a few tips and suggestions to help you protect your account even better:
- Don't give your password to anyone else. They could use it to log on to your account without your knowledge.
- Choose a password which is hard to guess to make it more difficult for someone else to access your account. For this reason, using your player name as your password is just as unadvisable as using "123456" or "password".
- If you feel at any time that your password is not secure, you can easily change it. First tap on "Settings" at the top right of the screen. Then tap on "Options" and finally the silver key.
- If you visit a questionable website or download software of suspicious origin, programs which spy on your passwords are sometimes installed onto your computer without your knowledge. Therefore it's best to avoid sketchy websites and offers claiming to give you cheats, hacks, and free rubies.

Public order influences resource production and the time it takes to recruit and heal your troops.
Decorative items make your citizens happier and thus increase the public order.
Strong walls and towers offer your citizens safety and increase the public order.
Residential buildings increase the population and thus decrease the public order.
Unrest and fire damage significantly decrease public order.

Always keep public order as high as possible! The happier your citizens are, the higher your public order. That makes your resource production buildings work more efficiently, and it has a positive impact on the time it takes to recruit and heal your troops. Fire damage and a high population have the opposite effect.

Resource production is a cornerstone of your power. You need wood and stone to build, upgrade, and repair buildings after an attack. Your food production is particularly important. Your troops need rations so that they can stay strong in battle, lead your attacks, and defend your castle. If your food production no longer meets the demands of your troops, you will lose your troops, and you will be left unprotected against other castle lords.

The kingdom of Everwinter Glacier is overrun with eternal ice and the axes of lawless barbarian warriors. But it's also home to a rare and valuable resource - charcoal. If you dare to brave the frost and barbarians, you will enter a land of glory, honor, and riches. Don your armor and seize the chance!

The kingdom of Burning Sands will put your skills to the test! The deadly heat and brutal desert warriors will fight you tooth and nail. But all the blood and sweat can be worth it in the end. Valuable olive oil and a name that will send your enemies running are yours to fight for in this sandy wasteland!

The kingdom of Fire Peaks can instill fear in even the bravest of warriors. Volcanoes and evil dragon cultists will try to take your life at every chance. But if you summon all your courage, you can find glass, a rare and precious resource, and fight countless battles on your way to becoming a living legend!

The nomad invasion is a time-limited event in which you and your alliance must fight against specific nomad camps on the world map. If you defeat them, you will loot Khan tablets and the camp will go up one level. You can use Khan tablets to buy special decorative items and equipment items from the Herald of the Invasion. You will also earn one Khan point per looted Khan tablet. This point counts toward both your individual score and alliance score. The more points you collect, the more valuable the rewards you can unlock. Even more prizes will come your way if you count among the most successful castle lords or alliances at the end of the event.
You can keep your Khan tablets after the end of the event, but your Khan points will expire.

A banished king is asking you for help! Rush to the icy North to halt the invasion of the cruel Norsemen. Build a camp in the snow and ice, fight against the barbaric hordes, free the land, and collect the treasure! But beware: even greater dangers are lurking deep in the ice...

Build some stables and equip your armies with horses!
You can use these powerful warhorses to launch quick attacks on enemies even if they're far away!
But beware! The villainous robber barons are again venturing out to attack any unsuspecting castle lords!
Fight honorable battles against other players to gain glory points. Glory points allow you to unlock more titles and rewards.

Closed beta has ended! All the castles have been reset, and we'll start seeing some real action!
But don't worry, we have credited you with all the rubies you previously purchased and there also is a bonus to thank all the brave beta testers.

Have you researched everything? The new research provides improvements to high-level players!

Empire: Four Kingdoms
Prepare for battle! Construct fortresses to last for eternity, capture outposts and establish a flourishing economy. Send out your armies to reduce the castles of enemy players to rubble. Build your mighty empire and compete with thousands of other players. Play now in the huge and visually unique world of Empire: Four Kingdoms!
ON YOUR SMARTPHONE OR TABLET!
EMPIRE: FOUR KINGDOMS OFFERS: ● Endless gaming fun for free ● Fantastic high-res graphics ● Castle upgrades to make it an impregnable fortress ● Economy with different resources ● Diplomacy and war to achieve your goals ● Alliances with friends ● Strategic battles with loads of units and weapons ● Exciting adventures to increase your wealth and glory ● Four different kingdoms for exploring ● Regular challenging events
The world's foundations will tremble and quake. Arm yourselves for the arrival of the foreign empire!
Collect rare gems and improve your equipment items with powerful effects!
Connect to Facebook now and join forces with your friends!
Connect to Facebook to invite your friends to the game. You'll be rewarded when they reach certain levels! The more friends you invite, the bigger the rewards you can expect!

Conquer robber baron castles to find pieces of the map. When you have collected all the pieces, you can enter the map and set off on a hunt for lost treasure. At the end of your journey, you'll receive a valuable decorative item for your castle!

Once upon a time, Prince Percival was to be the new king of the land. But he was arrogant and unpopular with the people. He mocked his citizens and said they should crown a pig instead of him so they would then be ruled by one of their own kind. To the little prince's great astonishment, the people took him at his word and soon afterwards, King Snout, the first of his name, was crowned the new king of the realm! He reigned over the people for six happy and peaceful years, and is still honored today in some circles as the greatest ruler of all time.

Once upon a time, Sir Bruno's life was spared when an arrow aimed at his heart landed and stuck in this noble knight's waving banner. On that day, Sir Bruno announced that he no longer needed to squeeze into a metal suit because his luck alone would protect him! He threw out his armor and rode into battle armed only with his lucky banner. He became famed throughout the land for his extraordinary courage. Even though a well-aimed crossbow bolt soon brought an abrupt end to his run of luck, his banner has ever since remained a symbol for the fine line between bravery and stupidity.
The Banner of Sir Bruno the Lucky

When the kingdom was first founded and wars plagued the land, King Richard I laid siege to Marktburg. When the moment finally came for the decisive assault on the castle, the good king took pity on the innocent citizens, and the women and children were allowed to leave the castle carrying whatever they could hold. But when the women filed out of the castle the next morning, they carried neither supplies nor treasured possessions: instead, they bore their husbands on their backs. King Richard laughed, and kept his royal promise. Thus the siege of Marktburg ended with no blood being shed.

Once a great king commissioned an artist to make him a valuable globe made from leather, gold, and jewels, and showing each of the three continents. The artist did as the king commanded, and filled the inside of the leather globe with water. Sadly, as it was being transported, the globe rolled off the coach and broke. The coachman, fearing punishment, decided to say nothing and deliver the globe in its new, flat shape. The king liked this flat earth so much that he quickly decreed that the whole kingdom should now see the world this way.

Back in the day, chivalrous tournaments always featured a farmer made to fight for the amusement of the king and nobles. The chosen farmer would be dressed up in armor and then given a thorough beating. At one tournament, however, a farmer named Ruppich could not be subdued. He slashed about so wildly that even the most renowned knights in the kingdom took to their heels. The king was impressed and asked to see this simple man. "What is the secret of your fighting, good man?" he asked. "My king," the farmer answered, "the secret of my fighting is a wasp under my armor."

Felix, the famous bandit captain, once came upon a farm where he saw a farmer's wife crying bitterly. "What grieves you so, milady?" he asked. Sobbing, she replied, "I cannot pay my taxes, and the Count will soon be here to take away my farm!" Felix slipped a pouch of gold into the woman's hands and vanished. The Count was shocked that the farmer's wife could now pay and the farm would remain hers! He left in a fury. His wrath only increased further when he was ambushed by bandits on his way home. And that's how the farmer's wife kept her farm and the bandit kept his gold!

Ancient secrets and precious artifacts are hidden in the endless ice of the North, simply waiting to be found by daring adventurers like you. Travel to the kingdom of Everwinter Glacier, defeat the barbarians' towers, and loot pieces of their treasure maps! Once you've gathered all the pieces of a map, you can send your troops on a treasure hunt.

Once upon a time, a hunter named Yolo tried to catch a snow panther. To entice the beast, he disguised himself as a glacier hen, but when he imitated the bird's mating call, a love-struck rooster appeared and tried to force itself on him. The bird's advances were so insistent that Yolo was forced to flee. As he ran he collided with a snow panther, who would have promptly devoured him but for the rooster, who came to Yolo's rescue and pecked the panther into submission with its sharp beak. And thus began the story of Yolo and his loyal battle rooster Ono, who went on to have many an exciting adventure together.

A group of villagers hiking over a glacier once found a man frozen in a crevice who seemed to have been there for many years. They carved him out of the ice and took him to their village, where he slowly thawed out. The man turned out to be a bard, and he sang them a song in gratitude. At first the villagers were flattered, but then the bard did not stop singing! For days he crooned one song after another. Eventually they became so tired of his voice that they threw him back into the crevice. To this day he is still there, waiting for someone to free him so he can finally sing again.

Once upon a time, a group of adventurers set out to find the legendary scorpion amulet. After weeks of searching, they discovered it in an abandoned temple. But when they picked it up, a horde of scorpions swarmed out of the ground and attacked them. Only one man made it out alive. Suddenly he came face to face with a band of robbers who had been waiting for him! It seemed like the man's sorry fate was sealed, yet as he clutched the amulet close to his chest, he saw the sand beneath his enemies' feet transform into millions of poisonous scorpions. The robbers had no chance. This lonely warrior was known from that day on as the King of the Scorpions.

Unfortunately even a great lord can't live in his castle for free.
And that's where I come in! I have certain ways of motivating your subjects to pay their taxes.

Here you are at last. Welcome to my castle, old friend!
There is a great deal to be done before we can launch the massive attack!
Loyal friend, at last you've arrived. Your bravery has won you a knighthood and your very own castle. Please allow me to act as your counsel during your first steps as a castle lord.

You won!
You have been made a knight for your brave actions, and have been named lord of your own castle.
Select the building and place it in the castle.

The castle of the king's murderer is right in front of us.
Tap on the castle.
Your castle is now ready to defend itself against enemies!
Place the hurling rocks by tapping the slider and specifying the number.
Your soldiers will be deployed along three sides of the castle wall.
The defense rocks will automatically be used in the event of an attack.

Now we're ready to organize our defense.
Open the military menu!
This is the robber baron castle. Select it to attack!
There are robber baron castles everywhere just waiting to be attacked! You can also go to other players' castles.
The battle is over! Have a look at the battle report.
Move your fighters to the frontal attack.
I'll take the flanks. You attack the front!

Let's plan the attack.
We can attack the traitor from three sides!

Our troops need barracks.
Open the build menu!

You can recruit soldiers in the barracks.
Open the military menu and select "Recruit" at the bottom.

Train a spearman.
Select the soldier.
Tap the woodcutter and place it in the castle.

You need wood and stone to construct buildings.
Create a woodcutter.
You can find production buildings in the civil buildings tab.

It is now time to build your castle!
I have some new assignments for you.
Our forces are en route for the enemy.
Our troops are crushing the enemy!
I'll head off now and return in 30 minutes with the taxes I've collected!
It's time to take care of defending our castle.

Now we are ready for the battle!
Tap on the globe and enter the world map.
Confirm the upgrade in this window.
Select the unit slot to deploy your soldiers!
Use the slider to determine the number of soldiers.
Your soldiers have been posted, now confirm their formation.
Here you can see your travel details. Now let's fight!
Move the woodcutter to the indicated position.
Now build a stone quarry. To do so, select the hammer and place the stone quarry in your castle.
Move the stone quarry to a free position until the building area turns green.

Expand the castle wall to get more room for buildings and new tower bases too.
This option is in the build menu.
Select the top expansion to enlarge your castle!
Select the barracks to place them in your castle!

Training soldiers takes time.
Wait until the recruitment has been completed, then return to your castle!
You can pick up your taxes in 30 minutes!

Now you're ready to defend your castle against attacks.
Go to the military menu and select the option to produce tools!
Tap on the hammer button to start producing hurling rocks!
Production will take a while. You'll be able to use the rocks later when defending your castle.
Select the part of the wall where you want to put the defense!

Soon your enemies will want to know who they are dealing with.
You should give yourself a name.
Now select Attack from the menu to continue your planning.

Now confirm the position.
You can relocate the building at any time.

I know a good shortcut that'll get you to the purpose of your quests more quickly.
Just tap on the task!
Tap on the task to donate resources or coins. That completes the task and immediately gives you your reward.
Now return to your castle and tell your people of your victorious battle.
Now let’s begin to quarry stone – you can find the stone quarry in the build menu.
You need resources to upgrade your castle. Start by building a woodcutter to produce wood.

No more space in your castle? Just open the "Expansion" tab in the build menu! Here you can easily expand the size of your castle.
Not enough? You could also try rearranging your buildings.
You can return to your castle while soldiers are being recruited.
You have laid the foundation for your castle's growth, my lord. From now on, quests will be available in the quest book.

Expand the castle wall to get more room for buildings and new tower bases too.
This option is in the build menu.
Select the top expansion to enlarge your castle.
Select the top expansion to enlarge your castle.

Defeat robber barons of at least level {0}

Defeat desert towers of at least level {0}
Defeat desert towers! The higher the level of the desert warriors, the more nobility points you'll receive for defeating them.
Defeat barbarian towers of at least level {0}

Cause fire damage to your opponents with your attacks! Fires started with sabotage missions will not be taken into account.
Collect glory points in battles against other castle lords. The bigger the battle, the more glory points you'll receive.
Use the barracks to recruit units with a minimum amount of attack power! Units granted as rewards also count towards your points for this event.
Defeat as many castle lords as possible for the Shady Lady!

Alliance members can request help from one another. For the help request to succeed, only a few alliance members have to tap on the help button. Support your comrades wherever you can to make sure your alliance is always one step ahead!
Tap on this button to ask your alliance for help with recruitment. You'll get an extra unit if enough members help you!
Tap on this button to double the number of units recruited. This will cost you rubies.
Join an alliance to help you recruit units. You can then offer help to your allies as well.

You can see your alliance bookmarks at any time using the list in the alliance menu. Here you can give your target a name and specify whether it should be bookmarked as free to attack, in need of support, or for a coordinated attack.

Fight for the faction of the Bear!

You are fighting under the banner of the House of Ursidae in the Battle for Berimond. The old warhorse Grimbert of Ursidae is a friend of the common people and known as the "Bear of Berimond" by his soldiers. They love him when he calls:
"When the Bear growls, the earth shudders!"
Fight for the faction of the Lion!
You are fighting under the banner of the House of Gerbrandt in the Battle for Berimond. Leopold III is a skilled commander and his citizens consider him a just and generous leader. His motto:
"Follow the Lion into battle and there will be loot for all!"
This target is already being attacked by another castle lord! If his troops arrive before yours and win the battle, your army will be forced to return empty-handed.
Do you want to launch your attack anyway?

Supplies are being sent from your home as a token of gratitude for your loyal service in the Battle for Berimond. The units are already waiting at your main camp in Berimond. Continue to fight bravely and more supplies will be sent your way.
Your faction has won the battle for Berimond! King Leopold III has assumed the throne and will reward you royally for your loyal services. Long live the King!

Your faction's lost the Battle for Berimond, and Grimbert of Ursidae has been driven into exile! Do not give up hope, the day for revenge will come!

You have no free living quarters in your camp. Build more tents to create enough room for more soldiers!
Your camp was captured! If the enemy has captured all of your camps, you will need to start over with a new camp.

You've lost your camp in the Battle for Berimond! Now it's up to your brothers in arms to win this war. You can continue to visit the kingdom and follow the battle's progress, but you can't take part in it anymore.
The Battle for Berimond is coming to an end, and all participating castle lords are being evaluated on their performance. If you have troops deployed there, they will soon return to your main castle.
Protects your camp against attacks in the event kingdom
Protects your camp from being attacked by the enemy in the kingdom of Berimond event. Protection mode has a lead time of {0} hours and can't be reactivated for {1} days after it has been used.

Win gallantry points by looting and capturing camps, capturing villages, destroying towers, and defeating the capital. Once the Battle for Berimond is over, the castle lords with the most points will receive valuable prizes. Earn only 200 gallantry points to be guaranteed a prize!

Your faction's won the Battle for Berimond! King Leopold III has ascended to the throne! Unfortunately you have not collected enough points to earn a reward. Show some more commitment next time and you won't come away empty-handed.

Your faction's won the Battle for Berimond! King Grimbert of Ursidae has ascended to the throne! Unfortunately you have not collected enough points to earn a reward. Show some more commitment next time and you won't come away empty-handed.

Your enemies have driven you further and further back in the battle for Berimond! Unless you do something, all hope of victory is lost. Your faction is launching a final counter-attack. Gather your troops and force the enemy back!

Foreign castles are invaders from another realm. The castle lords of these invaders are known to be aggressive, so make sure your armies are prepared for the battles ahead. You will receive rewards for the glory you earn in battles against these foreign castle lords.

You can receive glory points for honorable battles against foreign castle lords. If you collect a certain number of glory points, you will receive rewards either immediately or at the end of the event.
The foreign empire has been driven out of our world. You collected {0} glory points in battle.
You collected {0} glory points in battle against the foreign empire. You will receive a valuable reward for your heroism!
You collected {0} glory points in battle against the foreign empire. You are the castle lord with the most glory points, and will receive a unique reward!
You collected {0} glory points in battle against the foreign empire. You were among the {1} castle lords with the most glory, and will be richly rewarded!
Look for a foreign castle lord to attack

A grave danger is upon us! All over the Great Empire, sinister powers have opened up gateways to other worlds! Castle lords from another empire are invading our realm! Gather your armies and drive back the armies of the foreign empire!
You cannot acquire any honor in this battle
Your useless agent failed in his mission and couldn't spy on the target! At least the incompetent dolt managed to get away - your enemy doesn't know that you tried to spy on them.

Robber baron castles are enemy sites on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. The more often you defeat a robber baron castle, the higher its level gets, along with the amount of resources and the quality of the items you can loot. The levels increase only for you, not for other castle lords. From time to time, robber barons attack your castles as well.

Outposts are castles where you can construct buildings, recruit units, and collect resources. Unlike main castles, there are only two different resources in outposts.
This outpost currently belongs to someone, but you can capture it with a castellan. If the attack is successful, you will occupy the outpost for a certain time, but the owner can try to drive you out again. If you withstand their attacks, you become the new owner of the outpost.

Outposts are castles where you can construct buildings, recruit units, and collect resources. Unlike main castles, there are only two different resources in outposts.
This outpost belongs to no one and can be captured with the help of a castellan. If you are successful, the outpost will be yours. But beware! Other castle lords can attack it and then take control of it if they occupy it for a certain time.

Capitals are special places on the world map that you can capture. Just like with other castles, they can be used to construct buildings, recruit units, and collect resources. Each castle lord can only own one capital.
The palace is a unique building that unlocks very powerful units in the barracks of every member of your alliance. These units are different depending on the kingdom.

Trading metropolises are a special kind of place on the world map that you can capture. Like other castles, here you can construct buildings, recruit units, and collect resources. Each castle lord can only own one trading metropolis.
The emporium is a unique building that gives your alliance a food production bonus. The higher the level of the emporium, the bigger the production bonus for the alliance. This bonus only applies to the kingdom that the trading metropolis is in however.

Royal towers are a special kind of place on the world map that you can capture. Unlike castles, you can station units here, but you can't construct any buildings. Royal towers give your alliance a combat bonus when attacking capitals and trading metropolises.

Ruins are castles that have been left behind by castle lords who haven't been online for a long time. If the castle lord doesn't return to their castle in time to build up the ruins again, it will disappear completely from the world map.

Shadow camps are the shadow mercenaries' quarters and can only be seen on the world map for a short time. Shadow attacks start here so that the attacked castle lord can't see who dispatched the soldiers.

Barbarian towers are enemy sites on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. The more often you defeat a barbarian tower, the higher its level gets, along with the amount of resources and the quality of the items you can loot. The levels increase only for you, not for other castle lords. Unlike the robber baron castles, barbarian towers won't attack you.

Desert towers are enemy sites on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. The more often you defeat a desert tower, the higher its level gets, along with the amount of resources and the quality of the items you can loot. The levels increase only for you, not for other castle lords. Unlike the robber baron castles, desert towers won't attack you.

Cultists' towers are enemy sites on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. The more often you defeat a cultists' tower, the higher its level gets, along with the amount of resources and the quality of the items you can loot. The levels increase only for you, not for other castle lords. Unlike the robber baron castles, cultists' towers won't attack you.
You can only see a robber baron fortress when the spy advises you to defeat the robber baron king. It disappears again once you attack it successfully or when the event time runs out.

Barbarian fortresses are enemy sites on the worldmap. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. Once a barbarian fortress is defeated, no castle lord may attack it again for a certain time. From time to time, the barbarians in the fortresses go on a raid themselves and attack you!

Desert fortresses are enemy sites on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. Once a desert fortress is defeated, no castle lord may attack it again for a certain time. From time to time, the desert warriors in the fortresses go on a raid themselves and attack you!

Dragons are enemies on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. Once a dragon is defeated, no castle lord may attack it again for a certain time. From time to time, the cultists who guard the dragons go on a raid themselves and attack you!

In the Berimond kingdom, watchtowers block your path to the enemy capital and to the surrounding villages. They need to be attacked and defeated several times to be destroyed for good. A watchtower can only be attacked by one castle lord at a time.

Villages in the kingdom of Berimond give you a production bonus on all resources. But they can't be attacked until their watchtower has been destroyed. Once a village is captured, the new owner's entire faction receives the production bonus from it. You can't construct buildings in a captured village, but you can support them with your units.

Capitals are the centers of power for the two warring houses in the kingdom of Berimond. They can't be attacked until all towers belonging to the relevant faction are destroyed. If a house's capital falls, the camps of the castle lords of that house can be destroyed. Then the faction can be driven out of Berimond for good.

Nomad camps are enemy sites on the world map that appear during a nomad invasion. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and khan tablets. For the duration of the event, you can go to the Herald of the Invasion in front of your castle to trade in your tablets for valuable rewards.
The campaign camp is your base in the event kingdom. Use it to recruit troops for battle and construct special kinds of buildings that can't be found in your castles.

Towers block your path through the land of the Thorn King. They need to be conquered before you can fight your way further through the kingdom. After a tower is defeated, you can plunder the villages surrounding it. Look at a tower's level to see how heavily fortified it is.

When you attack villages in the realm of the Thorn King, you'll get resources as loot. But you can't occupy them permanently. They also can't be attacked until you capture their tower. Once you've defeated a village, you have to wait awhile until you can attack it again. Look at a village's level to see how heavily fortified it is.
The Necromancer's castle is the seat of Obitus the Necromancer. Capture the castle and drive out Obitus to free the Thorn King's realm.

These cows have had enough of dairy farming, so they've rebelled against their owners and founded their own kingdom. Lately it's been rumored that terrible atrocities take place behind their castle walls - it's said that now the farmers must toil for their animals, feed them fresh grass all day long, and muck out their stalls. Stay far away from this place of madness or you might also end up with a shovel in your hand and manure at your feet!

Towers block your path through the Blade Coast. They need to be conquered before you can fight your way further through the kingdom. Once a tower is defeated, you can plunder the pirate convoys surrounding it. Look at a tower's level to see how heavily fortified it is.

Towers block your path through the Blade Coast. They need to be conquered before you can fight your way further through the kingdom. But the fog by this tower is too thick to risk an attack right now. To navigate further through the fog, go to your expedition camp and upgrade your ship to a higher level.

When you attack a pirate convoy on the Blade Coast, you'll get resources as loot. But you can't attack them until you capture their tower. Once you defeat a pirate convoy, you'll have to wait a certain time until you can plunder it again. You can see how well a pirate convoy is defended by looking at its level.
Sinister shadows are moving through the cloudy mist. What kind of monstrous secret is Captain Redbeard hiding from your eyes?

Towers block your path through the Underworld. They need to be conquered before you can fight your way further through the kingdom. When a tower is defeated, you can plunder the resource lairs surrounding it. Look at a tower's level to see how heavily fortified it is.

When you attack resource lairs in the Underworld, you'll get resources as loot. But you can't attack them until you capture their tower. Once you defeat a resource lair, you'll have to wait awhile until you can plunder it again. You can see how well a resource lair is defended by looking at its level.

A castle lord's main castle is the center of their power. You can construct different kinds of buildings and upgrade them to higher levels here. You can attack and loot the main castles of your enemies, but you can never capture them. This means a castle lord can never lose control of their home.

Villages give you a production bonus for a particular resource. They can't be found in the Great Empire, but they exist in the other kingdoms. You can't construct buildings in a captured village, but you can station your units there.
The cave castle was once the center of the Underworld and is now in the hands of the fiends. Capture the castle and drive out these villains to free the Underworld.
List of bookmarked places is full

Camps are the bases for castle lords who fight in the Battle for Berimond. Special kinds of buildings that only exist in the event kingdom can be built here. Each castle lord has one camp. As long as the faction's capital city still stands, the camp of a castle lord cannot be destroyed. If the castle lord loses their last camp and the capital city has already fallen, the castle lord has to leave Berimond.

Foreign castles appear on the world map during the War of the Realms and belong to castle lords from another dimension. You can spy on them and attack them, to gain glory and win rewards in the War of the Realms event. After the event started, you have to choose a difficulty level before attacking a foreign castle. During the event, you can use the dethrone function to exile a foreign castle lord or to fortify their castle.
The kraken is the beloved pet of Captain Redbeard and the terror of the seven seas. Set the Blade Coast free by defeating this monster and driving out the pirates!

Outposts are castles where you can construct buildings, recruit units, and collect resources. Unlike main castles, there are only two different resources in outposts.
You currently own this outpost. But beware! The outpost can be captured by other castle lords if they can successfully occupy it for a certain period.

Laboratories are centers of power that can be captured. They give the owner and the owner's alliance a bonus on the production of a certain resource. Laboratories can be upgraded and captured by other players.

Well then, castle lord? Do you feel up to a real challenge? East of the empire are the Storm Islands, my home. This is the only place in the world where you can find aquamarine, a highly prized precious stone. The nobles will gladly reward the alliances that collect the most aquamarine before the moon storm lays waste to the islands. Travel to the Storms realm now and rise to the challenge!

Once again, the moon storm has swept through the Storm Islands with ferocious power and laid waste to the bases of all the castle lords! However, every disaster brings the possibility of a new beginning. Return to the Realm of the Storms with your alliance, plunder precious aquamarine, and become the new Storm Lord!

You can find aquamarine on the Storm Islands. But beware! The moon storm regularly washes everything away. Build cargo ships in time to protect your aquamarine so you can give it to the nobles for rewards.
Well then, castle lord, did you get a big haul? I will happily trade you some valuable rewards for your aquamarine – with no waiting time and for a decent price of course!
Island warfare is fiendish, but my tools will give you the upper hand. They only cost a little.
You've successfully occupied a resource island! What would you like to call your new island?

What glorious news! Storm Lord {0} has given you the honorable title of "{1}"! This special title will be displayed instead of your customary one. The effect of your normal title will remain, however.

This calls for revenge! Storm Lord {0} has given you the dishonorable title of "{1}"! This disgraceful title will be displayed instead of your customary one. The effect of your normal title will remain, however.
Storm Lord {0} has stripped you of the title of "{1}". As a result, you lose all of its positive or negative effects.

Storm Lord {0} has left your alliance and you've lost your title of "{1}" as a result. Only castle lords in the same alliance as the Storm Lord can bear honorable titles. This means you've also lost all the positive effects from the title.
Since you're no longer a member of the same alliance as Storm Lord {0}, your honorable title of "{1}" has been revoked.
Welcome to the Storm Islands! Adventures and treasures are coming your way!
Become the Storm Lord, the King of the Storm Islands
Aquamarine can be collected by plundering resource islands, by attacking the fortresses of the Storm natives, or by battling other castle lords.
The leader of the top alliance will be named Storm Lord, the new ruler of the Storm Islands.
The Storm Lord can award special titles to other castle lords. The titles can have either positive or negative effects for the lords who bear them.

The Storm Lord can award special titles to other castle lords. These titles cannot be awarded to more than one castle lord at the same time. Furthermore, no castle lord can hold more than one title at the same time.

The victorious alliance's leader earns the unique title of Storm Lord and earns the right to award other special titles.

Plunder resource islands to get your hands on a variety of resources. You can do this by occupying the islands for a certain time and defending them against enemies. If you hold the island until the end of the occupation time, the island will sink and you will receive all of the resources available there.

Storm forts are islands where the hostile Storm natives live. The storm forts protect valuable resources that you can loot. Keep in mind, however, that these islands will sink into the sea after a certain number of attacks, as they are constantly being buffeted by storms.
Travel to the Storm Islands and build cargo ships before the moon storm hits. This will earn you cargo points and win your alliance countless rewards.

The moon storm has ravaged the Storm Islands once more! Among the alliances that collected aquamarine, the castle lord {0} has been named the new Storm Lord. The new Storm Lord will award all titles anew. You will therefore lose your current title and all its positive or negative effects.

The great moon storm has roared and raged and violent floods have swept through the Storm Islands. Unfortunately your alliance wasn't able to collect the most cargo points this time! Castle lord {0} from the alliance {1} has been named the new Storm Lord. As a result, you've lost your title and all the privileges associated with it.
Set sail to the kingdom and earn rewards for your alliance!
Join the event and receive these rewards!
Alliance members who travel to the Storm Islands can earn fantastic rewards!
Your alliance is currently eligible for these rewards
Collect more cargo points to earn these rewards
The alliance leader will be declared Storm Lord and can then award special titles to other castle lords.
Keep in mind that storm forts will sink after a certain number of attacks and won't emerge again for a while.
Resource islands have to be occupied and defended for a certain time. If the occupation is successful, you will receive all the wood, stone, or aquamarine available there and the island will sink.
Build cargo ships to protect your aquamarine from the moon storm. This will help your alliance to earn cargo points and move up in the monthly rankings.

The more cargo points your alliance has collected by the time the moon storm hits, the better the rewards you will receive.
Castle lords who are not in alliances won't receive any rewards after the storm, but they can profit from quests and Luna's trade boat.
You can either collect aquamarine or swap it for useful items and tools on Luna Stormrider's trade boat.

Victory! Your alliance has collected the most aquamarine and every member has been rewarded. Your leader has even been named Storm Lord and can now award titles with positive or negative effects.

Victory! Your alliance has collected the most aquamarine. As the triumphant leader, you have been named the new Storm Lord and can now award titles with positive or negative effects. Honor or shame - the power lies in your hands.

Head of the alliance. Can appoint a new leader, award the rank of general, change the alliance description, assign ranks to members, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Right hand of the leader. Can award the rank of general, change the alliance description, assign ranks to members, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Alliance commander. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Responsible for finances. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Manages relations with other alliances. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Recruits and trains new members. Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.

Can change the alliance description, assign the ranks sergeant and member, invite castle lords, expel members, make announcements, write mass messages, create alliance bookmarks, upgrade the alliance, and engage in alliance diplomacy.
Can invite castle lords, expel members, promote novices to members, make announcements, write mass messages, and create alliance bookmarks.
Basic member with no special administrative rights. Can send mass messages and create alliance bookmarks.

A new alliance comrade who is still in their probationary period. No special administrative rights. Can send mass messages and create alliance bookmarks. A novice will be automatically removed from the alliance if their castle turns to ruins.

Double your rubies! Every upgrade reduces the waiting time until your wishes come true.

The wishing well lets you double your rubies! You need a certain number of rubies and a lucky penny to start the process. Once you've put the doubling process into motion, you will have to wait a short while until you can collect your new rubies.
However, you can also collect your rubies before the waiting time has ended by using rubies to complete the process instantly. Nonetheless, you will never pay more rubies than you receive at the end. This means you will never have to worry about losing rubies by using this well.
You will also be able to upgrade the wishing well to shorten the waiting time further.
If you run out of lucky pennies, you can buy more during certain special offers.

Dear players,
We thoroughly looked into the problems that some of you have recently experienced with Empire: Four Kingdoms after updating your devices to iOS 9. Today we have some really great news for you! Our technicians came up with a solution that allows you to update without trouble now. Hopefully this hasn't caused too much inconvenience. However, we will do our best to avoid future issues of this kind.
Your Empire: Four Kingdoms Team

Dear players,
We asked the technicians at Apple to thoroughly look into the problems that some of you have recently experienced with Empire: Four Kingdoms after updating your devices to iOS 9. Today we have some really great news for you! These guys came up with a solution that allows you to update without trouble now. Hopefully this hasn't caused too much inconvenience. However, Apple assured us that they will do their best to avoid future issues of this kind.
Your Empire: Four Kingdoms Team

Dear players,
We have thoroughly looked into the problems that some of you have been experiencing in Empire: Four Kingdoms for the past few weeks after you updated your devices to iOS 9. Today we have really great news for you! Our technicians worked with Adobe and Apple to come up with a solution that should significantly improve your gaming experience on iOS 9. We apologize for any inconvenience this has caused, and we will do our best to avoid any future issues of this kind.
Your Empire: Four Kingdoms Team
You've captured a royal tower! Each royal tower gives you and your alliance an attack bonus when attacking capitals and trading metropolises.
Resource villages give you a production bonus on a particular resource. You can't construct buildings in a captured resource village, but you can station your units there.
Resource islands have to be occupied and defended for a certain time. If the occupation is successful, you will receive all the wood, stone, or aquamarine available there and the island will sink.

Samurai camps are enemy targets on the world map that appear during a samurai invasion. You can attack samurai camps to loot resources, equipment items, and samurai tokens. For the duration of the event, samurai tokens can be exchanged for rewards by visiting the shogun's camp in front of your castle.

I've come with a terrible warning! General Akechi intends to conquer your empire. Boldly attack the camps of his despicable samurais and send them running! You will be richly rewarded for your victories over Akechi. The emperor is relying on your help, valiant warrior!
Find a samurai camp to attack

I've brought news from the east, my lord. General Akechi and his despicable samurai want to conquer your territories. The emperor has called all brave warriors to arms to put a stop to this invasion. Set out now to win glory and rewards!
You can receive glory points for battles against General Akechi's samurai camps. If you collect a certain number of glory points, you will receive rewards either instantly or at the end of the event.
The alliances that have collected the most glory points by the end of the event will be richly rewarded. Furthermore, your alliance will win valuable prizes just by reaching certain point thresholds.
Join an alliance to collect glory points for the alliance score and earn extra rewards.

Captured monuments grant the owner's entire alliance a glory bonus in all of their attacks. In addition, this bonus can be boosted by increasing the level of your monument.
All alliance members can donate wood and stone to increase a monument's level. The resources are transported from the alliance's castles and outposts using market barrows. Resources can't be reclaimed once they reach the monument.
The monument's level increases automatically when the required number of resources has been reached. A monument keeps its current level when it's captured by another castle lord, but the progress made towards the next level will be lost.
There are both large and small monuments. Large monuments can reach a higher level than their smaller counterparts.
Legendary skills are effective against monuments even if their owners have not yet achieved legendary status.

You will regularly receive resources that you can use to upgrade your camp. The amount of resources you get depends on the balance of power between the two factions. You can't send resources from other kingdoms to Berimond.
Other castle lords can attack your camp, steal your resources, wipe out your troops, and damage your buildings.

Auxiliaries can be hired at the training grounds in Berimond. They don't need food, and the number of units you can have depends on your auxiliaries' headquarters. They won't be available after the end of the event.
You can send troops from other kingdoms to Berimond to strengthen your army.

Destroy connected towers to free the way to the enemy capital. If the opponent's capital has fallen, you can destroy enemy camps once and for all and drive their owners from Berimond for good. Towers also block access to resource villages that you can capture to obtain more resources.
After a capital has fallen, the Last Man Standing battle begins. The camps of the faction that no longer has a capital can now be destroyed permanently.
You can neither win nor lose honor during battles in Berimond.

One of our top priorities is to provide our players with a safe and fair playing environment. We have stepped up our campaign against the use of 3rd party software, otherwise known as bots or mods. The use of these programs by a small number of players has already had an adverse effect on performance and player experience. To combat this issue, we will be introducing new features that will eliminate most of the functions that these programs are being used for, and have outlined a punishment system for users that continue to use these bots.
We will now begin using our very own detection software to identify players using bots, and issue an initial 1 hour ban to all flagged accounts. Continued use will subject your account to escalating punishment, ending in a permanent ban. In addition we have taken legal action against the creators of these programs, and will continue to do so. You can find additional information in the Royal Post or the Empire: Four Kingdoms forum.

Here you can copy your current recruitment line to another castle. Instead of going to each castle and starting recruitment, you can simply set up a line in one castle, and copy it to the others. Here you can copy your current tool production line to another castle. Instead of going to each castle and starting production, you can set up a line in one castle, and copy it to the others. You only have to pay for the costs of producing these tools, as well as any "doubling" costs you had in the original line.

To copy your recruitment line, you will need to rent the necessary amount of recruitment slots. Would you like to rent them now?
To copy your production line, you will need to rent the necessary amount of production slots. Would you like to rent them now?

You can produce tools for attack and defense here. Simply select a tool and enter the amount you want. Now production can begin! Remember: Each tool can only be used once!
You can save precious time by looping an existing production line and copying it to your other castles!
Use loops to automatically start recruiting the units in your current line again after the line ends. Set up a recruitment line and loop it until you have the units you need.
Use loops to automatically start producing the tools in your current line again after the line ends. Set up a production line and loop it until you have the tools you need.

When purchasing a loop, you must pay upfront for all the units in the line for each loop. If you purchase many loops, you may have to pay an additional small fee. If you have doubled the amount of units in a slot, you will also have to pay to double them in each of the loops you purchase. Note: When you purchase loops, you can no longer cancel the recruitment of individual units. You can only cancel the whole line at once. Recruitment speed will be calculated at the beginning of each loop, so make sure your feasts last long enough!

When purchasing a loop, you must pay upfront for all the tools in the line for each loop. If you purchase many loops, you may have to pay an additional small fee. If you have doubled the amount of tools in a slot, you will also have to pay to double them in each of the loops you purchase. Note: When you purchase loops, you can no longer cancel the production of individual tools. You can only cancel the whole line at once. Production speed will be calculated at the beginning of each loop.
