Your spies have gathered some information about a mysterious robber baron from the outer realms. They call him Rhukan the Flayer and word in the taverns is that he is recruiting a mercenary army of foreign warriors to invade our lands and kill King Eric!
Our information suggests that they plan to attack during the Festival of the Lotus King. Here's your chance to win valuable rewards by defeating each of the invading armies! A special decoration will also be awarded to all players who help drive the invaders from the empire. Additionally, players on the server where the top participants have earned the highest cumulative score at the end of the event will also be rewarded with a unique statue to commemorate their triumph.

Fight them off and earn as many points as possible during the Festival of the Lotus King! We will reward you with gifts of rare value once the invaders have been driven out.

In this latest update, we have introduced a new mechanic to help you manage your tools. Now when an enemy player captures one of your outposts, villages, or monuments, you will no longer lose your unassigned tools. All unused tools will return to the main castle in the kingdom in which the battle took place.
Returned tools will go straight into your castle’s tool storage after your outpost, village, or monument falls into enemy hands. From there, they can be assigned to your castle defenses or sent to any of your remaining outposts, villages, or monuments.
All remaining tools from your captured outpost have been returned to your castle. Any decorations, relic buildings & districts have been placed in your buildings storehouse.
All remaining tools from your captured village have been returned to your castle.
All remaining tools from your captured monument have been returned to your castle.

You don't have enough Khan tablets! Attack more nomad camps to capture more tablets. You can find the camps on the empire's world map.

The nomad invasion is a time-limited event during which you must fight against nomad camps on the world map. If you defeat these camps, you will gain Khan tablets as loot. You can use these to buy special items from the Khan tablet trader.
You'll also earn 1 Khan point for every Khan tablet you loot. The more Khan points you collect, the better the rewards you can unlock. If you are one of the castle lords with the most Khan points at the end of the event, you'll win even more valuable prizes!
You can keep your Khan tablets after the end of the event, but your Khan points will expire.

The nomad invasion is a time-limited event in which you and your alliance must fight against nomad camps on the world map. If you defeat the nomads, you will gain Khan tablets as loot. You can use these to buy special decorative items and equipment items from the Herald of the Invasion.
Every Khan tablet you loot will also earn you a Khan point. This point counts towards your individual ranking as well as your alliance ranking. The better you do, the more valuable the rewards you can unlock. If you are one of the castle lords or part of the alliance with the most Khan points at the end of the event, you can win even more prizes!
You can keep your Khan tablets after the end of the event, but your Khan points will expire.

Gather your allies and prepare for the invasion! Nomad armies from the east have waged war on our empire and are setting up military camps throughout our lands. Spies have even reported sightings of dreaded Khan camps!
Powerful alliances throughout the kingdom have been called to arms to defend our lands against the invaders and capture their precious Khan tablets and medals!

The nomads are coming! Our spies have reported that an invading nomad army has crossed our borders and are setting up military camps throughout our lands. There have even been sightings of dreaded Khan camps!
Mighty alliances across the realm have been called to arms to drive the invaders back and loot their precious Khan tablets and medals!
Attack and defeat nomad camps to earn Khan tablets that can be exchanged for valuable rewards.

Attacking Khan camps enrages their armies and increases the camp's rage level. Once the rage level is full, you can taunt the camp to trigger an attack on your castle. Defend your castle successfully to earn Khan medals that can be exchanged for valuable rewards.

The nomad invasion is a time-limited event during which you and your alliance must fight against nomad camps on the world map. If you defeat these camps, you will gain Khan tablets as loot. You can use these to buy special items from the Khan tablet trader.
You'll also earn a Khan point for every Khan tablet you loot. The more Khan points you and your alliance collect, the better the rewards you can unlock. If you are a member of the alliance with the most Khan points at the end of the event, you and your alliance can win even more valuable prizes! You need to gain a minimum of points to qualify for receiving alliance contest rewards.
You can keep your Khan tablets after the end of the event, but your Khan points will expire.
Successfully defend your castle against Khan attacks to earn Khan medals and unlock special alliance rewards.

Attack the Khan camp to earn Khan tablets and increase the camp's rage level. After each attack the Khan camp will have a cooldown period which can be skipped by using rubies or time skip consumables. The length of the cooldown period increases with each attack.
Once a camp's rage level is full, you will be able to taunt the Khan and trigger an attack on your castle. If you successfully defend your castle against the attack, you will receive coins, Khan tablets and Khan medals as loot. You can exchange these for special reward items from the Herald of the Invasion. You'll also earn a Khan point for every medal and tablet you loot.
Don’t fear the Khan! Even if a khan attack breaches your defenses, no loot will be taken and no buildings will be damaged!
The rage points collected by every legendary level member of your alliance contributes towards increasing the camp's rage level. A higher camp level means stronger defenses and more powerful attacks, but also more loot. Additionally, the higher the level of the Khan camp, the better the rewards you will receive at the end of the event!

Khan tablets can be looted by attacking and defeating nomad camps on the world map.
These tablets can be exchanged for valuable rewards by visiting the Khan tablet trader, who can be accessed via the herald of the invasion outside your castle.
You can keep your Khan tablets after the end of the event and spend them during the next nomad invasion.

Khan medals can be looted by successfully defending your castle against Khan camp attacks during the Khan's Revenge event.
These medals can be exchanged for valuable rewards by visiting the Khan medal merchant, who can be accessed via the herald of the invasion outside your castle.
The Khan medal merchant will still be available for a short time after the Khan's revenge event has ended. You can also keep hold of your Khan medals and spend them during the next Khan's revenge event.
You don't have enough Khan tablets! Attack more nomad camps to loot more tablets. You can find the camps on the world map.
You don't have enough Khan medals! Successfully defend your castle against Khan attacks to loot more medals. You can trigger attacks by taunting Khan camps when their rage level is full.
You can only taunt the Khan when the camp's rage level is full. You can increase the rage level by attacking the Khan camp on the world map.
The Khan camp is fully enraged! Taunt the Khan to trigger an attack. Successfully defending your castle will earn you valuable rewards.

Khan camps are enemy sites on the world map that appear during a nomad invasion. You can attack them to loot resources, khan tablets, and khan medals. For the duration of the event, you can go to the Herald of the Invasion in front of your castle to trade in your tablets and medals for valuable rewards.
Allow other members of your alliance to see this attack.

The Khan is seeking his revenge against the castle lords of the Great Empire! Work alongside your alliance to drive his armies out of our lands! But beware: The Khan is easily enraged and is now prepared to strike back against your castle!
Spectacular rewards of rare value are ready to be claimed by castle lords brave enough to drive the invaders from the lands. Gather your armies and prepare for war!

In addition to fixing a number of bugs, we have created a new research interface to provide castle lords with a clearer overview of the technologies they have already developed and the progress they are yet to make.

Hear ye, hear ye! King Eric the Artisan has declared that a special tournament shall soon take place in celebration of the empire's recent victory against the mercenary armies of the Flayer. This special tournament will be known as the Nations Cup!
Here's your chance to win valuable rewards by working together with the castle lords of your realm to defeat enemy camps that threaten the empire! The Nations Cup will pit servers against each other in a grand tournament, starting with a group phase and then progressing to head-to-head knock-out rounds. Progressing through each round will secure gifts and rewards for each member of your server, while top ranking players will also receive individual rewards for their efforts.
Each server's success will be determined by the total number of points earned by its castle lords during each event, so gather your armies and prepare for battle!
You can follow the progress of the Nations cup, learn more about the tournament format, and get an overview of the individual and server rankings by visiting the forum.

The first wave of invading armies has reached our lands, and the prestigious Nations Cup has begun! Defeat the invaders and earn as many points as possible to secure your realm's passage into the next round of the cup! Your efforts on the battlefield will be greatly rewarded should you drive the enemies out of the kingdom and progress to the next round. Good luck!
Remember: The two servers with the most points in each group shall progress to the knockout rounds, so be sure to defeat as many invader camps as possible!
You can follow the progress of the Nations Cup and get an overview of the individual and server rankings by visiting the forum.

The tenacity shown by you and your comrades on the battlefield has secured your place in the next round of the Nations Cup. King Eric is greatly impressed by your progress and has prepared an array of valuable gifts to reward your efforts. Additional rewards will also be granted to castle lords who place in the top 250 in the server rankings.
You can follow the progress of the Nations Cup and get an overview of the individual and server rankings by visiting the forum.

You and your countrymen have fought valiantly but unfortunately you have not secured enough points to reach the next round of the Nations Cup. Do not be disheartened - your bravery on the battlefield is still greatly appreciated and shall be sung about in the taverns of the empire for years to come.
You can follow the progress of the Nations Cup and get an overview of the individual and server results and rankings by visiting the forum.

The efforts of you and your countrymen in the Nations Cup have secured your place in the prestigious grand final! The nobles of the empire are mightily impressed by your efforts so far and have prepared a selection of valuable rewards for your progress.
Sharpen your blades and prepare to lead your armies into battle one last time!

Congratulations! The champions of your kingdom have proved themselves to be the mightiest warriors in the world. Your bravery on the battlefield has impressed King Eric, and your relentless efforts will be handsomely rewarded. Your remarkable achievement will be the talk of the taverns for many years to come!

You and your countrymen fought valiantly throughout the Nations Cup. Although you weren't able to win this prestigious event, your bravery on the battlefield is still greatly appreciated and shall be sung about in the taverns of the empire for years to come.

The invading hordes have been driven from the lands, and the Nations Cup has reached its exciting conclusion. King Eric has nothing but gratitude for the brave lords who helped protect the kingdom during the tournament, but on this occasion there can only be one winner.
Many congratulations to the winner of this summer's Nations Cup!
You can find out the final results and rankings in the forum.
Select a build item that you want to disassemble. The item will be destroyed and in exchange you will receive crafting materials.

If you have duplicates of certain build items that you no longer need, or if your build item storage is full, you can disassemble build items. This will destroy the item permanently, but you will receive crafting materials in exchange.

Unlock the true potential of your castle! With the new crafting system, you can use materials to produce a range of build items to enhance the efficiency of your castle! You can use these items to improve your resource production, decrease recruitment times, boost your defenses, and much more!

Based on feedback from our community, we have optimized the looting of Khan medals during the Khan's Revenge event. The amount of medals earned from battle should now satisfy most player's expectations!
Appearance build items will not grant you crafting materials after disassembling.
Next time you buy rubies, you'll get double the amount you pay for (not active during Prime Times)! Only valid for one purchase. For more information please visit our forum.
Gain the advantage over your enemies with these huge discounts!

The time has come to raise a glass in celebration of the Four Kingdoms' most beloved holiday: Oktoberfest! To mark the occasion, King Eric has invited lords and ladies throughout the Great Empire to enjoy a magnificent feast of sausages, sample the most refreshing brews in the tavern, and take part in a special Oktoberfest contest!
The Oktoberfest contest will take place between September 18 and October 5. During the event, castle lords across all servers can compete against each other by obtaining points in the Festival of the Lotus King. At the end of the contest, rewards will be awarded to each server’s top players. All top 1000 players will receive the special beer wagon. Additionally, a special reward package will be awarded to the top 200 players above level 70, as well as the top 200 players below level 70!
So, grab yourself a pretzel and get ready to outsmart your competitors!
You can find more information about the Oktoberfest contest by visiting the forum.

The kegs are empty and the last pretzel has been devoured. This can only mean that the Oktoberfest has come to an end! King Eric has been delighted by the festivities and has already ordered the delivery of themed rewards for the most successful lords and ladies in this year's Oktoberfest contest.
Although the Oktoberfest might be over for this year, there's no need to despair! The next celebration and festivities will follow soon!

Here you can see a list of all the royal quests that are currently available.
These assignments all belong to a quest series with a predefined time limit. Each individual quest also has its own time limit in which players must complete all the quest conditions in order to receive the quest rewards.
If you fail to complete the quest within the time limit, you can still purchase the rewards with rubies. The price for completing the quest is dependent on how many quest conditions have been completed.
Whether you complete or fail a quest, once the quest's time limit has expired, the next quest in the series will be unlocked. Completing all quests in the royal quest series before the series time limit expires will earn you a lucrative final reward.
You can also purchase the final reward at any time using rubies. The price for purchasing the final rewards is dependent on how many quests in the series have been completed. Even after purchasing the final reward, you can still complete the remaining royal quests and earn their individual quest rewards.
Select a particular quest to learn more about it.

Here you can see a list of all the adventure quests that are currently available.
Adventure quests are a series of particularly challenging quests that span across multiple kingdoms and events.
Adventure quests must be completed in the correct order. Completing a quest will unlock the next quest in the series.
The rewards for completing an adventure quest series are extremely valuable, however, you will have to show a high level of skill and commitment to complete the entire series.
Although there is no time limit for completing adventure quests, some individual quests are related to events and therefore can only be completed while that event is active.
Select a particular quest to learn more about it.

• Shapeshifters imitate the actions of real players on the world map • Each totem can be attacked once per day using attack runes • Alliances can't assist during the attack of the shapeshifters event
• Attacking shapeshifter totems will earn you points • Carry out five attacks to complete a point series • Enable hardcore mode to earn more points at a greater risk
• Compete for daily shapeshifter insignias with your best point series • Earn shapeshifter charms based on your points per attack • Spend your rewards in the event shop
Open the help dialog for further information

The summoner cult of the shapeshifters has crossed the borders of the Great Empire in search of blood needed to perform their dark rituals. The shapeshifters are cunning strategists and have taken the form of castle lords across the land with the intention of triggering a bloody war. We must fight back against these nefarious cultists before it is too late – who knows what terrible beasts they may summon to our lands.

Hardcore mode allows you to earn more points when attacking shapeshifter totems, but at a greater risk. When attacking in hardcore mode, all points earned from attacks on a shapeshifter totem will receive a point multiplier depending on the negative effects that have been enabled. Remember that when hardcore mode is enabled, you run the risk of losing troops during attacks on enemy totems.
You can save any remaining shapeshifter insignias and spend them during the next attack of the shapeshifters event.
You can save any remaining shapeshifter charms and spend them during the next attack of the shapeshifters event.

The shapeshifters have taken on new enemy forms and can be attacked once again. Prepare your armies for battle!

The attack of the shapeshifters is a time limited event in which you can anonymously fight and compete against other castle lords on the world map. At the start of the event, shapeshifter totems will appear in front of your castle in the Great Empire. Each totem represents a real player on the world map and will imitate that player's actions.
New totems will appear outside your castle each day during the event, but you can only attack each totem once!
Each attack on a shapeshifter totem will cost you one attack rune. Each castle lord is granted five free attack runes each day, while a maximum of five additional runes can be purchased daily. Additional attack runes can only be purchased once you have used all your current runes.
Important: Attack runes must be used on the same day on which they were purchased or they will be lost with the daily event reset.
When attacking shapeshifter totems, you will only lose tools that have been used during the attack, while all your troops will return to your castle without any loss, even in defeat. Troops will be lost when attacking in hardcore mode, however, the rewards for these attacks will be greater. Beware: The shapeshifters are a cunning bunch and often hide information about themselves in battle reports.
Attacking shapeshifter totems will earn you shapeshifter charms and event points depending how well you plan and execute your attacks. Once you've collected points on five different occassions, you will complete a point series. The highest point series you achieve during the event will be saved and used in the event rankings. Your ranking position will earn you shapeshifter insignias, which can be spent in the event shop.
You can increase the number of points each attack earns by purchasing point boosters from the event shop. Please note that these point boosters can only be used during certain shapeshifter events.
Enemies can also launch attacks on your castle, but there's no need to worry, since you won't sustain any damage to your buildings or units. However, it is always worth keeping your defenses strong to reduce the amount of event points your enemy attackers receive. You can access a special shapeshifter view in your defense overview to help you get a better picture of your defenses against shapeshifter attacks.
The attack of the shapeshifters is a single player event, so you are unable to call upon your alliance for assistance, though you can always turn to them for advice on how to best defend your castle.
Very powerful in defense. Ideal against melee attackers.

Do you really want to remove the gem? If you do, the equipment item will lose the gem's effect. After you remove the gem, you can embed it in another equipment item. You can also put a new gem in the first equipment item.

You can improve your commanders and castellans by equipping them with items. The bonuses of all equipment items used will strengthen the armies controlled by the commanders or the castellans.
You can acquire equipment by defeating <14kingdom NPCs< and taking part in events. You can also forge unwanted equipment into new items in the smithy. Combining three items of the same quality will result in a new item of the same level, while you can create an item of superior quality by combining 6 items of the same quality.
Many equipment items, heroes and gems also have different power levels and power rarities that influence the item's stats. When applying equipment and gem sets to your commanders, all items need to be of the same power level and power rarity in order to activate the set bonuses.
In addition, you can embed gems in equipment items to make them even more powerful. One equipment item can only hold one gem at a time. If you want to embed another gem, the old one will be destroyed.

Kingdoms Cup fever has hit the Great Empire, and the time has come for honorable kings to lace up their boots, strengthen their defenses, and prepare their attackers! To celebrate the arrival of this grand tournament, we have prepared a mighty gift for your castle!

Summer has arrived and with it the most anticipated tournament the world has known: The Kingdom's Cup. Prepare the troops as the hostilities are soon to begin!
The Kingdoms Cup will pit alliances against each other in a grand tournament encompassing both Goodgame Empire and Empire: Four Kingdoms!
After the initial qualification stage, competitors will battle their way through a series of knockout rounds in a bid to establish themselves as the mightiest alliance in the whole of Empire: Four Kingdoms! The victors will then have the chance to put their bravery to the test in the ultimate grand final against their Empire rivals!
Don't despair if your alliance fails to qualify. The Kingdoms Cup will run alongside a regular battle of nations tournament, so even if your alliance misses out on the later rounds of the competition, you still have the chance to claim valuable rewards by leading your server to victory!
You can follow the progress of the Kingdoms Cup, learn more about the tournament format, and get an overview of the alliance and server rankings by visiting the community hub.

The whistle of war has been blown and the qualification stage of the Kingdoms Cup is underway!
Defeat the invading armies that have entered the empire and earn as many points as possible to secure your realm's progression in this prestigious tournament!
Only alliances competing on one of the top 10 ranked servers will have the chance to qualify for the group stage of the Kingdoms Cup, so do all you can to lead your realm to victory!
Your efforts on the battlefield will be greatly rewarded once the invaders have been driven from the land.
You can follow the progress of the Kingdoms Cup and get an overview of the alliance and server rankings by visiting the community hub.

Congratulations! The heroes of your realm have left the invaders' defenses in ruins and claimed a glorious victory!

Today we celebrate the founding of the Great Empire! Let us fondly remember the epic feats and great acts of valor that took place in these lands. To commemorate this special day we have prepared a special decoration for your castle.
Today we celebrate the founding of the Great Empire! We are honored to have you take part in this epic saga. To commemorate this special day we have prepared a special gift for you.

As the giddy citizens of your castle roll out the birthday bunting, bloodthirsty invaders from the outer lands set their sights on the lands of the Great Empire. It's time to prepare for the Creation Day Conflict!

To celebrate the Empire family's birthday, brave knights and fierce warrior princesses are invited to take part in a birthday themed battle of the nations! The Creation Day Conflict is coming - are your armies ready?

As the anniversary of the founding of the Great Empire approaches, it's time to roll out the birthday bunting, raise a glass to the king, and prepare your warriors for bloodshed. The Creation Day Conflict is coming.
The Creation Day Conflict will pit servers against one another in a bid to claim prestigious rewards for the castle lords of their realm.
During the event, each server will be divided into 3 level brackets with players from each bracket competing against their counterparts from a rival server in each round.
Players can help guide their server to victory by actively participating in a variety of tasks such as defeating invading armies, battling against other castle lords, and overpowering villainous robber barons.
After each round, the servers with the most victorious level brackets will earn 3 ranking points, while defeated servers will earn 0. Points At the end of the event rewards will be distributed to servers according to their final ranking. Special rewards for certain top performing alliances are also up for grabs, so grab your swords and get ready for battle!
You can learn more about the Creation Day Conflict, and get an overview of each round's tasks, and keep yourself up to date with the event's rankings by visiting the community hub.

The final candle on the birthday cake has been lit and that can only mean one thing: The Creation Day Conflict is underway!
Find out how you can help guide your server to victory by visiting the community hub!

Now is not the time for celebration however, as more enemies lie in wait. Prepare to set foot into the breach once again!
You can learn more about the Creation Day Conflict, and get an overview of each round's tasks, and keep yourself up to date with the event's rankings by visiting the community hub.

You can store decorations that you don't need in the buildings storehouse. All decorations stored in the buildings storehouse are sorted by public order. You can also filter the displayed decorations by their size or name.
Non-decoration buildings purchased from merchants or won in events can be found in the buildings storehouse as well, and can be placed in a castle. Keep in mind that non-deco buildings placed in a castle cannot be moved back to the buildings storehouse.
Buildings stored in this buildings storehouse can be placed in the following locations:
- The Great Empire: Main castle, outposts, metropolises and capitals. - The Everwinter Glacier: Main castle and capitals. - The Burning Sands: Main castle and capitals. - The Fire Peaks: Main castle and capitals. - The Storm Islands: Main castle.
Decorations that have been fused or come from the colossus events are classed as unique. You can only store a certain amount of unique decorations in your buildings storehouse.
Select the equipment, heroes, and gems that you wish to be sold automatically and then save your selection.

Equipment, heroes, and gems that you select will be sold as soon as you receive them from the following sources:
- Loot from battles - Event rewards - Daily login bonuses - Daily tasks
Be aware that rewards received from special offers will also be sold automatically if they match your selection!
Light blue gem effects: - Increased army return travel speed
Dark blue gem effects: - Increased army loot capacity
Green gem effects: - Increased unit limit on the wall
Light green gem effects: - Increased unit limit on the flanks - Increased combat strength of courtyard defenders
Dark green gem effects: - Increased unit limit on the front
Red gem effects: - Increased fire damage inflicted when attacking - Decreased fire damage when defending
Pink gem effects: - Increased combat strength when attacking enemy courtyards
Yellow gem effects: - Increased secure storage capacity
Orange gem effects: - Increased chance of finding powerful equipment

The fusion hub lists all available fusion forges and their current energy state.
Additional information about the forge's level, the amount of dust the forge has, and how many forge level-ups that dust can provide is also available.
Energy and dust are not shared among different fusion forges.

The fusion hub provides an overview of all available catalysts for each fusion forge.
Catalysts are required and consumed in the fusion process and are categorized in catalyst tiers. Each catalyst tier allows you to fuse up to a certain fusion level. The higher the catalyst tier, the higher the fusion level.
Dust can be converted into catalysts, while catalysts can be converted into dust. Both of these processes require fusion energy.
Catalysts are not shared among different fusion forges.
You can purchase fusion materials using fusion coins.
You can purchase fusion materials from the fusion coin market using fusion coins.
Select the target you want to use for the fusion.
Select the source and catalyst you want to use for the fusion.

The decoration fusion forge is used to level up decorations. Increasing the fusion level of a decoration will increase its public order.
To begin the fusion process, you must first select the decoration you want to level up. This is called the fusion target. All decorations with a target icon can be selected as a fusion target.
Next, select a second decoration you want to use for the fusion process. This is called the fusion source. All decorations with a source icon that are stored in the buildings storehouse can be selected as a fusion source.
Finally, select a catalyst.
Note: Fusion sources and catalysts are consumed during the fusion process.
In addition to standard fusions, the decoration fusion forge also offers the option of premium fusions that provide a 100% boost on the bonus fusion XP. The fusion energy cost of standard and premium fusions is the same and determined by the selected fusion target. However, while standard fusions cost fusion coins and kingdom resources, premium fusions only cost rubies.
Kingdom resources are deducted from the stock in the main castle of the Great Empire.
Once a decoration has been fused for the first time it is classed as unique and will be marked with a special icon. Unique decorations are not stackable and require their own capacity slot when stored in the buildings storehouse. If a non-unique decoration is stored in the buildings storehouse and there is no capacity space left for unique decorations, you cannot level it up until you place it in one of your castles.
Select the decoration you want to level up.
Problems locating a stored decoration? Check your filter options to help find what you're looking for.
Here you select the decoration that you want to level up. This decoration is called "the target".
Source and catalyst will be lost during the fusion. Requires minimum catalyst tier {0}.

Catalysts can be disassembled and converted to dust, while dust can be assembled into new catalysts. Both disassembling and assembling requires fusion energy.
Some catalysts cannot be assembled. The limitation of which catalysts can and cannot be assembled is determined by the availability of higher catalyst tiers.
Chance to receive bonus fusion XP

Fusion XP is influenced by the source level and its relation to the target level. Bonus fusion XP chance is influenced by source and catalyst. Bonus fusion XP is influenced by the forge level, the target level, and the bonus fusion XP boost.
The most brilliant minds of the kingdom have united to design, build, and unleash the greatest technological achievement the Great Empire has ever seen. Behold, the brand new decoration fusion forge!

By clever manipulation of the newly available fusion materials, the decoration fusion forge gives castle lords the power to level up and improve the quality of the decorations in their castles. The future is truly fusion.

The blacksmiths of fusion are forging a prosperous future for the Great Empire.
Complete a fusion process in the fusion forge

The fusion process requires a fusion source and a catalyst to be selected. The fusion level of the target dictates the minimum required catalyst tier that can be used.
The selected fusion source determines the amount of fusion XP that will be gained from the fusion. That amount of fusion XP includes a modifier based on the relation of the target's and source's fusion levels. While a source with a higher fusion level than the target will increase the modifier, the reverse will decrease it.
The selected fusion source also determines the bonus fusion XP chance. Similar to the fusion XP, the bonus fusion XP chance is subject to the same source to target fusion level relation modifier. The bonus fusion XP chances can be further increased by the selected catalyst. If the selected catalyst tier is higher than the minimum required catalyst tier for the fusion level of the selected fusion target, then the catalyst will grant an additional bonus fusion XP chance.
The bonus fusion XP chance increases the likelihood of earning additional bonus fusion XP. Bonus fusion XP is determined by the level of the decoration fusion forge and the fusion level of the target. The bonus fusion XP chance can exceed 100%, with any percent above providing a boost to the bonus fusion XP.
Fusion XP and potential bonus fusion XP are added to the current XP value of the selected fusion target. If enough fusion XP is gained then the fusion level of the selected fusion target increases.
Note: Source and catalyst will be lost during the fusion.

Automatic spying allows players to automatically gather spy reports on NPC targets on the world map.
When automatic spying is activated, you no longer need to send spies to gather intelligence on NPC targets, but instead can instantly view perfect reports of the enemy's defenses.
Please note that this doesn't apply to all NPC targets. Enemies for which automatic spying applies are marked with a blue star icon, which can be found next to the target or in the target's ring menu.

It's time for busy castle lords to rejoice! A new player subscription is now available, providing two new time-saving features that allows overworked kings to focus their attentions on more important matters, such as counting their coins and vanquishing their enemies.

Open the help dialog for further information

Decoration catalysts are fusion materials required for upgrading decorations. Each catalyst's tier determines the maximum fusion level it can be used for. Catalysts can be assembled from dust, earned as event rewards or purchased from the forge markets.

Decoration dust is a fusion material required for upgrading the decoration forge and assembling catalysts. Dust can be disassembled from catalysts, earned as event rewards or purchased from the forge markets with fusion coins or rubies.

Fusion energy is required for all fusion processes, including the assembly and disassembly of catalysts and dust. Fusion energy recharges automatically at a rate determined by your fusion forge level. You can also recharge your energy instantly using rubies.

The decoration fusion forge is used to upgrade decorations. The level of your forge determines its fusion energy capacity and recharge rate as well as the bonus XP gained from fusions. You can upgrade the decoration fusion forge with dust.

Sources are decorations that can be sacrificed to upgrade targets in the decoration fusion forge. All decorations with a source icon can be used as a source. There are special source-only decorations that can't be used as targets. These can be earned as event rewards, or purchased from the forge markets with rubies.

Targets are decorations that can be upgraded in the decoration fusion forge. All decorations with a target icon can be upgraded. Upgrading a target decoration requires catalysts, source decorations, energy, and fusion coins.
A special source-only decoration that can be used in the fusion forge.
A special source-only decoration that can be used in the fusion forge.

The samurai invasion is a time-limited event during which you must fight against samurai camps on the world map.
Samurai camps can be spied upon or attacked. The strength of the samurai camps depends on the difficulty level chosen after the event started.
Defeating these camps will earn you samurai tokens that can be exchanged for special items at the shogun's camp outside your castle. You'll also earn 1 Bushido point for every samurai token you loot. The more Bushido points you collect, the better the rewards you can unlock. If you are one of the castle lords with the most Bushido points at the end of the event, you'll win even more valuable prizes!
You can keep your unspent samurai tokens after the end of the event, but your Bushido points will expire.

If you are one of the castle lords with the most Bushido points at the end of the event, you and your alliance will win even more valuable prizes!
You can keep your unspent samurai tokens after the end of the event, but your Bushido points will expire.

We have received a lot of questions regarding the new temporary server event in recent weeks and would like to take this opportunity to address the three most discussed issues.
- Why do players have to start at level 1? For this first run of the Outer Realms event, we wanted to gauge initial player reactions before deciding where to take the event in the future. Therefore, we decided to use the simplest technical implementations rather than spend many months of production on an event that may be poorly received. It is for this reason that all players start at level 1.
If the event is a success in terms of player enjoyment and participation, we will look into the possibility of implementing more complex features including different starting levels during future events.
- Why are some servers excluded from the event? Again, this decision was made due to technical limitations, specifically those that relate to displaying localized text within the new temporary server. Although it was our initial intention to make the event available to all players, we found that the user interface struggled to properly display certain languages resulting in a poor user experience.
- Why do we focus on PvP? We based many of the elements featured in the new event on feedback we have received from our community. As many players regularly request more PvP events in the game, we decided to place the main focus of the Outer Realms event on PvP.

The Reaper's Wrath is a Halloween event that allows players to earn special rewards by collecting souls from enemy players.
During the event, players can launch special attacks that will allow them to claim souls from their enemies. The amount of souls that can be claimed during each attack can be increased by equipping commanders with special equipment items or by using soul snatcher boosters, all of which can be purchased from the event shop with rubies.
At the start of the event, players will receive a supply of souls as well as one special equipment item. Players will also receive additional souls on each day of the event according to the amount of souls already in their possession.
There's no need to fear the reaper during the event, as all attacks on your enemies will be anonymous. Additionally, attackers and defenders won't lose any tools, troops or resources from battles, nor will their buildings suffer any fire damage.
The amount of souls you still have in your possession at the end of the event will determine the rewards you receive - so keep your defenses strong to prevent your souls being claimed by your enemies! Souls are deleted at the end of the event.
Here you can use rubies to purchase soul snatchers and appearance items during the Reaper's Wrath event. This event shop will also be available for a short period after the event's runtime.
Soul snatchers increase the amount of souls you will collect from successful attacks on your fiendish enemies. You can choose how many soul snatchers you want to take with you into battle.
Soul snatchers increase the amount of souls you will collect from successful attacks on your fiendish enemies.

Souls are used to determine the rewards you will receive at the end of the Reaper's Wrath event. You can earn souls by attacking enemies during the Reaper's Wrath event. Souls are deleted at the end of each event.

The Winter's Prey is an event that allows players to earn special rewards by collecting pelts from enemy players.
During the event, players can launch special attacks that will allow them to loot pelts from their enemies. The amount of pelts that can be claimed during each attack can be increased by equipping commanders with special equipment items, or by using special hunting boosters, all of which can be purchased with rubies from the event shop.
At the start of the event, players will receive a supply of pelts as well as one special equipment item. Player's will also receive additional pelts each day of the event according to the amount of pelts already in their possession.
There's no need to fear the vengeance of your enemies during the event, as all attacks are anonymous. Additionally, attackers and defenders won't lose any tools, troops or resources from battles, nor will their buildings suffer any fire damage.
The amount of pelts you still have in your possession at the end of the event will determine the rewards you receive - so keep your defenses strong to prevent your pelts being claimed by your enemies!
Please note that any excess pelts you have in your possession after the event has ended will be lost.

The Kingdom's League is a long-term event in which players can compete for rewards based on their combined progress during four league events: Nomad Invasion, Samurai Invasion, War of the Realms, and Bloodcrow Invasion.
During each league season, you will be placed into a division with other players where you can improve your ranking by collecting points during the active league event. Each day you will receive a medal depending on your division ranking.
Medals are needed to earn kingdom title promotions, with each promotion earning you rewards and improving the pool of rewards available to you at the end of each league event.
Your kingdom title is also used to calculate your overall league season ranking, which in turn determines the rewards you will receive when the Kingdom's League event ends. Players with the same kingdom title are sorted according to the total number of gold medals they have collected, then silver medals, then bronze medals.

A new league event has started: {0}.
The matchmaking has taken place and you have been placed in a new division.

Collect points during league events to increase your division ranking. Medals will be paid out once a day according to your current ranking - the better your ranking, the better the medal.
The medals you earn contribute towards kingdom title promotions and are used to sort players with the same kingdom title in the final league season ranking.
Division rankings are reset at the start of each individual league event during the Kingdom's League League season.

Your kingdom title defines your progress during the Kingdom's League season and determines the value of the rewards you will receive during the event.
You can earn new kingdom titles by collecting medals during the division ranking. The higher the value of a medal, the more it will contribute towards your next promotion. Once you have collected enough medals for each promotion threshold, you will earn a new kingdom title.

The season rankings measures your success over the course of an entire Kingdom's League season. This ranking contains players from all divisions, sorted according to their kingdom title. Players with the same title are sorted according to the total number of gold medals they have collected, then silver medals, then bronze medals.
Only players who have earned at least one gold medal from their division ranking will qualify for a season ranking reward.

The Kingdom's League is a long-term event in which players can compete for rewards based on their combined progress during four league events: Nomad Invasion, Samurai Invasion,War of the Realms, and Bloodcrow Invasion.
The Kingdom's League consists of three major components:
- Division rankings, in which you compete against a limited number of players based on points earned from league events. - Kingdom titles, which determine the rewards you will receive during the event and your final season ranking. - Season rankings, which measure the progress each player has made during the entire Kingdom's League season.
Detailed information regarding each of these components can be found in the league guide.
All players above level 10 can take part in the Kingdom's League. Participation is automatic and comes at no cost.
Each season of the Kingdom's League lasts for a pre-determined number of event days. Each day a league event is active, a day is deducted from the league’s season runtime.
Please note that the Kingdom's League is completely independent from King Ludwig’s seasonal contests.

Players can earn points for the division rankings by participating in the following events:
- Nomad Invasion - Samurai Invasion - War of the Realms - Bloodcrow Invasion - Battle of Berimond
If two of these events are active at the same time, only one of them will provide points for the Kingdom's League.
The event providing points contains a button in its event overview that directly links to the Kingdom's League overview.
A season of the Kingdom's League can include several events of the same type, but a new round of matchmaking for the division rankings will take place for each individual event.

The division ranking is a contest within the Kingdom's League in which you compete against a limited number of competitors of a similar skill level, chosen by the matchmaking mechanism.
The points you earn during the active league event are used to determine your position in the division ranking. The more points you gain, the higher your ranking position.
For each of the events, you will receive a medal according to your current position in the division ranking. The higher your position, the better the medal. You can find details regarding medals in the medal overview.
The medals you earn during the Kingdom's League season contribute towards kingdom title promotions and are used to sort players of the same title in the final league season ranking.

Your reputation title defines your progress during the Kingdom's League season and determines the value of the rewards you will receive during the event.
There are 21 reputation titles in the Kingdom's League, with all participating players starting each league season with the lowest.
You can earn reputation promotions and receive new titles by collecting medals during the division ranking. The higher the value of a medal, the more it will contribute towards your next promotion. Once you have collected enough medals for each promotion threshold, you will earn a new title.
You can only be promoted to a higher reputation, you will never get demoted to a lower title.
There are two types of rewards connected to each reputation title:
- Promotion rewards: Awarded once you earn a new reputation title - Event end rewards: Awarded at the end of each individual event. The value of event rewards is determined by your current reputation title.
Some rewards are locked and are only available with an active season or promotion pass.

The season ranking measures the progress of the best players of a each league season. All players who have earned at least one gold medal from their division ranking qualifies for the season ranking, regardless of their player level or division.
Players are placed in the season ranking according their kingdom title. Players with the same title are sorted according to the total number of gold medals they have collected, then silver medals, then bronze medals.
Your position in the season ranking determines which rewards you will receive at the end of the Kingdom's League season. Players who did not qualify for the season ranking will not receive a season reward.

The following rewards are available during a season of the Kingdom's League:
- Medals: Awarded once a day according to your current division ranking. Medals are required to earn reputation promotions and improve your season ranking.
- Promotion rewards: Awarded when promoted to a new reputation title. Additional promotion rewards can be unlocked by purchasing a season pass or a promotion pass.
- Event end rewards: Awarded at the end of an invasion event according to your reputation title. Additional event end rewards can be unlocked by purchasing a season pass or an event pass.
- Season end rewards. Awarded at the end of the Kingdom's League season according to your final season ranking. Only players who have qualified for the season ranking can receive a season end reward.

When a league event ends:
- All divisions and division rankings are reset - Players will receive an event end reward according to their current kingdom title - Only players who have earned points during the event will receive a reward - When the next league event starts, players will be matched into a new division

At the end of a Kingdom's League season:
- Season rewards will be awarded to qualifying players. - Purchased passes will expire. - Reputation titles will be reset for the next season. - The season ranking is reset. - A new season of the Kingdom's League will start soon after.

Season passes unlock additional Kingdom's League rewards and can be purchased once per league season.
Active season passes unlock the following rewards: • Reputation promotion rewards • Event end rewards for each reputation title Previously locked rewards from promotions achieved and events that have ended before the pass was purchased will also be awarded.
Once purchased, season passes remain active for the remainder of the current Kingdom's League season. The price of the season pass decreases during a season depending on already purchased reward passes.

The Outer Realms is a special event in which you can compete with castle lords from around the world on a temporary event server.
With prestigious rewards up for grabs, the Outer Realms requires brave castle lords to use skill, strategy and strength to increase their position in the ranking and dominate these uncharted lands.
How you collect points for the ranking changes with each edition of the event, so be sure to check out the scoring overview at the start of each event.
Although the Outer Realms may be teeming with lucrative treasures, space there is limited - so be sure to enter before it becomes fully populated!

Daily ranking points are calculated at the same time each day based on the total might points of the buildings and decorations in your castle. The might points of buildings and decorations that are on fire or still under construction at the time the daily ranking points are calculated will not be included.
A server wide daily ranking point multiplier will also be active during the event to further aid your progress. The strength of the multiplier will increase as the event progresses, so be sure to keep working hard on your castle!
The daily ranking points you collect will be used to determine your overall score and ranking.
Please wait while we create your castle...
• Compete with players from around the world on a new event server • Collect daily ranking points to earn valuable rewards • Bring flames to your enemies and prosperity to your people
• Fight against and alongside new neighbors on the world map • Form new alliances and trade opportunities • Rule your castle in a land free of diplomatic binds
To the victor goes the spoils!
• Actions taken in the event won't affect life in your main server • Earn precious rewards by defeating your rival castle lords • Return your spoils to your main castle at the end of the event

The Outer Realms is a special event in which you can compete with castle lords from around the world on a new temporary event server. Use your skill, strategy and strength to collect daily ranking points and dominate these uncharted lands.

The progress you make during the Outer Realms event will have no impact on your main castles or their economy. You won't lose any troops, resources or rubies from your main server during the event, nor will you be bound by the diplomatic ties and alliances of your regular game.
You can switch between your main server and the Outer Realms server at any time during the event's runtime. This can be achieved by tapping the event icon found near the kingdom selection button.

The Outer Realms is a time-limited event, so don't hesitate when raising powerful armies and constructing mighty buildings for your castle. However, be aware that at the end of the event, your event castle and all the troops, resources and buildings within it will be lost.

It is not possible to transfer troops or resources between your main server castle and your Outer Realms event castle. Therefore, the economy, might and military power of your event castle will be entirely dependent on your event progress.

While playing the Outer Realms event, you are not bound by the alliances and diplomatic ties of your main server. You can, however, forge new alliances within the server to aid your progress during the event. After all, it never hurts to have trustworthy friends in these uncharted lands.

Although you can't transfer resources from your main castle to your Outer Realms castle, you can purchase rubies within the temporary server. Any unspent rubies you have left over at the end of the event will be transferred to your main castle with your event rewards.

Hard work during the Outer Realms event will be rewarded with valuable treasures and rewards. The ranking and participation rewards that you earn during event will be transferred to your main server account within 10 days of the event ending.

The Carnival of the Phoenix is an event that allows players to earn special rewards by collecting beads from enemy players.
During the event, players can launch special attacks that will allow them to loot beads from their enemies. The amount of beads that can be claimed during each attack can be increased by equipping commanders with special equipment items, or by using special bead boosters, all of which can be purchased with rubies from the event shop.
At the start of the event, players will receive a supply of beads as well as one special equipment item. Player's will also receive additional beads each day of the event according to the amount of beads already in their possession.
There's no need to fear the vengeance of your enemies during the event as all attacks are anonymous. Additionally, attackers and defenders won't lose any tools, troops or resources from battles, nor will their buildings suffer any fire damage.
The amount of beads you still have in your possession at the end of the event will determine the rewards you receive - so keep your defenses strong to prevent your beads being claimed by your enemies!
Please note that any excess beads you have in your possession after the event has ended will be lost.
Here you can use rubies to purchase bead boosters and appearance items during the Carnival of the Phoenix event. This event shop will also be available for a short period after the event's runtime.
Bead boosters increase the amount of beads you will loot from successful attacks on your enemies. You can choose how many bead boosters you want to take with you into battle.
Bead boosters increase the amount of beads you will loot from successful attacks on your enemies.

Beads are used to determine the rewards you will receive at the end of the Carnival of the Phoenix event. You can loot beads by attacking enemies during the event. Any beads you still have in your possession after the event has ended will be lost.

Bead boosters increase the amount of beads you will loot from successful attacks during the Carnival of the Phoenix event. You can buy bead boosters with rubies from the Carnival of the Phoenix event shop.

The amount of heritage that can be claimed during each attack can be increased by using special heritage boosters, which can be purchased with rubies from the event shop.

Daily ranking points are calculated at the same time each day and one final time at the end of the event based on the total might points of the buildings and decorations in your castle. The might points of buildings and decorations that are on fire or still under construction at the time the daily ranking points are calculated will not be included.
During the event, a server-wide points multiplier will also be active to increase your daily points yield.
The daily ranking points you collect during the event will be used to determine your overall score and ranking.

Daily ranking points are calculated at the same time each day based on the amount of heritage you have in your possession.
During the event, a server-wide points multiplier will also be active to increase your daily points yield.
The daily ranking points you collect during the event will be used to determine your overall score and ranking.

Some castles will be free to use, while others will cost rubies.

Global effects are active for every player on the whole server. These effects can change certain aspects of an event or the whole game. Which part of the game is influenced by a global effect can be viewed in the detailed view of the specific effect.
Global effects will only run for a certain amount of time and can occur in different strengths and combinations depending on player level.

The Herald of Spring is an event that allows players to earn special rewards by collecting bees from enemy players.
During the event, players can launch special attacks that will allow them to loot bees from their enemies. The amount of bees that can be claimed during each attack can be increased by equipping commanders with special equipment items, or by using special busy bee boosters, all of which can be purchased with rubies from the event shop.
At the start of the event, players will receive a supply of bees as well as one special equipment item. Player's will also receive additional bees each day of the event according to the amount of bees already in their possession.
There's no need to fear the vengeance of your enemies during the event as all attacks are anonymous. Additionally, attackers and defenders won't lose any tools, troops or resources from battles, nor will their buildings suffer any fire damage.
The amount of bees you still have in your possession at the end of the event will determine the rewards you receive - so keep your defenses strong to prevent your bees being claimed by your enemies!
Please note that any excess bees you have in your possession after the event has ended will be lost.

Relic equipment is the strongest type of equipment, offering the highest effect bonus values. Relic equipment cannot be combined with equipment of a lower rarity level; a commander or castellan can be equipped with either relic or non-relic equipment. Likewise, relic gems can only be placed into relic equipment. Only appearance items can be equipped to a commander or castellan who is wearing relic equipment. Before the player receives a relic equipment most of its effects and values are random. Only when the player receives the equipment are the values finalized and set.

Prices will reset on a daily basis.

The military academy increases the strength of your units against specific targets by activating training programs.
When visiting the military academy, you can choose from three training programs that will increase the strength of your units when battling against certain targets. Each program will be differently priced and offer different boosts.
If you don't like the selection available, you can reroll your choice of programs a certain number of times per day for free. After all the free rerolls have been used, you can continue to reroll the training programs for a randomly chosen event currency which will change daily.
The premium reroll will always create a training program that applies to a currently available target. You can also choose to lock a training program so that it isn't lost when rerolling.
Upgrading the military academy will unlock additional units that can benefit from training programs. The selectable training programs will only apply to units that have been unlocked in the military academy.
You prolong the runtime of each training program for rubies, but each runtime increase will also increase the price until you select a new training program.
Reroll the training programs for free or with an event currency. Use the premium roll to create programs that apply to current targets.

Collect duty points by completing daily duties in the Outer Realms and unlock rewards for your main server account. You will get rewards from your current reward step and all previous steps.

Completing duties in the Outer Realms will earn you duty points. The amount of duty points you earn will determine the reward level and rewards you receive at the end of the Outer Realms event. These rewards will be sent to your main server account. You will receive the rewards of the current reward threshold and of all previous reward thresholds.

The Outer Realms is a special event that allows castle lords to compete for unique rewards with players from around the world on a temporary event server.
When playing the Outer Realms event, you will be taken to a temporary event server in which you can build a new castle and collect daily ranking points in a bid to win valuable rewards.
How you collect the daily ranking points changes with each edition of the event, so be sure to check out the "scoring overview" at the start of each event.
The daily ranking points you collect are added to your overall score, which will be used to determine the final rankings and rewards at the end of the event. Participation rewards will also be granted based on the ranking points you collect during the event.
When first entering a new Outer Realms event, you can choose a castle you would like to start the event with. The castle you choose will determine the quality and quantity of your starting buildings and resources.
The Outer Realms also offer specific daily duties that will reward the player with daily duty points. These points will unlock additional rewards at the end of the Outer Realms event for the player's main server account.
During the event, players can form alliances and trade with other castle lords within the event server. These alliances are completely separate from the alliances in each player's main server.
It is not possible to transfer troops, resources, currencies or subscription and VIP bonuses from main server castles to event castle, and vice versa. It is, however, possible to purchase rubies and activate VIP bonuses inside the temporary server.
At the end of the Outer Realms event all buildings and resources will disappear, though all event rewards and unspent rubies purchased inside the event server will be transferred to each player's main server account within 10 days. Player's will only receive the reward of their specific rank, and not the rewards from each of the lower ranks.

These are the final rewards for your alliance's efforts in the Legion of the Daimyos. Throughout the event, your alliance will be ranked according to the war effort points collected. Once the event has ended, rewards will be paid out according to your alliance's position in the final rankings. Any alliance boosters (i.e. Time Doubloons) will be added directly to the alliance treasury after the event.
Defeat a robber baron castle level {0} or higher!
Rankings are determined by event contribution points collected by alliance members

A new invasion event has started. Your alliance will be placed in a division as soon as the matchmaking process is complete. You can already start collecting points from the invasion event while the matchmaking is taking place.
You are not member of an alliance. This alliance ranking compares the performances of competing alliances during the current league season.

Alliances whose players qualifiy for participation in the Kingdom's League are sorted into divisions at the start of each invasion event.
Members of each competing alliance can collect contribution points for their alliance by participating in the ongoing events. The sum of all contribution points collected by alliance members decides the alliance's position in the alliance division ranking. Medals will be paid out once per day according to each alliance's current ranking - the better the ranking, the better the medal! Division rankings are reset at the start of each individual invasion event within the Kingdom's League season.
At the end of the Kingdom's League season, alliances are sorted by the total number of gold medals they have collected throughout the season.
Daily medals have been awarded for the invasion event: {0}. You achieved ranking position: {1}. Your alliance achieved ranking position: {2}.
No alliance has yet qualified for the season ranking. Alliances are ranked by the total number of gold medals collected during the season.

You are not member of an alliance. This alliance ranking compares the performances of competing alliances during the current league season. Join an alliance to participate in this contest and earn valuable rewards.
Alliances are ranked according to their gold medals

The season alliance rankings measures your alliance's success over the course of an entire Kingdom's League season.
This ranking contains alliances from all divisions, sorted according to the total number of gold medals they have earned. Alliances with the same amount of gold medals are sorted according to the total number of silver medals they have collected, then bronze medals.
Only alliances who have earned at least one gold medal will qualify for a season ranking position.

The alliance division ranking is a contest within the Kingdom's League in which you compete against a limited number of competitors of a similar skill level, chosen by the matchmaking mechanism.
The total number of points alliance members collect during the active league event are used to determine each alliance's position in the division ranking. The more points you and your allies gain, the higher your alliance ranking position.
Each day, your alliance will receive a medal according to their current position in the division ranking. The higher your alliance's position, the better the medal.
The medals your alliance earns during the Kingdom's League season contribute towards your alliance's final league season ranking.

The season ranking measures the progress of the best alliances during each league season. All alliancess who have earned at least one gold medal from their division ranking qualifies for the season ranking.
Alliances are placed in the season ranking according to the medals they have collected from each invasion event. Alliances are sorted according to the total number of gold medals they have collected, then silver medals, then bronze medals.

The Elemental Knights is an event that allows players to earn special rewards by collecting essences from enemy players.
During the event, players can launch special attacks that will allow them to loot essences from their enemies. The amount of essences that can be claimed during each attack can be increased by equipping commanders with special equipment items or by using special essence boosters, all of which can be purchased from the event shop with rubies.
At the start of the event, players will receive a supply of essences as well as one special equipment item. Player's will also receive additional essences each day of the event according to the amount of essences already in their possesion.
There's no need to fear the vengeance of your enemies during the event, as all attacks are anonymous. Additionally, attackers and defenders won't lose any tools, troops or resources from battles, nor will their buildings suffer any fire damage.
The amount of essences you still have in your possesion at the end of the event will determine the rewards you receive - so keep your defences strong to prevent your essences being claimed by your enemies!
Please note that any excess essences you have in your possession after the event has ended will be lost.
Here you can use rubies to purchase essence boosters and appearances items during the Elemental Knights event. This event shop will also be available for a short period after the event finishes.
Essence booster increase the amount of essences you will loot from successful attacks on your enemies. You can choose how many essence booster you want to take with you into battle.
Essence boosters increase the amount of essences you will loot from successful attacks on your enemies.

Essences are used to determine the rewards you receive at the end of the Elemental Knights event. You can loot essences by attacking enemies during the event. Any essences you still have in your possession after the event has ended will be lost.

The moon storm regularly lays waste to the islands. All troops in your island castle will then return to your main castle and your progress in the castle will be wiped clean. The alliances that have diligently collected aquamarine will be royally rewarded.
You can start the kingdom again immediately after the moon storm.

The wind is beginning to blow on the Storm Islands. Soon a new moon storm will cause all the islands to sink. Only troops in your island castle will return home when the time comes. You should also send as many of your resources to the other kingdoms as you can, as they will otherside be lost.

Lords and Ladies! The great kingdom of your favorite medieval strategy game has expanded and we're pleased to present to you a brand new Empire game - Empire: Age of Knights. This little brother of Empire: Four Kingdoms adds a more casual approach to the Empire formula: Fight off the orc invasion, collect strong heroes and strengthen your trading skills. Choose your destiny and decide how you want to grow your empire: cooperative and peaceful or competitive with an iron fist. Empire: Age of Knights is now available in your preferred app store. And don’t worry, development on Empire: Four Kingdoms will continue as strong as ever. The team continues to work on improvements as well as developing new features, events and mechanics, along with fixes and repairs to older features. The community team, customer team and game team will continue to work hard on the ongoing updates and improvements for you. Yours most sincerely, Lumbricus the Chief Herald

This is where you can skip time in an ongoing process or complete it instantly.
Skipping time lets you significantly reduce the time required for construction processes, research projects, or other processes. Tap on the button under the hourglass symbol to skip time in a process. Look above the time skip in question to see how much time you will save on this process. You can skip time in a process as many times as you like!
You can plunder time skips from cultist shrines.
Just tap on the gray button in the upper part of the box if you want to complete a process instantly without skipping time. However, this will cost you rubies if there is no special free skip offer available at that time.

Aye! Captain Redbeard Drake at your service m'lord. My brave crew and I found a sea passage that led us to a new world. The natives call it "Tangled Wilderness". Fits if you ask me. Trees as far as the eye can see. A mysterious and dangerous place - but also full of undiscovered treasures. I can show it to you. Interested?
A new world has been discovered. Follow captain Redbeard Drake on a glorious adventure. Explore the deep jungles of the "Tangled Wilderness" with your alliance.
Increase your influence by conquering city states and attacking enemy castles or capitals. But be careful, as enemy castle lords can also decrease your influence by attacking you!

At the end of the day, the influence you get is converted into alliance influence and stored in your capital. Your alliance influence defines your alliance rank in the event, so you need to defend it at all costs.

Aye! Captain Redbeard Drake at your service m'lord. My brave crew and I found a sea passage that led us to a new world. The natives call it "Tangled Wilderness". A mysterious and dangerous place - but also full of undiscovered treasures. Other castle lords from all over the world are on their way to claim the lands for themselves. Do you want to join the exploration?

The "Tangled Wilderness" is a dense jungle where you and your alliance fight against other alliances from all over the world.
The goal of your alliance is to achieve more alliance influence in the kingdom than the other alliances.
Increase your individual influence by conquering city states and attacking enemy castles or capitals. But be careful, as enemy castle lords can also decrease your influence by attacking you!
At the end of the day, the influence you get is converted into alliance influence and stored in your capital. Enemy players can decrease your alliance influence by successfully attacking your capital.
Your alliance influence defines your alliance rank in the event, so you need to defend it at all costs.
All alliances are split into smaller teams for the event. Below you can see in which alliance team you will participate and your rank in the alliance.

Welcome, my Lord! My name is Diana, warrior of the Wildland Rebels and protector of the Great Empire.
In dark times like these it takes more than a victory on the battlefield to free the citizens of the realm. They need a ruler who can bring ruin to the dark forces across the land, and prosperity to the innocent. You are our only hope!
I will aid you in developing this humble pile of wood and stone into a vibrant castle!
But first we need to do some groundwork. Come, let me show you around.
Your castle requires an abundance of resources in order to thrive. Let us begin by building a woodcutter.
You can find new buildings in the build menu.
Tap the woodcutter and place it in the castle!

Now confirm the position.
You can relocate the building at any time.
Powerful castle lords have no time to wait around! Tap the highlighted button to skip construction time for free.
Good, you have built your first woodcutter. Now, let's increase its productivity!
Wood is an important building material. Upgrade your woodcutter to increase wood production in your castle.
You need lots of wood to construct and upgrade buildings in your castle, so remember to upgrade your woodcutters regularly.
Excellent! Now you are producing enough wood to construct more buildings.
Use the shortcut to finish your task faster.
Expand your castle walls to create more space for new buildings.

Expanding your castle walls will increase the building space inside your castle.
This option can be found in the build menu.
Open the build menu and select where you want to expand.
Each time you expand your castle walls, you will create more space for building. You will also create another tower base that can be upgraded to improve your defences.
Select the top expansion to enlarge your castle!

Collect taxes from your citizens to increase your war chest.

The Kingdom's League is a long-term event in which players can compete for rewards based on their combined progress during four league events: Nomad Invasion, Samurai Invasion,War of the Realms, and Bloodcrow Invasion.
The Kingdom's League consists of three major components:
- Division rankings, in which you compete against a limited number of players based on points earned from league events. - Kingdom titles, which determine the rewards you will receive during the event and your final season ranking. - Season rankings, which measure the progress each player has made during the entire Kingdom's League season.
Detailed information regarding each of these components can be found in the league guide.
All players above level {0} can take part in the Kingdom's League. Participation is automatic and comes at no cost.
Each season of the Kingdom's League lasts for a pre-determined number of event days. Each day a league event is active, a day is deducted from the league’s season runtime.
Please note that the Kingdom's League is completely independent from King Ludwig’s seasonal contests.

Tomorrow we will be offering you the chance to test our new event: BEYOND THE HORIZON

This will be a test and as such there might be some bugs that we need to iron out still. However we do hope that you will test this event for us and help us improve the event for the future. To that end we would like to let you know a few details about how the event works.

  • You need to be level 30 and a member of an Alliance before the event starts if you want to take part.
  • When you start you will be assigned to a new Alliance composed of the other members from your main account Alliance.
  • These new Alliances are restricted to twenty members and the first to join will be the Leader.
  • You will need to attack City States on the map to gain Influence.
  • This Influence is what your alliance needs to win the event.
  • Every day the Influence you have gained will be transferred to the vaults in the Alliance Capital.
  • Rivals will be able to attack you or the Alliance Capital to steal a portion of the accumulated Influence.
  • You and your Alliance members will have to focus on both attack and defence and only by organising well will you be able to compete and win this event.

We hope you enjoy our new event!
