"Every fortress has a weakness. Every defense a crack. The wolf waits and watches, and then strikes without mercy."
Years ago, he was just a whisper, a cautionary tale from the Great Empire's turbulent past. Wolfgard the Flayer: a cruel and cunning man, a traitor who once stood among the highest-ranking generals of the Empire, only to turn his back on his duty for the sake of ruthless ambition.
Wolfgard's eyes gleam with an unnerving, predatory intelligence. His wolf-like grin and sharp features are a chilling testament to his brutal nature. With a broadsword in one hand and a dagger in the other, he strikes with a ferocity that has earned him his fearsome moniker.
In the Empire's bygone days, Wolfgard was a scourge that spread fear throughout the land. His brutalities were infamous, as was his cadre of bandits and villains. The Weasel, his loyal henchman, and others like him razed villages, spread chaos across the green lands of the Empire, and even kidnapped noble maidens. But Wolfgard's ambition led to his downfall: after a defiant stand against his tyranny, his forces were scattered, and Wolfgard was exiled from the Empire he sought to bring down.
But nightmares do not die; they simply lay low between dawn and dusk… From the depths of his exile at the fringes of the Empire, Wolfgard watched and waited, plotting his return. Gathering a motley army of bandits and disloyal soldiers, the nefarious warlord prepared to unleash an onslaught that would shatter the Empire.
His return from exile sent shockwaves throughout the Empire. Wolfgard's brutal assault on General Horatio's fortress forced its loyal guardians into retreat. Yet, the cunning wolf would not reign victorious for long. Horatio regrouped and led the armies of the Empire's mighty lords and ladies against the bandit army, forcing the wolfish traitor to retreat once more. But even in defeat, Wolfgard's threats hung heavy in the air: "Don't cherish your victory, Horatio! You have not seen the last of me! You and your rotten Empire will be ground down to dust!"
The Empire celebrated the wolf's defeat, yet amidst the cheers and jubilation, Horatio and the lords and ladies of the realm remained wary. Wolfgard's ominous threats still echoed in their ears. The Empire must remain vigilant and united against this relentless predator.
For the cunning wolf bides his time until his victim shows signs of weakness… and then pounces!
Ushkal, the Thunder of the Steppes

“Hide in your fortresses, cower behind your walls. But know this, you are merely a small creature atop a high tree, trembling as the tide sweeps away all beneath. We are that flood, and like water, no force can hold us back!”
From the mysterious lands beyond the Fire Peaks, from plains unseen and untamed, comes the formidable figure of Ushkal. The loyal general of the Great Khan leads the nomadic hordes through the continent, their horses hooves like thunder, their determination as unyielding as the mountains themselves.
The nomads under Ushkal's command are as restless as the winds that sweep across their unseen homeland. They recognize no borders, no confines of kingdoms and empires, only the endless expanse of the world that stretches before them. They are creatures of freedom and fierce independence, taking what they need and going where they please. Their paths are drawn not by the lines of maps, but by the allure of the horizon and the beckoning of the unknown.
A titan among warriors, the formidable nomad general is a sight to behold. His favored weapons, a swift scimitar and sturdy round shield, are handled with strength and grace, relentless and unstoppable like a stampeding herd. Yet, Ushkal is no mere brute. His strength is matched by a sharp strategic mind, skilled in the arts of both offense and defense. His warriors are experts of the charge and the flanking attack, striking with the ferocity of a sandstorm. The camps they establish are akin to fortresses, heavily defended and fiercely protected, a testament to Ushkal's understanding of a well-rounded defense. For all his martial prowess, Ushkal is also a man of honor. Diplomats are treated with respect, and guests are greeted like kings, welcomed to partake in the nomads' feasts with bowls of fermented mare's milk and plates of juicy yak roast. His adversaries, including Lord Horatio, have found no fault in his hospitality, nor in his honor, even amid the trials of conflict. In fact, it is said that some of the Empire's finest pieces of art have been inspired by the nomads' intricate craftsmanship, their creations admired and prized throughout the land. And what stone-hearted knight or lady would not be moved to tears by the tragic and epic throat-singer ballad, “Flight of the nomad princess”.
But make no mistake, behind the honor and the feasts, the nomads are warriors to their core. They traverse kingdoms as they please, taking what they want. Any opposition is met with the thundering charge of the horde, trampling all resistance under their might. The steppes are free, and so are they. And anyone attempting to curtail their freedom will feel the full fury of Ushkal, the Thunder of the Steppes.

"Warrior's path winds, Beneath cherry blossoms' shade, Honor's face is masked."
From the heart of the Sunrise Kingdoms, where cherry blossoms dance in the wind and the warrior code of Bushido is law, emerges a formidable figure: Akechi, the Iron Shogun. A man of sharp contrast, he appreciates the tranquility of bonsai trees and the artful expression of kabuki theater. Akechi appears refined, his words are elegant and subtly cruel, insults and mockery carefully veiled behind the veneer of politeness. Yet, behind this façade of cultured sophistication, resides an ambitious warlord whose understanding of Bushido has been twisted by a lust for power. To Akechi, the path of the warrior is one of ceaseless battle and conquest. His distorted beliefs have spurred on brutal Samurai invasions of neighbouring realms, justified by a deluded sense of honor and duty.
Akechi's presence is formidable, his tall frame radiating a potent mix of strength and speed. His strikes, like his words, are swift and powerful, the calculated precision of a man who claims to be honorable. Yet, when threatened, he is known to cast aside his principles, unafraid to resort to dishonorable acts if they serve his agenda or preserve his life. His rivalry with the moderate General Takemura has been long-standing, a game of strategic maneuvering and power plays for the future and soul of the Sunrise Kingdoms. Less well-known but just as fierce are his games of Hanafuda with the honorable Oba-san. Despite all strategy and cunning, Akechi has yet to best the elder matriarch in this battle of wits and will. Yet, it is Sasaki, the Ronin Warrior, who poses the greatest affront to him. Her decision to abandon the Sunrise Kingdoms in defiance of his rule is a wound to his pride that has yet to heal. Her victory over him in combat is a scar on his honor that stings with every remembered blow. Akechi is prepared to repay Sasaki tenfold. Harakiri will be too easy a death for the honorless traitor. His aggression has not gone unanswered. His clashes with Toril and Horatio of the Great Empire were fierce, and his attempts to invade the Storm Islands were thwarted by the tenacious Alyssa. Despite his setbacks, Akechi is relentless, fueled by a grudge that runs deep and a determination that's frighteningly resilient.
Behind the curtain of politeness, in the silence of his bonsai garden, Akechi plots his next move. For him, the world is a stage, and he is both the actor and the director. Those who cross him best beware, for the Shogun's revenge is a play written in the ink of blood and tears. For Sasaki, his former protégé, he dreams of a fittingly tragic finale. For himself, he dreams that his name becomes a whisper of dread that lingers long after his armies have retreated.
"An autumn leaf falls, In the silence, steel whispers, Betrayal's cost paid."

"Fair turns foul, and foul turns fair / the foolish remain unaware / Soon, our nemesis despair / our rule they shan't forbear!”
Amidst the nobility of the Empire, a corrupt cabal casts a long, dark shadow. This is the sinister world of the Bloodcrows, led by the Twisted Matriarch, Baba Varjúka. A distorted reflection of the Empire’s nobility, she is a perverse parody of the grandeur and honor they embody, replacing these virtues with deceit and treachery. Baba Varjúka may hold the appearance of a noblewoman, but the cruel glint in her eyes and the venom in her words reveal a nature far from honorable. She moves among her enemies with the grace of a highborn lady, her words dripping with veiled threats and hollow courtesies.She embodies deceit where others bear honor, treachery where others engage in noble combat. Every utterance from her lips carries the potential for betrayal, every seemingly innocent gesture a precursor to a lethal strike from the dagger hidden behind her back. Her followers, the Bloodcrows, are the shadows within the Empire's nobility, a grim specter of its corruption and decadence. They are cunning predators lurking in the darkest forests and untamed mountains, emerging from the shadows whenever weakness is detected. They draw power from forbidden rituals and dark magic, twisting the essence of life itself to extend their influence and reach. The Bloodcrows are the bloodied talons that clutch at the Empire's heart, drawing strength from its lifeforce. The rumors whisper of Baba Varjúka's blood magic, providing her with a semblance of eternal youth, though her countenance betrays the terrible cost of such sorcery. In battle, she is a cunning predator, preferring to flank her enemies, lay traps, and employ deceit over face-to-face combat. Only a foolish general would underestimate the cunning crow and her fanatical followers. Old tales suggest that Baba Varjúka once had a hand in the upbringing of the young prince who would become the Emperor. Yet, Horatio, ever the protector even as a young squire, managed to sway the prince from her toxic influence and banished her from court. Since that day, Baba Varjúka has harbored a deep enmity for Horatio. Her animosity also extends to Leo, who has persistently hunted her followers through forests and mountains, and to Valenta, a priestess of the sun order who has led the charge against the spreading influence of the Bloodcrows. Despite the terror she instills, and the dark power she wields, Baba Varjúka serves as a grim reminder. She symbolizes the price of unchecked ambition and the cost of dark desires. Her twisted visage, despite her claims of eternal youth, bears the scars of her vile magic. Yet she remains, a dark specter in the Empire's core, a reminder that even in the heart of civilization, the siren song of ambition can lead to darkness.

From a dimension far removed from our comprehension, a formless shadow emerges beyond the veil of reality. Bathed in a pulsating purple light, a manifestation of an otherworldly threat materializes. These are the Strangers, mirror images of us, yet corrupted and disquieting. Their existence is a paradox. Leading these entities from a realm beyond the reach of our understanding is Nukh'raia, the Otherworldly Marauder.
Nukh'raia is a grotesque inversion of a general, a chilling corruption of the human form that disturbs as much as it frightens. Their presence causes the bravest of hearts to quiver, as though reality itself buckles and shivers under their cold, calculating gaze. The barbed weapon they swing, a warped echo of earthly arms, slices the air with a precision that’s bone-chillingly mechanical. Each swing is a harbinger of terror and despair. Survivors of encounters with Nukh'raia whisper tales of a being as cold as the deepest winter and as merciless as the decay of time. No sound escapes from the Stranger’s General, no emotion betrays their mask-like face. Silent and impassive, they command their swarm with an unspoken will that’s as absolute as it is terrifying.
Cold, efficient, relentless – the Strangers under Nukh'raia's command know no reason or negotiation. Their attacks on the Empire are executed with ruthless precision that’s soullessly mechanical. Borders of kingdoms, pleas of diplomats – all are meaningless in their icy gaze that sees only opportunities to dominate and to spread the insidious taint of the Otherworld. Their castles, suffused with an ominous purple light, stand not as testaments to grandeur, but as harbingers of a dread that taints the land. Every tower, every wall, is a macabre echo of human architecture, radiating an unnerving blend of familiarity and alienness.
Yet, despite the relentless horror that the Strangers represent, hope is not extinguished. The inexorable passage of time, an unyielding force in our realm, appears to be their sole adversary. After an onslaught, the Strangers are banished back to their enigmatic dimension, their sinister castles dissipating as if they were mere illusions. But the cold certainty of their return looms like a persistent nightmare. As long as Nukh'raia exists, peace is but a fleeting dream, a moment's respite in a reality forever stalked by the Otherworldly Marauder. Their objectives remain an enigma, their desires unknowable. Nukh'raia does not divulge their thoughts to mere mortals. And if they did… perhaps the truth might be more terrible than ignorance.

“Let the roar of House Gerbrandt echo through the heart of Berimond!"
In the war-torn realm of Berimond, a figure of regal bearing and unyielding resolve stands firm - Leopold III of House Gerbrandt. The sigil of the lion, etched in vibrant red, speaks of his fierce courage and the royal lineage he fervently claims to uphold. Whispers among his men speak of a savage lion's attack, its mark on Leopold’s face a constant reminder of his battle-hardened past. His feline features and regal bearing mask a mind of both calculating ambition and finely controlled rage.
Masterful in his approach to warfare, Leopold exercises a lion's patience, preferring strategic maneuvers to brute force. Yet, when stirred to anger, he strikes with the ferocity of his house's sigil, leaving foes quivering in the wake of his wrath. The battlefield reverberates with Leopold's maxim, "In the heart of a lion, patience fuels the fire. We bide our time, yet when we strike, our roar echoes and our power is felt."
Leopold’s disdain for his rival, Grimbert of Ursidae, runs as deep as the history of Berimond itself. He views Grimbert as nothing more than an uncouth upstart, a blemish on the noble face of Berimond, as well as a personal annoyance. Citizens and nobles alike report having seen the rivals brawl and duel, even in the streets of the imperial capital. Yet rumors persist of the two kings occasionally being spotted together at a tavern’s most hidden table, covered in bruises yet sharing a drink like old comrades. One might wonder to what degree our rivalries inspire us … Of course, both kings proclaim these rumors as mere vile slander.
Yet, Leopold's commitment to tradition and his unyielding belief in his birthright fuels his fiery resolve to preserve Berimond's past glory against Grimbert's ambition for change. Leopold III stands as a beacon of the old world, a staunch defender of his kingdom's proud lineage. The Lion of Berimond waits, watches, and when the moment comes, he strikes with the full fury of his namesake.
P.S.: "If Grimbert put as much time and effort into ruling as he does to seeing the bottom of a beer barrel, perhaps Berimond wouldn't be in such disarray!"

"Let the strength of Ursidae surge through the veins of Berimond!"
Amid the strife and chaos of Berimond, a warrior of raw power and unparalleled vigor stands against the tides of war - Grimbert of House Ursidae. The sigil of the bear, rendered in striking blue, encapsulates his indomitable strength and the daring nobility he earned through blood and valor. Grimbert, with his burly form, flaming red hair and rough features, is often mistaken as a mere brute, yet beneath this facade lies a cunning mind capable of surprising the most adept of tacticians.
Renowned for his direct and relentless approach to warfare, Grimbert believes in a show of power to crush his enemy's will. His thundering charge on the battlefield is likened to a bear's ferocious attack, eliciting both dread and respect from allies and adversaries alike. Grimbert's war doctrine resonates across the battlefields of Berimond, "In the heart of a bear, strength and valor make their home. We do not wait - we act. Our roar resounds and our strength is undeniable."
His rivalry with Leopold III of House Gerbrandt is legendary. Grimbert perceives Leopold as a snobbish and over-refined aristocrat, whose claim of rulership only stems from the name of his ancestors instead of his own deeds. Berimond needs direct and decisive rulership, not flowery words and empty pomp! Tales of their clashes resonate across the realm, their bitter disputes often unfolding in the most unexpected of places - from the heart of Berimond’s battlefield to the green meadows of the Great Empire, and even to the cobbled streets of the imperial capital itself! Yet whispers also speak of rare nights where the two kings, battered and bruised, share a drink in the dim light of a secluded tavern like old comrades. One might wonder to what degree our rivalries inspire us … Of course, both kings proclaim these rumors as nothing more than vile slander.
Unbound by the chains of tradition, Grimbert carries an unyielding belief in the potential of Berimond. He envisions a kingdom reborn in the glory of the present, discarding the shackles of the past.
The Bear of Berimond charges ahead, unyielding, and when the moment is right, he seizes victory with a might akin to his namesake.
P.S.: "Perhaps if Leopold spent less time grooming his mane and more on the battlefield, he might pose a real challenge!"

"Many names, many faces, but one dark purpose – greed knows no bounds."
As one navigates through the rugged landscapes of the Great Empire, scattered castles and towers dot the terrain, their menacing silhouettes stark against the skyline. Not the bastions of justice, but fortresses of fear, these are the domains of the Robber Barons. Whether cloaked in the darkness of the woods, nestled in mountain crags, or lurking in the foggy marshes, the Robber Barons command from their ill-gotten keeps, their eyes always hungry for the wealth and lands of others.
Names like Bolko, Gamareth, and Karasek have been whispered among the subjects of the Empire, each name bringing with it a chill of dread. But the name matters not, for the purpose is singular: to plunder, to seize, to dominate.
Many of these opportunistic warlords flocked to Wolfgard the Flayer's banner during his reign of terror, finding in him a kindred spirit of ruthless ambition. And even after Wolfgard's fall, the remnants of his dark legion continue their vile deeds, now under the banner of the Robber Baron General.
The Robber Barons remain a constant, unyielding threat to the prosperity of the Great Empire. Yet, the Empire's loyal subjects and brave lords and ladies stand firm. They refuse to bow to the lawless plunderers. Their courage and valor serve as a beacon of hope against the endless tide of the Robber Barons. For they know that unity is their strength, and determination their shield.
The Robber Barons may represent the cruel and relentless force of the Barons, but the Great Empire holds stalwart heroes of its own, ever ready to meet the challenge, ever willing to protect their realm.

"They call this place a wasteland, but it's merely the crucible from which the future will be forged." To the east of the Great Empire, the landscape drastically transforms. Mighty volcanoes dominate the horizon, their fiery hearts spewing grey ash and streams of lava. Dominating this harsh landscape are the mighty towers and fortresses of the dragon cult, guarded by the fiery beasts themselves, their dark and forbidding magic controlling these dreadful creatures of legend. Amidst these volatile lands, one woman rules with ruthless certainty: Yigris, Lady of the Flames. As lean as the dagger she wields with deadly precision, Yigris's quick wit and biting mockery can sting as much as her poisons. Her razor-sharp grin is a constant reminder of her capacity for cruelty, a testament to her unwavering commitment to uphold the cult's ruthless rule. She is a woman of great ambition, not content to dominate only her volcanic realm. Yigris has grander plans. She seeks to undermine the Great Empire, to rot it from within, to bring it to its knees. A bitter betrayal marked Yigris rise to power. She and her cousin Toril were raised to be the cult's leaders. But where Toril chose to escape the cruelties of the cult, Yigris betrayed her cousin and stabbed her with a poisoned blade. While Toril escaped with her life intact, Yigris rose to rule the cult unopposed. A lean woman with short hair and a face as sharp as a razor blade, Yigris rules with a wicked grin and a dagger as quick as her tongue. Her barbed humor is as lethal as the poisons she expertly crafts. Unafraid to employ dark and forbidden magics, she wields her power with deadly precision, aiming to undermine the Empire and corrode its foundations. Despite her power and the terror she spreads, Yigris has made enemies of her own. Her cousin Toril, now a fierce warrior of the Empire, seeks vengeance for Yigris's betrayal and strives to end the cruel reign of fire. Their conflict is personal, a clash of blood turned bitter. The ronin warrior Sasaki, ambushed by the cultists during her journey from the Sunrise Kingdoms to the Great Empire, remains another potent adversary.
In the desolate reaches of the Fire Peaks, under the brooding gaze of dragons and the watchful eyes of her cult, Yigris plots. She will stop at nothing to ensure the fall of the Empire, to watch it crumble and burn, just like the lands she so proudly commands. As the Lady of the Flames, Yigris is a force to be reckoned with. Those who dare to challenge her better learn from Toril’s mistake… and watch their back…

It is said that these warriors once battled giant serpents.
A blade from the Far East, forged in the light of the rising sun.
A symbol of power that was personally awarded by the Great Khan.
The leather of the yak offers great protection along with comfort.
A masterpiece of eastern blacksmithing. Meant to be worn by the Great Khan alone.
This helmet was worn in many battles, serving both as protection and as a crown.
A symbol of the Great Khan's absolute power.
Once belonged to a legendary warrior of the House of Gerbrandt.
This scepter once belonged to the proud rulers of the Blade Coast.
The thorn armor was carved from a gigantic iron thorn.
The dark weapon of a necromancer, charged with the icy breath of death.
Gives its wearer the strength of the Bear.
Once belonged to the Prince of the Deep.
Shows the way through even the roughest oceans.
Combines solid protection with beautiful elegance.
"The Lion's mane will teach his enemies the meaning of fear!"
The helmet of the Necromancer has unfathomable powers.
A demonic artifact, surrounded by an aura of chaos.
Temporarily gives your army the guise of a horde of terrifying death knights.
Temporarily gives your army the guise of a horde of terrifying death knights.
Temporarily makes your castle look like a fearsome demon fortress.
A legendary helmet from the northern lands – it never gets warm.
A breastplate of the legendary Frozen Guard of the north.
Named after the morning sun. Its gleaming surface leaves enemies blind.
The mask of the Iron Sultan. Nobody ever glimpsed his true face.
This armor was crafted from thousands of little metal discs.
Select an equipment item and tap the equip button to equip it.
Here you can see detailed information about the selected equipment item.
One shot from this bow brought an end to 150 years of war.
A thick breastplate that protected the Executioner from his many enemies.
Whether a noble or simple soldier, all stand equal before this mighty battleaxe.
No one knows who the Executioner was. His face always remained hidden under his helmet.
This lantern's light once shone brightly across the battlefields of the Great Empire.
This dazzling breastplate perfectly reflects the extravagant lifestyle of its former wearer.
This sword is as beautiful as it is deadly.
The Radiant's enemies once trembled in fear upon seeing the gleam of this magnificent helmet.
This splendid goblet was crafted especially for the Radiant.
Temporarily makes your castle look like a magnificent shining palace.
Temporarily causes your troops to appear as a dazzling army under the beams of the sun.
Temporarily makes your castle shine in the crystal radiance of the Underworld.
Temporarily makes your castle look like a fearsome demon fortress.
Temporarily gives your army the guise of a horde of terrifying death knights.
The warrior who wears this breastplate will not rest until his enemy has breathed his last.
No arrow launched from this bowstring made of a stag's tendon has ever missed its target.
This helmet leaves every enemy awestruck in battle.
Gives its bearer the speed of an animal.
Hardened in snake blood, this breastplate repels all blades with ease.
Like a bloodthirsty reptile, this weapon leads a lethal life of its own in battle.
It is said the bearer of this helmet can see their opponents even in the blackest darkness.
The owner of this artifact can attack their enemies with the force and speed of a snake.
Forged in the smithies of the Underworld, this breastplate recalls a bygone age.
Originally designed to split rocks, this axe also deals with pesky enemies quickly and brutally.
Protects its wearer from axes, swords and rockfalls.
Its bright gleam always illuminates the right path through the darkness.
Carved from solid stone. Can only be used against fiends.
Withstands the heaviest storms of arrows. Can only be used against fiends.
The crystal tip will pierce any gate. Can only be used against fiends.
Your melee soldiers are filled with strength and courage. Can only be used against fiends.
The crystal bolts turn all walls to dust. Can only be used against fiends.
The wearer of this armor can slip through the darkness without a sound.
Sharp and swift like a raptor's claws.
Its owner was both a warrior and a scholar.
Its piercing gaze can expose any lie.
Only the strongest warriors on the Storm Islands may wear this wooden breastplate.
Crafted from the tip of a stingray's tail, this spear will also pierce steel armor with ease.
Like the monster of the deep, this helmet strikes fear into the hearts of your enemies.
This was once a gift from a princess to a young warrior.
A warrior is said to have swum to Everwinter Glacier with this armor.
Said to transform its wearer into a supernatural being.
A chief sought to use this to express his love for a woman. He died lonely.
As tough as the most stubborn ram.
Decides every battle in favor of its owner.
This helmet will destroy anything in its path.
Although originally made for drinking, this horn is also useful as a heavy weapon.
Protected Dorgo from every danger - except for an old woman's revenge.
With this sword, Dorgo sealed the fate of the previous Khan.
Prevented the unworthy from gazing upon the mightiness of Dorgo's face.
Designated its carrier as a messenger sent by Dorgo himself.
Once one of the Khan's personal bodyguards, his loyalties now lie with you.
You need at least 3 equipment items of the same rarity to use autofill.
You don't own enough gems to use the autofill.
A ruthless warrior from another world.
Evidence of the invaders' twisted concept of beauty.
An evil power flows through this artifact.
These sharp prongs were always sure to leave a scar.
Gave the foreign warlord the power to break into our world.
Significantly increases loot when plundering a castle
Makes your castle look like it's floating among the clouds.
Gives you the reflexes and swiftness of a bird of prey.
This sword harnesses the searing wrath of the Winged Knight to defeat every enemy.
Every sip from this goblet lends you wings and inspires you to achieve great deeds.
Sharpens your eyesight so you can see straight through any ploy.
Quiet as a gentle breeze, but deadly as a hurricane.
Makes your army look like clansmen hungry for battle.
Each Highland clan wears its own unique pattern.
Sealed the fate of the last McBundy.
One blast of this bagpipe drove off the monster of Loch Lomond for good.
Protects your head from both axes and the cold, damp Highland climate.
As temperamental and unpleasant as the weather in his homeland.

If you want to keep the equipment you've just won, you have to make space for it in your inventory first.
Sell all of the equipment you've won

Equipment items that you won in events or from looting aren't lost if your inventory is full. You can sell old equipment to make space in your inventory. You can also sell the equipment you've won for coins if you have no use for it.

You still have items that aren't stored in your inventory. If you close the dialog, these items will automatically be sold for coins.

Unlock extra permanent inventory spots using rubies
You can purchase extra inventory spots for rubies. The spots will remain permanently unlocked.

News for the most powerful lords of castles.

Hear the news from your kingdom: Your skilled leadership is bearing fruit. The most talented citizens have dedicated themselves to research.
Build them a research tower to benefit from their talents. Their work will be of value in many areas of life at the castle. Research may provide helpful results, such as improved resource production, higher tax revenues, and stronger troops.
Your architects have also increased the upgrade levels of several buildings.
Advance your castle quickly, and be a pioneer of research.
The hunter has xxxxx food for you

have you heard the news from your kingdom yet? A skilled hunter is traveling across your land, and offers you his services.
Send him to hunt in the forests nearby, and enjoy the bountiful game he returns with. Your subjects and soldiers will thank you for the additional food.
To prove his talent, he has already hunted xxxx food for you.
Follow this link to accept the food.
Use the merchant to increase your trading power

Hear the news from your kingdom: an enterprising merchant has found his way to your castle.
His experience will help your trade to flourish. Hire him and secure the option to transport more goods across your country. Your allies will reward your generosity with their eternal loyalty.

News of far-away lands has reached your court: three new territories –dominated by desert, ice and volcanoes– are waiting for you to conquer them and secure their wealth. Build a new castle in each kingdom to serve as bases for your campaigns, on which you will conquer valuable resources. But beware, the locals and feuding upstarts will challenge your ownership, and will wrest them from you if you are not careful.
Seize the opportunity and rise to become ruler of the new kingdoms!

SHADOW UNITS The shady shadow mercenaries are roaming the land in search of some unscrupulous work. They will fight your enemies discreetly, given ample payment. Keep an eye out for their arrival.
IMPROVED NOTIFICATIONS Do you want to know what goes on in your castle in your absence? Then make use of improved notifications and find out when construction finishes, taxes have been collected or recruitment is completed.
EASY CONSTRUCTION Handling buildings and decorative items in the castle has been improved. Press down on an object and you will be taken straight to the castle’s building mode.
NEW LANGUAGES From now on you can also play Empire: Four Kingdoms in Japanese and Greek. To do so, change the language in the game’s settings.
A HOST OF IMPROVEMENTS We never rest in Empire, which is why Empire: Four Kingdoms constantly sees new improvements.
If you have any ideas or suggestions you’d like to tell us, register in the Empire: Four Kingdoms forum and discuss them with other castle lords and ladies.
http://en.board.goodgamestudios.com/empirefourkingdoms
Become a fan on Facebook and stay up to date:
https://www.facebook.com/EmpireFourKingdoms

Please remember to rate the app after each update!

NEW BUILDINGS - There are 5 new buildings and 20 new upgrade levels!
NEW RESEARCH - New levels in various fields of research for you to discover!

New units and building upgrade levels! - Unlock marauders, pyromaniacs and renegades in one-day events in the new kingdoms. - The architect event allows you to upgrade your buildings to new levels.
More tactical battles! - Make your strategic prowess count: Now plan attacks in several attack waves.
Improved alliance functions! - Now keep up with conversations in your alliance all the time in the new mini alliance chat. - The new attack horn warns you in advance whenever a member of your alliance is under attack.
Lots more improvements! You can find the complete list of improvements in the game forum!

- Unlock new units and building upgrade levels in one-day events!
- Plan your attacks with tactical acumen thanks to the new attack waves!
- Alliance improvements: A new alliance chat and attack warnings for your friends!
- Lots more improvements. You can find the complete list of improvements in the game forum!

ACHIEVEMENT SYSTEM Complete achievements to collect points and earn rubies!
NEW GRAPHICS Four building levels have new high-quality graphics!
FASTER RECRUITMENT Hold feasts to increase recruitment speed!
FASTER SPIES Agents are now 800% faster!
IMPROVED TAX SYSTEM End tax collection early - now for free!
FOUR NEW GLORY TITLES Recruit units of the Kingsguard!
You can find a list of all the changes in the forum.
CLIENT OPTIMIZATION Lots of technical improvements to the client performance

EQUIPMENT SYSTEM Deploy your commanders and castellans strategically! Use bonuses from equipment when attacking and defending! Get new equipment when plundering!
SMITHY Forge old equipment items into new ones!
EQUIPMENT TRADER Get new equipment packs!
TECHNICUS Improve equipment items and their bonuses!
STRATEGIC ATTACK PLANNING Make the most of an extra unit and tool slot for frontal attacks!
CLIENT IMPROVEMENTS Fixes for smaller bugs

MORE FOOD PRODUCTION Send woodcutters and stonemasons hunting for extra food!
MORE GLORY AND HONOR Earn glory more easily and lose no honor if your attacks are defeated!
MARKET BARROWS Increase the capacity of your market barrows forever!
THEMED EQUIPMENT PACKS Get special themed packs for attacking or defending from the equipment trader!
NEW PRIME DAYS Secure yourself loads of unique rewards!

NOBILITY CONTEST Test yourself in different disciplines! Collect points to win rewards! Earn special rewards by being one of the best!
FASTER UNITS Conquer even more villages with the speedy Everwinter Glacier renegades!
LOTS OF TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS Fixes for problems with connection interruptions and restarts!
NEW ACHIEVEMENTS Add to your collection with achievements for equipment items!

BIGGER ALLIANCES Space for 15 members from the start! Existing alliances will be refunded the rubies for the first upgrades!
NEW NOBILITY CONTEST Collect glory points in attacks for the biggest version of the nobility contest!
SELL EQUIPMENT ITEMS! Sell equipment for coins whenever you want! The better the quality of the equipment, the more you get!
Achievements via Google Play Game Services!
CLIENT IMPROVEMENTS Crashes on the world map have been fixed

CAPITALS Claim a capital for your alliance! Build a palace! Recruit Kingsguard attackers and defenders!
ROYAL TOWERS Capture royal towers for attack bonuses on capitals!
OPEN ALLIANCES Find new members for your alliance more easily! Join alliances automatically!
NEW COLOSSUS Build a large horseman statue!
PERFORMANCE Optimized working memory!

NEW RESOURCES Now you can produce charcoal, olive oil, and glass in Everwinter Glacier, Burning Sands, and Fire Peaks! Trade the new resources for special units and unique equipment!
NEW LEVEL Go all the way up to level 70! Unlock new upgrade levels for buildings!
MISSIONS Complete missions at the mercenary post to collect valuable rewards!
NEW LOGIN BONUS Get at least three gifts every day!

NEW RESEARCH Upgrade your research tower and improve your castle and troops! Visit the researcher's camp for new discoveries!
MORE COMPETITION Battle for valuable rewards in the new rankings for your level range!
NEW MARAUDER EVENT Donate resources, collect points, and receive great rewards!
HIGHER ALLIANCE LEVEL Climb all the way up to level 50 with your alliance!
VIP SYSTEM Stay a step ahead with exclusive bonuses!

NEW GLORY TITLES Unlock veteran kingsguards with new titles! Collect as many glory points as possible to earn the title of the Invincible!
LOOT COINS Attack other castle lords and get extra free coins!
CAPITALS IN OTHER KINGDOMS Capture capitals in other kingdoms to recruit powerful renegade units!
QUICK RELOCATION Move your castle to another place more quickly!

BLADE COAST Support Queen Namia in the battle against the treacherous pirate Captain Redbeard! Collect precious pearls and trade them in for unique rewards!
ALLIANCE HELP Ask your alliance members to help you with recruitment and you'll get extra units for free!
TRADING METROPOLISES Capture trading metropolises to earn a bonus on food production for your entire alliance!
WHEEL OF FORTUNE Test your luck and win valuable prizes!

INVASION OF THE FOREIGN EMPIRE Fight mighty warriors from other worlds in epic PvP battles!
BANNER OF GLORY Receive more glory points from attacks!
AUTOMATIC WAR DECLARATION Now you have the option to choose if attacks and failed sabotages should automatically trigger the state of war!
BOOKMARKS Easily find locations on the world map!
BUILDING Control and monitor your building processes with the new progress circle!

NEW EVENT: THE BATTLE FOR BERIMOND From level 30, you can join one of two factions and fight for the throne in this brand new PVP event!
RECRUITMENT PROGRESS BARS Ongoing recruitments can now be tracked in the castle view like construction processes.
INCOMING ALLIANCE ATTACKS The number of incoming attacks on you and your alliance will now be displayed next to the horn.
NEW COLORS SHOW UNIT STRENGTH You can now recognize units’ strength from their colors.

THE LEGENDARY LEVELS All lords who reach level 70 unlock new legendary levels, going as high as legendary level 500, granting them access to new buildings, skills, and powerful bonuses.
REWORKED HOSPITAL A portion of all troops lost during battle will be automatically admitted to the hospital. These units can be healed so that they can fight again!
AUTOFILL FOR ATTACKS Use this function to automatically select the best arrangement of soldiers and tools for your attack.

NEW EVENT AND KINGDOM: THE STORM ISLANDS You can now set out on a new adventure from level 35! Send your troops to a faraway archipelago full of valuable aquamarine. A small castle with a few buildings and decorative items will serve as your base there. Earn points alongside your fellow alliance members by collecting as much aquamarine as possible. Every participant has the chance to win valuable rewards, and the leader of the most successful alliance will be declared the Storm Lord!

FACEBOOK CONNECT Now you can access your Empire: Four Kingdoms account from any device: simply log in with Facebook! You can also invite new players into the game!
INVITE A FRIEND With the new invite system, you and your friends can get all kinds of rewards for playing on the same server. Join forces and reap the benefits - this is what we call a win-win situation!
FRIENDS LIST On the friends list, you will be able to see all of the friends you’ve invited on the same server.

NOMAD INVASION Call to arms! In this new event, available from level 6, nomad camps of various levels appear on the world map and start attacking you. Rally your alliance and defend your Empire to earn rewards!
ALLIANCE BOOSTS Big alliances can now activate temporary boosts with different effects, such as increasing combat strength in attack or defense.
WHEEL OF FORTUNE OPTIMIZATION Among other optimizations you can now win the prized decorative item Mighty Crystal Palace.
The House of Gerbrandt: {0}% - The House of Ursidae: {1}%
The enemy's capital has been destroyed! You can now destroy enemy camps with normal attacks to drive them from Berimond. The battle is won once all your enemies have been crushed!

A decisive attack is the only thing that's going to help now! Protection mode has been deactivated for all camps in Berimond.

NEW ALLIANCE POINTS EVENT In the “War of the Realms” event you can now earn points and win exciting rewards together with your alliance members. All glory points that alliance members receive for attacking and defending will count directly towards the contest and give your alliance a higher position in the ranking list. QUEST OVERVIEW IN HUD From now on you can check the progress of all your local quests in the HUD.

FACEBOOK GIFTS Once every 24 hours, each of your friends can send you a gift and you can send one to them. The gifts will be randomly selected, so you can look forward to receiving lots of surprises in return for sending gifts to your friends. FACEBOOK FRIENDS LIST You can now see the Facebook picture and name, the coat of arms, and a link to the player info of all your friends that are playing Empire: Four Kingdoms. They just have to be connected to Facebook and on the same server as you.

NEW HERO SYSTEM You can now use new heroes to boost the effects and alter the appearances of your castellans and commanders! They can even increase their effects beyond the normal limits. Heroes come in five different rarities and can be obtained as rewards from certain traders and defeated NPCs. But choose wisely, some heroes might have a negative effect as well.
NOBILITY CONTEST Four new conditions now give you the chance to collect even more points.

HALL OF LEGENDS Unlock powerful attack and defense bonuses to use against legendary players and other enemies in your kingdoms! Upgrading the hall gives you legendary points to use in your skill tree to become even more legendary!
SAMURAI INVASION From level 10, you can face our newest enemy, the samurai. Put an end to their invasion and fight their camps for loot and glory points. Compete in single player and alliance competitions to get new rewards for your effort!
Earn glory in battle against other castle lords and receive powerful titles.

Due to new legislation, current jurisdiction, and technical change, we have revised and amended our Terms and Conditions (“T&C”) for you.
You can find the new T&C in full here:
http://www.goodgamestudios.com/terms-conditions/
Should you not wish to accept the changes to the T&C, you have to object within four weeks of receiving this message. If you do not object within this period, the changes will be deemed accepted.

MONUMENTS Team up with your alliance to capture and upgrade all these new landmarks! You can find rare and ordinary monuments all across the Great Empire. Captured monuments grant the owner's entire alliance a glory bonus for all attacks! Every month, the monuments move to new positions on the map and reset to their base levels, so the hunt for them begins anew!
UPDATED REWARDS Rewards for the samurai invasion and alliance/single player tournament have been updated!
Increases the number of coins looted in nomad camps
High bonus on coins looted from nomad camps
Extreme bonus on coins looted from nomad camps

BRAND NEW GEMS Head into battle and loot shiny gems from robber barons to improve your equipment! Hold your weapons high and look forward to receiving gems as a reward! You will loot gems or equipment randomly during attacks and once attached to your armor, these gems will give you awesome effects.
GEM CRAFTING Enhance new gems in the smithy and use coins to increase the success rate. Improve them up to level 10 and increase your power!

MIGHT POINTS With our new might points system you can reveal your true power! Increase your might value with might factors like units, equipment, heroes and buildings! By reaching a certain number of might points you will also be granted nice rewards! Your might will also be shown in the alliance members list.
NEW RANKINGS To keep up with other players the might points will be introduced with its very own new rankings which will become the default rankings.

DAILY IMPROVEMENTS Activity pays out! The daily activities have been reworked with new and better rewards! All players will also receive a fresh new login bonus! Log in on a daily basis to receive increasingly more valuable rewards.
GLORY MEMORIAL Get even more glory out of your hard-fought battles. This new premium building provides a permanent bonus on glory gained! It can be built once per kingdom and the higher the level, the more glory and public order it will provide!
Shortens the waiting time by {0} minutes
Shortens the waiting time by {0} hours

TIME SKIPS Are you still waiting for construction times and cool-downs to pass? Skip the time! These all-new looted and awarded consumables decrease your waiting times. Time skips can range from one minute to 24 hours!
ALL-NEW REWARD POPUP A tidy house, a tidy mind! When logging in again after getting some fancy rewards, you will now be able to see them all in one single window that will display which rewards come from which event.
Use these to pay for racehorses or racing ships to increase the travel speed of your armies.

GIFT PEDDLER Be generous and make your friends happy! This new event lets you purchase and send gift packages to any player of your choice. Gifts can be resources, coins, premium tools and equipment items and will wind up in the receiver's main castle in the Great Empire.
THE ROYAL POST This is our new in-game blog. It will provide updates, articles, interviews, concept art and much more so you always have the most exclusive information right at the tip of your thumb!

Fusion coins can be used to purchase fusion materials and begin standard fusion processes.

Decoration dust is a fusion material required for upgrading the decoration forge and assembling catalysts. Dust can be disassembled from catalysts, earned as event rewards, or purchased from the forge markets with fusion coins or rubies.
Tickets can be used to spin the wheel of fortune outside your castle. You can earn tickets as event rewards or buy them with rubies.
Our new subscription package cannot currently be purchased on iOS. This is a known issue and it will be resolved very soon. Thank you for your patience and apologies for the inconvenience.
The issues with the iOS subscription packages have been resolved. The packages are now available for purchase. Thank you for your patience!
Can be used for buying or upgrading private resource villages.
Open the help dialog for further information
War effort points are awarded for fulfilling alliance contracts.

Daimyo castles appear on the world map of the Great Empire and can be spied on and attacked. Each Daimyo castle starts at level 1 and has its own rank. The level and rank of a Daimyo castle define how difficult the castle is to defeat and the value of the rewards you will receive for attacking. Rewards come in the form of loot, samurai medals and shogun points.

Townships appear on the world map of the Great Empire and can be supported with units and tools in order to defend them against Daimyo attacks. To trigger an attack on a township, you have to taunt a Daimyo castle. Each Township starts at level 1 and has its own rank. The level and rank define how difficult the township is to defend and the value of the rewards you will receive for defending. Rewards come in the form of loot, samurai medals and shogun points.

Earned by attacking Daimyo castles or defending townships during the Legion of the Daimyos event. Can be traded for rewards in the Daimyo shop. You gain 1 Bushido point for every samurai token you collect.
Earned by attacking Daimyo castles or defending townships during the Legion of the Daimyos event. Required to level up Daimyo castles and townships, and fulfill alliance contracts.
Increases the amount of samurai medals earned when attacking Daimyo castles or defending townships.
Increases the amount of shogun points earned when attacking Daimyo castles or defending townships.
Can be used to activate temporary alliance boosts. Once gained, doubloons are directly credited to the alliance funds.
Can be used to activate temporary alliance boosts. Once gained, doubloons are directly credited to the alliance funds.
A finely crafted coin of decent value. Can be exchanged for valuable rewards at the Master Blacksmith.
A finely crafted coin of significant value. Can be exchanged for valuable rewards at the Master Blacksmith.
A finely crafted coin of immense value. Can be exchanged for valuable rewards at the Master Blacksmith.
Influence can be gained by controlling certain areas or by successfully attacking enemies.
Alliances are ranked by alliance influence. The influence of all alliance members is stored in the capital.
Increases the amount of influence you gain from successfully attacking enemy castle lords. Unused boosters will be lost at the end of the event.
Increases the influence points gained from enemy capitals. The costs are paid using the alliance funds.

Each alliance has its own capital on the world map that is owned by the alliance leader. Capitals store the alliance influence, which defines the rank in the alliance rankings. By succesfully attacking enemy capitals, players can get influence and the capital will lose alliance influence.
The palace is a unique building that unlocks very powerful units in the barracks of every member of your alliance.
Increases public order in your capital

City states are a special kind of place on the world map that you can capture. Each city state grants the owner influence at the end of the occupation time. Once the occupation time ends, the city state will vanish into the jungle. Each castle lord can only own one city state.
The altar reduces the occupation time needed to get the influence. With each altar level, the time decreases even further.

Cultist shrines are enemy sites on the world map. You can attack them to loot resources, equipment items, and rubies. The more often you defeat a cultist shrine, the higher its level gets, along with the amount of resources and the quality of the items you can loot. The levels increase only for you, not for other castle lords. From time to time, cutlists attack your castles as well.

Observation towers are a special kind of place on the world map that you can capture. Unlike castles, you can station units here, but you can't construct any buildings. Observation towers give your alliance a combat bonus when attacking capitals and city states.
Can be used to activate temporary alliance boosts. Once gained, doubloons are directly credited to the alliance funds.
Can be used to activate temporary alliance boosts. Once gained, doubloons are directly credited to the alliance funds.
Can be used to activate temporary alliance boosts. Once gained, doubloons are directly credited to the alliance funds.
Can be used to activate temporary alliance boosts. Once gained, doubloons are directly credited to the alliance funds.
Stores the alliance influence of your alliance
Provides an attack bonus on capitals and city states
Grants the owner influence after the occupation time

Alliances are ranked according to the number of statuettes collected by all the alliance's members during the event.

Increases each time one of your jungle shrines is defeated. Once a day the number of statuettes collected by the alliance decreases according to the penalty value.
A rare and valuable coin. Can be used to unlock Sovereign skills.

The production and consumption of food have temporarily been frozen for all players on this server. During the freeze: - Food production in all castles will be suspended. - Units will neither consume food nor will they be lost to starvation.
You will be notified via an in-game message as soon as the food freeze has ended.

The production and consumption of food and mead have temporarily been frozen for all players on this server. During the freeze: - Food and mead production in all castles will be suspended. - Units will neither consume food nor mead, nor will they be lost to starvation.
You will be notified via an in-game message as soon as the food and mead freeze has ended.

The freeze has ended. Production and consumption of food have resumed normally for all players on this server: - Food production has resumed in all castles. - Units have resumed food consumption and can be lost to starvation again.
All changes apply since the moment this message has been sent out to the players on this server.

The freeze has ended. Production and consumption of food and mead have resumed normally for all players on this server: - Food and mead production has resumed in all castles. - Units have resumed food and mead consumption and can be lost to starvation again.
All changes apply since the moment this message has been sent out to the players on this server.
Increases the productivity of all apiaries in all your castles.
Increases the productivity of all breweries in all your castles.
Assign this build item to any building you like to improve it. To do this, you need a level 1 construction yard in your castle.
Assign to its respective building to improve efficiency for a limited time. Build item boosters can also be applied.
Apply to a temporary build item to boost its effect and reset its timer to 48 hours.
Apply to a temporary build item to boost its effect and reset its timer to 60 hours.
Apply to a temporary build item to boost its effect and reset its timer to 36 hours.

The total number of cargo points of your alliance members determines which rewards you will receive when the moon storm arrives.
This allows us to connect you with your friends and helps our trusted partners personalize your experience by showing you ads that match your interests.
Your soldiers will not starve while food consumption is frozen.
This reward will be added to the alliance treasury.
Your soldiers will not be lost while mead consumption is frozen.
An exclusive token of unfathomable value. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
Tool limit in a single wave
A festive charm of rare value. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
A festive charm of rare value. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
As valuable as they are beautiful. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
A majestic token of unfathomable value. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
A rare token from far-eastern realms. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
A common key that allows you to open a Mystery Box.
A epic key that allows you to draw from high-tier rewards. Can only be obtained through mystery boxes.
A legendary key that allows you to draw from high-tier rewards. Can only be obtained through mystery boxes.
A rare key that allows you to draw from high-tier rewards. Can only be obtained through mystery boxes.
A unique token for a festive occasion. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
A spooky token that seems to be cursed. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
This chilling token is as valuable as it is freezing. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
Tool maximum amount in attack support wave
This enchanted token returns unfathomable luck and wealth to its beholders. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.

Exchange excess sceats for valuable wares. Spend your skill points before you reach the maximum sceat stock limit. Be aware that sceats are also used to unlock sovereign skills in the Hall of Legends.
These golden tokens of the sun god were found in ancient jungle shrines. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
These golden skull tokens were minted from pirates' loot. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
Join our community for the latest news
This token was made from precious red gold, melted in dragon fire. Can be exchanged for rewards at the Master Blacksmith for a limited time.
Here you have a global overview of the important contents of your castle and all your outposts.

The world map shows your castles and those of the other castle lords. The robber baron castles are represented by towers. Whenever you defeat one, the tower will burn. There are outposts that castle lords can capture. These contain valuable resources. You can also search for other castle lords by their honor or coordinates.
You need active sword brothers to be able to hire agents and commanders.
Here you can communicate with other alliance members.

Here you get an overview of diplomatic relations with other alliances.
To enter into a diplomatic relationship with another alliance, find a member of that alliance on the world map.
Your members can collect glory points to make the alliance level up! Every time you reach a new level, you'll receive a big reward that goes directly to your alliance funds!
The leader can change the name and description of the alliance here. In addition, members of certain ranks can send mass messages.
Here you have an overview of all members of this alliance.
Here is a list of all castle lords who have requested to join your alliance. Only members with certain rights can let in new members.
This is an overview of your alliance. Here you can always see the current announcements as well as a chronicle listing all important events.
Here you can change the rank of a member, which determines his rights within the alliance.

Here you can find an overview of potential members for your alliance.
Tap on members to see more information about them and invite them to join your alliance.

Every member can contribute to the alliance funds to allow the leader and generals to expand the alliance and make substantial improvements.
Please keep in mind that you need to be a member of this alliance for at least 24 hours to be able to donate to the alliance funds.
This is a castle lord's request to join your alliance. Now it's up to you whether or not to accept this lord.
Here you can write directly to an alliance leader and request to join their alliance.
An enemy army is on its way to you! The closer they get to your castle, the more you can find out about their soldiers.

This is a marching army. Here you can see the exact composition of its ranks.
The larger the marching army, the sooner it will be detected by the enemy.
This army is on its way back. The soldiers are bringing looted goods with them and can be deployed again once they return.
Here you can see a detailed battle report. Tap on the numbers to get a comparison. If none of your soldiers return, you won't get any information about the enemy.
If you don't have a commander available, you can hire an extra commander for this attack!

If you hire an overseer, the productivity of your production buildings will increase considerably for the next few days.
The overseer can be used for all wood, stone and food production buildings at the same time.
All the remaining troops that couldn't be posted on the castle wall are at the Keep. You can also place extra defense tools here.
Building a moat or castle moat helps defend your castle against attacks. You can also position certain tools here to further boost your defense. Villages don't have moats, however.
Here you can determine the ratio of ranged and melee soldiers on this section of the castle wall.
Here you can decide which units should be given priority when deployed on the castle wall.

Use the slider to set the distribution of soldiers along the three wall sections. You can also set the ratio of melee and ranged soldiers for each section of the wall. Finally, this is where you can place powerful defense tools.

Expanding the castle wall section by section will give you more space for buildings and you'll receive a new tower base each time.
You can either expand the castle wall at an early stage in exchange for rubies or a few levels later for resources.
If you start your own alliance, you become its leader. Invite other castle lords to join and form a powerful union!

These rankings list the accomplishments of all the castle lords in the entire kingdom.
There are also overall and weekly rankings and you can choose the criteria to sort the rankings by.
If you have declared war on an alliance, its members will be marked in red on the map.
In the castle management screen, you can change your coat of arms and change the name of your castle. You can also activate various local and global effects.

If you hire a marauder, your soldiers will acquire even more resources and coins from the storehouses of other castles and robber baron castles. Even if the loot is actually more than they could carry!
These market barrows transport resources back and forth between castles.
A physician lets more of your defending soldiers survive an attack on your castle.

Here you can see all of your messages. These are also filtered by different categories, such as battle reports and espionage reports.
System messages are automatic notifications, for example the outcome of a battle.
You can change your message display by selecting one of the categories displayed above. You can also view sent messages or archive messages. And if a player is harassing you, you can ignore them in order to block any more messages from that player.

This is a report on the outcome of a battle that your troops fought!
Consult the battle report if you would like more information about the battle.

This is a message from another castle lord. You can reply to them directly if you'd like.
You can also report them if their royal manners leave something to be desired.

Here you can write a message to another castle lord.
But be warned, the Great Emperor will not allow noblemen to insult each other in an undignified manner.
To prevent scams and harassment, the number of messages that can be sent per day is limited.

Here you can write a message to all members of your alliance.
To prevent scams and harassment, the number of messages a single alliance member can send per day is limited. Each message recipient counts towards the message limit.
Here you can see an overview of all movements on the world map. You can see your own troops, as well as those of your enemies and allies, as they approach you.
If you sign a non-aggression agreement with an alliance, you both agree not to attack each other. Members of the alliance are marked in white on the world map.
If you have a pact with an alliance, you both pledge to help each other and can no longer attack each other. Alliances that have formed pacts are marked in yellow on the world map.
Here you can see all the information about this castle lord at a glance.

Here you can see a list of all the current quests. These assignments give you experience points and allow you to advance an experience level.
Select a particular quest to see more information about it.
You've completed the quests and can now receive the reward. Once you complete a quest, you will usually be offered a new one.

Here you can see the assignments you need to complete to finish the quest. You can also see what reward to expect.
The quest giver will often provide some handy hints relating to his assignments too.

You can recruit soldiers here. Simply select a unit and enter the amount you want and a stack of up to five soldiers will be moved from the first queue slot in line to the recruitment slot. Now the training can begin! Once the soldiers from the first stack have been recruited, the next stack of soldiers is taken from the first queue slot. This process continues until all the soldiers from the line have been recruited.
Remember: All soldiers consume food in your castle, so make sure you have enough food to go around! Some especially strong units later on will consume mead.
Every unit has its ideal counterpart in the other weapon class. For example, when attacking, ranged attackers fight most effectively against melee defenders.
You also have the option to ask your alliance for help recruiting one additional soldier for each five units in a slot.
If you buy another slot, you can line up more units for recruitment and therefore improve your forces in the most efficient way.

You can produce tools for attack and defense here. Simply select a tool and enter the amount you want and a stack of up to five tools will be moved from the first slot in line to the production slot. Now the production can begin! Once the tools from the first stack have been produced, the next stack of tools is taken from the line. This process continues until all tools form the line have been produced.
Remember: Each tool can only be used once!
If you hire a sword brother in exchange for rubies, he will be available to you for a certain time. He doesn't count toward the maximum possible number of sword brothers either.
You can buy extra construction slots that will be completed in a row. This lets you have several building sites and therefore plan your construction in the most efficient way.
Here you can communicate your diplomatic demands to the leaders of another alliance.

Here you can find an overview of suitable alliances close by. Tap on an alliance to obtain more information about it and to send its leader a membership request.
If you are searching for an alliance right now and wish to receive membership requests, you can specify this with the option below.

Here you can send your troops and resources out into the event world.
You can't return until the end of the event, however!

Before you can set out for the event world, make sure you gather enough materials for your expedition.
To do this, you can either donate resources or use rubies.
You can see the result of espionage missions here. The success of the agent and the accuracy of the information depends on the risk and the precision of the mission.

Here you can see the presumed formation of your enemy. Please remember that these values may not be totally accurate.
You should also remember to always keep a current overview of your enemy's defense.

You can dispatch troops to members of your alliance to protect them from enemy attacks for a limited time. Troops that are with your allies will still consume food from your castle.
The support troops you are sending will first fill up empty troop capacity on your ally's walls, participating in the wall defense. Then your troops will fill up the castle's courtyard defender capacity, and participate in the defense of the castle's courtyard. Remaining troops will then fill up the alliance support capacity, and actively participate in the defense of the castle's courtyard. Keep in mindthat the alliance support capacity is shared among all alliance members who are sending supporting troops to the castle. If the alliance support capacity is maxed out, any remaining supporting troops are placed in the reserve, and will not participate in the castle's defense.

You need sword brothers to use as commanders and agents!
You can get sword brothers by offering brotherhood to other castle lords. But be warned: sword brothers need to be active players to be able to help you! If they don't play for a while, you will also lose your commanders and agents.
If you bribe the tax collector, you'll get a temporary bonus on all the taxes he collects.

The tax collector is out collecting coins! If you don't want to wait until he returns, you can stop the collection early, but you'll only receive the amount of money he has collected up to that point.

The tax collector collects coins from your subjects. The amount of coins he brings in depends on the total population of all your castles and how long he makes his rounds for. The tax collector doesn't do his work of his own accord, though. It's up to you to send him out!
All military units in this castle are listed here. Along with the tools and soldiers that you can recruit regularly, you'll also find all your special units that you can only get from events.

Some units are well-suited for attacks while others are better at defending.
Troops of one class are also most effective against troops of the opposite class, e.g. a melee attacker is the best choice against a range defender.
When you have multiple construction slots, you can line up several buildings for construction. They will be completed in a row, allowing you to carefully plan how to upgrade your castle.

Each castle only has a limited number of resources. The first production buildings always produce at full workload. Once the location's limits have been exceeded, additional production buildings of the same type will have a reduced workload and therefore produce less.
Constructing and upgrading buildings takes a lot of time. If you want things done more quickly, use rubies to complete them immediately!
The survival of your castle depends on always having enough resources. If you hire an overseer, he will make sure your lazy workers are 20% more productive!
Public order in the castle determines how quickly soldiers can be recruited and resources produced. Every dwelling decreases public order, so build decorative items to bring it up again!

Your castle has been attacked or sabotaged by agents and some of the buildings are burning! Quickly make the necessary repairs since burning buildings produce a lower output and also decrease public order!
This gives you an overview of your alliance - with news, information about the balance of the alliance funds, and other information.
You can leave the alliance from here.
You can send a mass message to all alliance members from here.
You can use this to donate resources, coins, or rubies to the alliance funds.
This lets you increase effects for all alliance members. The costs will be paid out of the alliance funds.
Use the slider to determine how many resources you want to donate to the alliance. You can only donate rubies if you have already purchased rubies or are level {0} or higher.
When you found an alliance, you need to give it a name and a description. You can change the name later on in exchange for rubies.
Use the slider to determine how many units to send to battle.
Here you can find all buildings and objects that you can build in your castle. Tap the image of a building to get detailed information on it.
Here you can find an overview of all resources in all of your castles. This overview also lets you travel directly to your castles.
Here you can get an overview of all four kingdoms. You unlock the kingdoms one at a time by reaching certain levels.
You can send other castle lords a message.
You can invite this castle lord to join your alliance.
You can send this castle lord resources.
You can change descriptions and texts here. This function is only available to members with certain ranks.

The research tower allows you to unlock and research new technologies, blueprints and crafting manuals to help improve the efficiency, strength and productivity of your empire.
There are multiple research categories that can be unlocked by upgrading your research tower, with each category's research tree containing either technologies, blueprints or crafting manuals:
- Technologies provide effects and bonuses that improve the overall productivity of your military economy and resource production. - Blueprints enable you craft new or improve build items that can be used to increase the efficiency of your castle's buildings. - Crafting manuals are integral to the advanced tool crafting process which will ultimately help strengthen your military's might.
Almost every technology, blueprint and manual has multiple levels that you can research to increase the overall effect. New research opportunities are unlocked once certain other projects have been researched.
Committing to a research project takes time and requires resources. It is possible to reduce and even completely skip research times with time skip consumables or rubies, though keep in mind that you can only commit to one research project at a time.
Although the research tower can only be built in your main castle, the bonuses and effects provided by researched technologies apply to every castle in your empire! The resources required for your research projects are taken from the storehouse of your main castle
You can make life at your castle a little easier by visiting the King's Market. For example, you can hire a specialist to increase your productivity.
Decorative items help to promote public order. More decorative items mean higher public order and thus higher productivity.
Here you can find all the civil buildings that you need for your economy. Tap on one of the buildings to get more detailed information on it. You will also see a preview of all upgrades possible.
Here you can find an overview of all military buildings. You need them to recruit units and produce tools.

Here you can find all the options for upgrading your battlements: the higher the levels of your castle walls, towers, and castle moats, the better protected you will be against attackers. A wall is upgraded immediately and requires no construction time.
You can expand your castle here. You can either expand it for rubies or resources.
You can put your stored decorative items back into the castle again without needing any time to build them. Only decorative items can be stored.

You can station troops in outposts, metropolises, capitals, villages, and royal towers to protect these places from enemy attacks. Soldiers in outposts, metropolises, and capitals get food directly from these sites, but soldiers in villages and royal towers require food from your main castle.
Use the slider to determine how many tools to send to battle.
Here you get an overview of all the defense parameters.
The number of soldiers on your castle wall. It depends on the number of towers in your castle.
The defense bonus from your wall.
The castle gate gives an extra defense bonus at the front.
The defense bonus from your castle moat.
The defense bonus from your ranged soldiers.
You can earn achievements by completing certain tasks. You receive achievement points for every task you complete.
You'll receive rubies as a reward when you collect a certain number of achievement points.
Some achievements are split into several parts – you'll earn achievement points for completing each part.
You can earn achievements in various areas. These include economy, military, challenges, and events.
You can earn military achievements by deploying your troops or agents.
You can only earn event achievements during certain events. The events can last for several days or only a few hours.
You can earn economic achievements through trade or by upgrading your castle.
Achievements for challenges are hard to earn! They require skill, patience, and sometimes a little luck.
There's no room in your armory for more equipment. Sell unused items or forge them into new items in your smithy before you can collect new equipment.
Use this button to sell the selected equipment item for coins.

Tap this button to enter the smithy. Here you can forge new equipment items from unused ones. If you use three equipment items of the same quality, you get a new item of the same level of quality. If you use six equipment items, the new item will be of the next level of quality.

Here you can send your woodcutters and stonemasons off to hunt. Move the slider to the right to increase food production in all castles in this kingdom. Less wood and stone will be produced as a result. Sadly, your workers are not skilled hunters. You will need to sacrifice a proportion of your wood and stone production in order to increase your food production. You can see the ratio in the field to the right. Food productivity has a maximum value that you cannot exceed. Move the slider all the way to the left to reset the values.
In the inventory, you can view all the equipment and heroes that you receive or find. Detailed information on each equipment item or hero can be found below the inventory.
Depending on the view you have open, you will see the heroes and equipment items for either commanders or castellans. Items can be used by either commanders or castellans, but never by both.
Your inventory is divided into the categories: armor, weapon, helmet, artifact, appearance, and heroes. Select one of these categories to view all items of this type.
To equip one of your commanders or castellans, simply select the item and tap the equip button. Items that you have already equipped have a marker in their icons.

All the items displayed here are sorted by quality. You can't equip or forge equipment items that are allocated to traveling commanders or castellans. Keep in mind that heroes can likewise have different qualities and skills.
The smithy lets you forge unwanted equipment items into new items.
Only equipment items of the same quality can be melted down together.
If you melt down 3 equipment items, they get destroyed and a new equipment item of the same quality will be made.
If you melt down 6 equipment items, they get destroyed and a new equipment item of better quality will be made.

In the smithy, you can only see equipment items that can be forged into new items. You can't melt down equipment that you've allocated to your commanders or castellans or equipment that changes appearances or is of unique quality.
There's no room in your armory for more equipment. To collect new equipment, you can sell unused items or forge them into new items in your smithy.

The nobility contest is a time-limited event. You are given a task which you can complete as many times as you want within the time limit.
One task can consist of up to three sub-tasks. Whenever you complete a task or sub-task, you earn nobility points. Once you reach a certain number of nobility points, you receive a reward immediately.
All the castle lords taking part in the event are grouped into categories according to their experience level. When the time runs out, the castle lords who have earned the most points in their category will receive exclusive rewards.
The tasks are selected at random at the start of the event, so you'll be sure to find new and exciting challenges every time!

This list includes all the capitals, trading metropolises, royal towers, monuments, and laboratories belonging to your alliance. Tap on the jump-to button for one of these centers of power to jump to it on the world map.
Controlling these special places grants your alliance big advantages over other alliances. A capital with a palace lets all members of that alliance recruit especially powerful units in the barracks in their castles. Meanwhile, for every trading metropolis with an emporium, the entire alliance receives a food bonus. Every royal tower awards a combat bonus for attacks on capitals and trading metropolises. Monuments increase the glory received in battle, and laboratories increase the production of certain resources.
