The is no limit on the number of centers of power an alliance can own. However, each individual castle lord can only own one capital and one trading metropolis at the same time. There is no limit to the number of royal towers, monuments, and laboratories that can be owned.
The various kingdoms hold only a limited number of centers of power. This means that competition for them will be fierce! All the members of the alliance must work together closely to capture centers of power and defend their own from enemy conquests.

These chests hold valuable prizes. Tap on one of them to open it and retrieve the treasure. You need a key for each chest. If you run out of keys on any given day, you can buy more. To do so, simply tap on a locked chest. Keys need to be used on the same day because you can't save them for the next day.
Every day you come back, you'll find new keys and better treasure. If you don't log in to the game for a day, the treasure you find the next time you log in will be less valuable. You can access the login bonus menu at any time through the Admin menu.
Here you have a global overview of all of your castles, outposts, villages, and centers of power that you control.
Here you can see a list of all the centers of power that are controlled by your alliance.
This symbol appears next to your position if you are currently ranked among the best competitors. Hold on to your position until the end of the event and you will earn a special reward.
This symbol appears next to your position if you are currently ranked in first place. Hold on to your position until the end of the event and you will earn a special reward.
Donate a certain amount of resources to receive a plunder point. Keep your eye on the time limit though, because all the points you collect will expire at the end of the event!

Donate resources to rebuild the native people's village and trade with them. Once you donate resources, you can't get them back.
After you repair the village, you can trade using the special resource from that kingdom (charcoal, olive oil, or glass). As you upgrade the village, the value of the items or units that the villagers offer you increases as well.

Here you can trade with the villagers to get coins, special items, or units. You can pay with the special resource (charcoal, olive oil, or glass) from the respective kingdom.
Upgrade the village to higher levels to improve the things you can trade for. Upgrading requires you to donate certain amounts of wood, stone, and coins.
Use rubies to double the number of units per recruitment slot.

Alliance members can request help from one another. If some of your alliance members tap on the help button, you'll get the help you need. Support your comrades whenever you can to make sure your alliance always stays one step ahead!

The War of the Realms is a time-limited event during which the castles of foreign castle lords will appear on the world map of the Great Empire. Before you can attack a foreign castle you need to select a difficulty level.
Foreign castle lords can be spied upon or attacked. The strength of the foreign castle lords depends on the difficulty level chosen after the event started. If you defeat a foreign castle lord, their castle will be replaced with a new one.
There are separate scores for individual castle lords and alliances. In the individual contest, the glory you earn in battles against foreign castle lords will earn you valuable prizes. The pool of available rewards depend on which difficulty level has been chosen at event start.
All of the castle lords who participate in the event will be divided into leagues according to their experience level. When the event is over, the castle lords who have acquired the most glory points in their league will receive exclusive rewards.

On your alliance notice board, you can create new threads and write replies to existing threads.
Threads with unread posts are marked green in the overview. Tap on a post to read it.
The alliance notice board has enough space for 10 threads. Tap on the button at the top right to create a new thread or tap on the button directly next to a thread to delete it. Threads can be deleted by their original creator or by castle lords with the rank of general.
This castle lord has been online in the last 12 hours.
This castle lord has been online in the last 48 hours.
This castle lord has not been online in over two days.
This castle lord has not been online in over 7 days.
The distance shows how far this castle lord's main castle is from you.
Here you can see this castle lord's honor. The alliance's overall honor is calculated by averaging the honor points of all alliance members.
This number shows how much wood and stone the castle lord has donated to the alliance funds in total.
This number shows how many coins the castle lord has donated to the alliance funds in total.
This number shows how many rubies the castle lord has donated to the alliance funds in total.
Here you can see a list with the different ranks.

You can shelter units in your stronghold to protect them against attacks. These units don't help defend your castle, but they also won't be killed during battle. This is a great way to hold onto especially valuable units if your chances of victory are low.
Tap on the plus sign to station units in your stronghold. In the next dialog, you can choose which units you want to send to the stronghold.
Upgrade your stronghold to shelter more units. Troops stationed there still consume food.

Gems can be embedded in any equipment item. The effect of the gem will then be permanently transferred to the equipment item, until the gem is replaced by another one. If the item is sold or used in the smithy, the gem will also be lost.

You can replace a gem in an equipment item with a new one. In doing so, the effect of the new gem is transferred to the equipment item, while the old effect is removed. Bear in mind that this will also destroy the old gem.

Gems can be upgraded to higher levels. To do this, place the selected gem on the center square of the smithy. You also need to place 6 more gems of at least the same level on the outer squares. The upgrade process destroys the 6 gems on the outer squares.
You can also fill the gem smithy automatically. The gems with the lowest quality will then be upgraded first.
When upgrading, make sure to note the chance of success. The higher the level of the gem, the greater the chance of the upgrade attempt failing. If an attempt fails, the center gem will remain at the same level, while the outer gems will be destroyed.

Once a day, every alliance member can use coins to create an equipment item or gem for their own use. The higher the level of the alliance smithy, the greater the chance of receiving higher-quality items or gems. The cost of forging increases with the level of the alliance smithy.
You cannot use the smithy if your equipment or gem inventory is full. In this case, you must first make space in the inventory that is full.
Hold a feast for your citizens! Spare a bit of food to considerably increase the recruitment speed in all your castles. The size of the feast determines the strength and duration of the effect.
Here is a list of all the tools located in this castle. Along with the normal tools that you can produce yourself, you'll also find all your special tools that you can only get from events.

Here is a list of all the units stationed in this castle. Along with the normal soldiers that you can recruit yourself, you'll also find all your special units that you can only get from events.
You can also discharge units to save food. Just tap on the trash can button to do this.

These rankings show you the skills of all the castle lords in the entire kingdom.
You can select which criteria you want to sort them by.

These weekly rankings show you the skills of all the castle lords in the entire kingdom.
The rankings are sorted according to how much loot the castle lord has plundered over one week.

These rankings show you the skills of all the alliances in the kingdom.
You can select which criteria you want to sort them by.
Win a certain number of glory points and you'll be granted a title that earns you extra rewards! You can gain glory in battles against other castle lords.

Once a week you will win a special reward for the honor you've gained in battles. You can win honor in battles against other castle lords. Keep in mind, however, that you can't collect any honor points when your protection mode is active.
Allows players who are looking for an alliance to join automatically
Automatically declares a war between two alliances whose members have attacked or unsuccessfully sabotaged each other.

Here you can select on which day and at what time a coordinated attack should take place and which alliance members should take part in it.
Keep in mind that the coordinated attack has to occur within 24 hours and can take place in one hour's time at the earliest.
Only the highest ranking alliance members can select other members for coordinated attacks.

This list shows you all the places bookmarked for the alliance. They are either free to attack, selected for a coordinated attack, or in need of support. You can choose what is displayed here using the boxes above.
Once a bookmark is created, it can only be removed by its original creator or by castle lords with the rank of general or higher. Bookmarks for coordinated attack are automatically deleted once the attack time has been reached.
The counter in the upper left corner shows the maximum number of places your alliance can bookmark.

Here are the details of your successful sabotage.
The overview shows you how many buildings your agents sabotaged and what kind of damage you inflicted upon your enemy.

Here are the details of your failed sabotage.
The overview shows you how many city guards your agents faced and how high the risk of being caught was.

Here are the details of your successful economic espionage.
The overview shows you an estimate of how many resources your enemy has. Keep in mind that this overview might be inaccurate.
That's why it's best to get an overview of your enemy's resources on a regular basis.

Here are the details of your successful espionage.
The overview shows you how your enemy's defense is probably set up. Keep in mind that this overview might be inaccurate.
That's why it's best to get an overview of your enemy's defense on a regular basis.

Here are the details of your failed espionage.
The overview shows you how many city guards your agents faced and how high the risk of being caught was.

The military hospital lets you treat warriors that have been wounded in battle so you can deploy them again. Wounded men aren't able to fight, but they don't require any food either.
Units are not treated automatically: you must start the treatment yourself. If you want to treat your warriors, tap on their icon and choose how many you want to treat. The treatment will cost coins or rubies, depending on the type of unit.
Your castle's public order also influences the treatment speed of wounded soldiers. The higher your public order is, the faster you can heal the units in your military hospital.
You can ask your alliance to help you treat units by tapping on the alliance help button. If enough members help you, it will take less time to treat them.
If the military hospital is full, the strong and more valuable units will still be admitted - but the weaker and poorly equipped warriors will need to leave to make room for them. This means that these unfortunate fellows will ultimately succumb to their wounds and be lost.
Units that are currently being treated or are in line for treatment don't take up space in the military hospital.
In addition, the military hospital increases the minimum percentage of units that can immediately be deployed again after a defensive battle. These warriors will appear as only slightly wounded in the battle report.

Select one or more castle wall sections to attack and choose which soldiers and siege tools you want to use for each section. You can place the soldiers and tools in the slots yourself or you can choose the autofill option to have the current attack wave filled for you automatically.
Autofill uses the espionage report about your target to determine how to best fill the attack wave. The more accurate the report is, the better your warriors and tools will be positioned to defeat the enemy. If there is no espionage report, a balance of units and tools will be chosen. Autofill will always try to achieve the highest possible attack power so that you suffer as few losses as possible, however. The number of tools used and how they're distributed will be determined according to the defensive bonuses from the defender's castle gate and castle wall. Autofill takes into consideration your commander's equipment effects as well.
Please keep in mind that bonuses which affect travel speed are not effective during capture attacks.
An automatically filled attack wave can be changed at any time by adding or removing units or tools manually.
When attack support tools have been unlocked, they can be used to add additional effects to an attack. Support tools always apply to the entire battle, not a specific front/flank or wave of the attack.
Here you can find an overview of all military buildings. You need them to make space for units in your campaign camp, for example.
Decorative items increase morale. Make sure that your morale is always as high as possible. A positive morale increases your combat strength in battles.
Here you can see a short introduction to the Storm Islands, collecting aquamarine, the Storm Lord and other important subjects.

Here you can send units and tools to your castles in other kingdoms. The more troops you send out, the more you have to pay for travel. Travel costs are paid with coins. You can use rubies to reduce the travel time of your troops. Once you have sent your troops out, you can't call them back until after they have arrived in the other kingdom.
Here you can see the messages you have sent to other castle lords.
Extra defense bonus at the front from the castle gate
Defense bonus from the castle wall
Total combat strength of the selected soldiers
Looting capacity: how many resources the unit can carry when looting

Here you can see details on the espionage you prevented.
The overview provides information on the number of enemy agents who faced your city guards and the chance of their discovery.
You can also fill the smithy automatically. The items with the lowest quality will then be used first. If you own enough items of the same quality, they will make one item of a higher quality.
This is a system message. You can find important information about the game here.

The War of the Realms is a time-limited event during which the castles of foreign castle lords will appear on the world map of the Great Empire. You will only be shown a limited number of castles with similar experience levels to your own.
Foreign castle lords can be spied upon or attacked. The strength of the foreign castle lords depends on the difficulty level chosen after the event started.
There are separate scores for individual castle lords and alliances. The alliance score is equal to the sum of glory points collected by all alliance members during the event.
The glory points you earn in battle against foreign castle lords can earn you and your alliance valuable prizes. You need to gain a minimum of points to qualify for receiving alliance contest rewards. If you reach a certain number of glory points, you will immediately receive a reward. You and your alliance mates might receive different individual rewards, depending on the difficulty level each individual member has chosen.

Once a day, every alliance member can use coins to create an equipment item or gem for their own use. The higher the level of the alliance smithy, the greater the chance of receiving higher-quality items or gems. The cost of forging increases with the level of the alliance smithy.
You cannot use the smithy if your equipment or gem inventory is full. In this case, you must first make space in the inventory that is full.

Captured laboratories grant the owner's entire alliance a production bonus on the resource unique to the respective kingdom. In addition, this bonus can be boosted by increasing the level of your laboratory.
All alliance members can donate wood and stone to increase a laboratory's level. The resources are transported from the alliance's castles and outposts using market barrows. Resources can't be reclaimed once they reach the laboratory.
The laboratory automatically moves up a level when the required number of resources has been reached. A laboratory keeps its current level when it's captured by another castle lord, but the progress made towards the next level will be lost.
Legendary skills are effective against laboratories even if their owners have not yet achieved legendary status.

Every month all the laboratories will be moved to new places on the world map and reset to their original level. Once they have been relocated, the laboratories will be controlled by robber barons or other lowlifes again.
When a laboratory is reset, the troops stationed there will return to the castle which they originally came from. Market barrows which were on their way to the laboratory will automatically turn around once they reach the previous location of the laboratory.

The world map shows you the castles of other lords and your own troop movements.
World map icons The pictures on the world map show you the upgrade level of another lord's castle.
If you tap on a castle, you will see that lord's <9player level<, <15honor<, and <16alliance<. A green parchment banner indicates members of your own alliance, a yellow banner indicates members of a friendly alliance.
<14Robber baron castles< that are occupied by bandits are shown on the world map as towers. <3Outposts< are indicated by the <5resources< available there.
Arrows on the world map represent troop movements. You can see a troop's remaining travel time by tapping on the Info button. The color determines whether this involves an <12attack<, or supporting <11units< for <13defense<.

Units & tools are intended for <12attacking and looting< as well as for the <13defense< of your castle.
What unit types are there? Each unit is ideally suited for a particular role, either attacking or defending. A distinction is also made between melee and ranged units.
How can you recruit units? Units are recruited at the <4barracks<. To recruit units, you will need <6coins<.
Always make sure that you have plenty of food to feed your troops! Units consume <5food< regularly, and will starve as soon as your supply has been depleted. If you own a military hospital, some of your fallen or starved units can be healed there.
Keep an eye on your military hospital's capacity as once it is full, units who have fallen or starved will be lost!
Shadow mercenaries are a special type of unit who come to your castle to offer their services from time to time. They don't consume any of your castle's food supplies, and the <13defender< will not discover who hired them.
Tools The different types of tools are used for various purposes and in different areas in <12attacks< and for <13defense<.
Siege tools can be used when <12attacking< an enemy castle, for example to reduce the defender's <13wall or castle gate protection<. You can assign defense tools to your castle walls or your castle gate to weaken enemy attacks.
How can you make tools? Tools are produced in two <4military buildings<: the defense workshop and the siege workshop. To produce tools, you need <5resources< or <7rubies<.
Attack and defense tools can only be used once in battle.
When an outpost, village, or monument has been captured by an enemy player, all unassigned tools in the location will be returned to the previous owner’s tool storage in their main castle.

Here you will find important information on key functions and terms in Empire: Four Kingdoms.
What do you get for visiting the game every day? The daily login bonus is a reward for players who log in several days in a row. If you do this, you are rewarded with <5resources<, <6coins<, and <7rubies<.

The castle is the seat of your power and can't be captured by other rulers.
By upgrading castle walls and towers, you can substantially improve your defense against attacks on your castle.
Once you prove your skill and increase your influence and <9level<, you can build more castles as <3outposts< and expand your mighty empire.
How can I change my castle name and my coat of arms? You can change your castle name and your coat of arms in exchange for <7rubies< via the Economy menu under Admin.

Outposts are castles on the <10world map< that you can capture and upgrade.
Each outpost lets you collect 2 <5resources<. You can build fewer kinds of <4buildings< at outposts than at <2your castle<.
When can you get outposts? You can capture outposts from <9level< 13 up, after you have constructed an estate.
How many outposts can you own? You can own a maximum of 3 outposts in the game.

You can build new buildings via the build menu.
What types of buildings are there? - Civil buildings (e.g. for increasing the <6population<) - Military buildings (e.g. for recruiting <11units<) - Fortifications for improving <13defense< - Decorative items for raising <8public order<
As soon as you select a building, you can upgrade it, move it, and even demolish it to make room and get back some building materials.
The upgrade level of your Keep determines how fast buildings are constructed and upgraded.
When the build menu is open, you can expand the construction area and limits of your castle walls using the arrows in exchange for <5resources< or <7rubies<.

Coins are used primarily for recruiting <11units<, for <12attacks<, <18espionage<, and <5dispatching resources<.
How do you get more coins? - By collecting taxes with the tax collector - By completing <9quests< - By <12attacking< <14robber baron castles< - By defeating enemy attacks - By tapping on the coins above your citizens' heads
The larger your population and the more time the tax collector spends collecting, the more coins you will get at the end.
The tax collector can also be bribed with <7rubies< to give you a bonus on all the coins you collect.

Rubies are the premium currency in the game. You can use them to save time, perform special actions, or to purchase special buildings or items in the game.
How do you acquire rubies? You can buy rubies or win them in many ways: - By fullfilling certain quest tasks - By <9leveling up< - By <12attacking and looting< <14robber baron castles< - Through the <1daily login bonus<

Public order represents the general mood of the population at <2your castle< and your <3outposts<.
What advantages do you gain from a positive public order? - Increased production of <5resources< - Increased speed of recruitment of <11units & tools<
How do you improve public order? - Number of decorative items - By upgrading your <13defense<
What damages public order? - Population in dwellings - Damaged <4buildings< after enemy attacks (unrest)
What is affected by negative public order? The production of <5resources< and the recruitment of <11units & tools< slow down considerably.

The experience level shows your progress in the game and increases with experience points (XP).
How can you get experience points (XP) to level up? - By completing quests that have XP as a reward - By building and upgrading buildings - By fighting battles against <14robber baron castles< - From honorable battles against castle lords of similar strength
What benefits do you get from leveling up? - New <4buildings and upgrade levels< are unlocked. - This also unlocks new <11units & tools< - You receive a reward of 60 <7rubies<
How do I reach a legendary level? - When you reach experience level 70, you enter into legendary level 1 - From this point on, you increase in legendary level instead of experience level.
How do I level up with legendary levels? - If you reach the legendary levels, you start to earn legendary experience points (XP) instead of experience points (XP). - Legendary experience points are displayed as a golden XP symbol on a silver background. - You receive the same benefits from reaching a new legendary level as you did with a new experience level, like new buildings, units, and other rewards.

Royal towers are rare places on the world map that you can capture. Every royal tower that your alliance controls gives it a combat bonus for attacks on enemy capitals. This bonus applies to normal attacks as well as capture attacks.
There is no limit to the number of royal towers a single lord can control. However, unlike castles or outposts, you can't build any buildings there.
If you ever withdraw all your troops from a royal tower, it will fall into the hands of robber barons. This means it will be neutral and no longer under your control.
Royal towers are the key to defeating a capital, so the competition for them is extremely fierce.

Capitals are very rare places on the world map that you can capture. They bring great advantages to your alliance and are in very high demand. If an alliance controls one or more capitals with a palace, all the alliance members can recruit powerful units. These soldiers can be recruited in all the castles and outposts in the same kingdom as the capital.
Each castle lord can only control one capital at a time. Once you control a capital, you can build and upgrade buildings in it like in normal castles and outposts. You can also build a royal storehouse and palace in a capital – the palace is required to recruit the special units.
Since there are only a few capitals on the world map, epic battles for their control break out regularly. Defending them is a task for the whole alliance!

Agents are specialists that you can use for espionage.
How do you employ agents? The number of agents at your castle depends both on the number and upgrade level of your taverns.
What advantages do you gain with your agents? Agents allow you to spy on enemies before an <12attack< to discover their <13defense< (military espionage) or <5resources< (economic espionage).
To spy on a <14robber baron castle< or another lord's castle, tap on the enemy castle icon in the <10world map< and select espionage from the ring menu.
The travel costs for espionage depend on the distance to be traveled on the <10world map<, the number of agents deployed, and the mission risk.
How can you protect yourself from enemy agents? City guards increase the risk for enemy agents. The number of city guards you have depends on the number and level of your guardhouses.
Depending on the accuracy and risk involved, a successful espionage mission will provide information on an enemy castle's properties. However, if this mission fails, the enemy castle lord will learn of your attempted espionage.

Alliances are pacts between castle lords in Empire: Four Kingdoms.
How can you benefit from an alliance membership? - Support each other by dispatching units and resources - Protect yourself through diplomacy with other alliances - A group chat just for the alliance - Plan and execute joint battle strategies - Bonuses from alliance upgrades
How can you join an alliance? You can join an alliance by contacting its leader, a general, or a sergeant and requesting an invitation into the alliance.
When can you create your own alliance? You can create your own alliance as soon as you've got the necessary resources.
What ranks does an alliance have? - Leader: full rights - Generals, war marshals, treasurers, diplomats, recruiters: membership management, mass messages, announcements, alliance upgrades - Sergeants: membership management, mass messages, announcements - Members: mass messages - Novices: no special rights

A castle lord's honor determines their position in the general rankings.
How do you get honor? You can win honor in battles against other castle lords, but you can lose it this way too. You win honor points for a successful <12attack<, and you lose honor points if your <13defense< is defeated. Your honor points can never fall below zero, however. In general, honor can only be collected from attacks. Honor can't be collected from defense.
How much honor can you win? The amount of honor you can win or lose from a battle depends on the difference in honor points between the attacker and defender. Keep in mind that you will receive little to no honor if you attack a castle lord with a considerably lower experience level than you. You will actually lose honor if the level difference is too large.
The more honor you have, the more glory you can receive in battles.

Robber baron castles that are occupied by bandits are shown on the <10world map< as towers.
If you command a successful <12attack< on a robber baron castle, you can loot <5resources< and <6coins< afterwards. If the robber baron castle is <9level< 3 or higher, you can even get <7rubies< too.
The <9level< of a robber baron castle increases if you defeat it often enough. Each castle lord increases the levels of the robber baron castles only for themselves.
You can't weaken robber baron castles through several <12attacks< since they are immediately reoccupied after each attack.

To defend <2your castle<, tap on one of your towers or on the Military button to open the Defense menu.
Use the slider to set how the <11units< are distributed on all three wall sections. You can also specify the ratio of melee and ranged soldiers deployed on each wall section.
Depending on the level of the castle wall and castle gate of <2your castle<, your units will receive an extra bonus on defense. You can use <11defense tools< to increase it even further.
The number and levels of <2your castle's< towers determine how many units can stand on the castle wall and benefit from the defense bonus.
Troop movements The time it takes for an enemy army to travel from its point of origin to its target depends on the distance on the <10world map< and the army's travel speed.
The enemy army's arrow turns red once it's very close to your castle on the <10world map<. From then on, you can see a more detailed formation of the <11units and siege tools< and position your defense accordingly.
However, if your defenders are defeated, you lose <15honor< and fall in the general rankings.

To attack a <14robber baron castle< or another lord's castle, tap on the enemy castle icon on the <10world map< and select Attack from the ring menu.
Your enemy's castle is divided into a front and two flanks. Select one or more wall sections to attack and assign <11units and siege tools< to your attack waves for each section. Your troops will then attack the wall sections in a series of waves. The higher your level, the more attack waves you have available. On the other hand, your target's level limits the number of possible attackers per wave.
It's always worthwhile to use <18espionage< to find weaknesses in the defense.
Troop movements The time it takes for an army to travel from its point of origin to its target depends on the distance on the <10world map< and the army's travel speed.
The cost depends on the distance to be traveled and your army's size. When armies march to a castle on the <10world map<, the castle lord there will discover them as soon as they're within view.
Once you've defeated an enemy castle, your victorious <11units< will loot the enemy storehouse's <5resources<. Each of your units has its own looting capacity, which determines how much loot they can carry.
Nevertheless, the Keep has a secure storage that protects some resources from being looted by an enemy.
If you defeat another castle lord in battle, you gain <15honor< and rise in the general rankings.
Depending on the number of attackers, the <4buildings< in a looted castle will be damaged. This reduces the <8public order< at that castle.
Siege and defense tools can increase or decrease the strength of the defending army. Lots of other combat attributes can also be affected by tools. These symbols will show you which ones:

Resources are especially important for building and upgrading <4buildings< and producing <11tools<.
What types of resources are there?
Ordinary resources available in every kingdom: - wood: produced by woodcutters and also by forest lodges upon reaching the legendary levels - stone: produced in stone quarries and also in stone works upon reaching the legendary levels - food: produced in farmhouses and also in granaries upon reaching the legendary levels
Kingdom resources can only be collected in the kingdom they belong to: - charcoal: produced in charcoal burners in the Everwinter Glacier - olive oil: produced in olive groves in the Burning Sands - glass: produced in glass furnaces in the Fire Peaks - iron ore: produced in iron mines in the Great Empire
The locations of your production buildings within your castle have no effect on their production.
In addition, you can exchange and trade resources with other castle lords. Your trade partner needs to unlock these resources first. They don't need to have a castle in the same kingdom. They only need to have the appropriate experience level.
Only a certain number of production buildings can run at full workload in each castle. You can see how many production buildings can run at full workload in a castle in the production overview. If this number is exceeded, the productivity of each new production building will decrease. The production buildings with the highest basic production will always be among those running at full workload. For example, if you upgrade a production building to a higher level or replace it with a better one, it automatically runs at full workload.
The storehouse's capacity determines how many resources of one type can be stored there.

These rankings list the cargo points earned by all the alliances. Valuable rewards await the alliances who achieve a certain number of cargo points or who collect the most cargo points overall before the arrival of the next moon storm. Tap on one of the arrow buttons below to scroll through the list. The alliances with the most points are highlighted in the rankings.
The rewards are always given out after the monthly moon storm.

In this list you can see how many cargo points the castle lords in your alliance have won. Members who have not acquired any cargo points yet are marked in gray in the list.
Rewards for collecting aquamarine are only ever given to members of alliances, never to lone castle lords.

You can open the friends menu via the high-five symbol. There you can connect to Facebook and invite your friends. If they install the game using the invitation they receive and then connect to Facebook, they will be sent to your server. This means you can play together. In the friends list, you can see which of your friends have already connected to Facebook. Remember that you can earn rewards for your each of your friends, so the more people you invite and the more of your friends who play, the more rewards you'll receive! In addition, every 24 hours you can send each of your friends one gift and receive one gift from each friend as well.

Here you can find an overview of the resources in your campaign camp. Make sure you have enough room for your troops and their morale stays high! Keep in mind your space for soldiers limit includes both troops in your camp and troops marching to attack an enemy target.

Here you can pay coins to mercenaries to complete missions for you. When they return from their mission, they will bring you valuable rewards.
Missions come in different levels of rarity: free, ordinary, rare, epic, and legendary. The rarer a mission, the better rewards you get when you complete it. Missions can never fail and you always get a reward. Keep in mind, however, that you can never start more than one mission at a time.
Old missions are deleted every few hours and replaced by new ones, but your ongoing missions will remain active, along with missions which you completed but haven't collected your rewards for yet.
If you don't want to play a mission, you can swap it for a new one. Now and again the new mission may be a rarer one and have more precious rewards to offer.

You can win a variety of prizes at the wheel of fortune! You need tickets to spin the wheel. These can be purchased with rubies. Each spin gets you one step closer to the next highest prize level, where even more valuable prizes are in store. If the wheel lands on a jackpot, you will win one of three jackpot prizes for your current prize level.
Once the event is over, the castle lords who have spun the wheel of fortune the most will get extra rewards which are especially valuable.
You can also use rubies to guarantee a jackpot prize with your next spin or to unlock the next highest prize level. Unlocking a prize level with rubies is not counted as a spin, however, nor does it move you closer to the highest ranks in the competition.
Remaining tickets don't expire and can be used again during the next event. However, with each new event you will start from the lowest prize level.
Occasionally you can watch advertisement videos to receive a free spin in normal mode.

You can save interesting and important places in a list on the world map so that you can easily find them again later.
You can create your own names for each place on your list. To do this, tap on the place's name and enter a new name. This name is only visible in your list – the old name remains on the world map.
In addition, places can be bookmarked as friendly or hostile. These categories are only designed to give an overview and have no effect on a place's diplomatic status.

You can create your own names for each place in your list. To do this, tap on the place's name and enter a new name. This name is only visible in your list, while the old name remains on the world map.
In addition, places can be bookmarked as friendly or hostile. These categories are only designed to give an overview and have no effect on a place's diplomatic status.

You can bookmark up to 50 places in all the kingdoms so that you can easily find them again later. Old entries can be deleted at any time. A place which is no longer available will be automatically deleted from your list.
You can give a name to each place you save and mark it as friendly or hostile. You can sort your list using the tab at the top of the screen. Tap on the change button next to an entry to edit the place's name or change its status as friendly or hostile. You can jump straight to a place using the appropriate button.
Some places cannot be bookmarked, for example your own castles or places in event kingdoms which run for a limited time.

This is where you can bookmark places for your alliance. These bookmarks are visible to all members and can be separated into three categories:
Free to attack: the entire alliance can attack this place at will.
Coordinated attack: selected alliance members all attack a specified target at a designated time.
Request support: this place needs troops for support.
When a place is bookmarked for the alliance, it appears in a list of bookmarks within the alliance menu.
Here you can get an overview of your alliance's current status. You can also read the latest messages or write one of your own if your rank is high enough.

Here you can read the latest entries in the alliance chronicle. The chronicle is updated every time something important happens in your alliance, such as when someone is promoted, an important monument is captured, etc.
Here you can display the full chronicle by tapping on the chronicle button. You can also set which entries you want to see.

Here you can see your alliance's current level and the progress needed to move up to the next level. You'll also see what rewards you'll get from your next level up.
Every time one of your alliance members earns glory points, they will be credited to your alliance automatically. If you have enough glory, you can upgrade your alliance and earn rewards for your alliance funds in the form of resources, coins, or even rubies.
However, keep in mind that your alliance loses 0.5% of its glory points every day.
Here you can get an overview of your alliance's centers of power and go to the world map to see what bonuses they are earning for the entire alliance.
Here you can see a list of all members of your alliance.
Distance between this member's main castle and your own
Rubies donated to the alliance funds by this member
Resources donated to the alliance funds by this member
Coins donated to the alliance funds by this member
Honor won by this member in battles against powerful opponents
Yellow: member was online in the last 12 hours
Orange: member was online in the last 24 hours
Red: member was online in the last week
Black: member has not been online for over a week
Here you can get an overview of the status of your alliance funds and donate resources, coins, and rubies. These can then be used by high ranking alliance members to acquire bonuses for all members.
Here you can see the different diplomacy statuses you have with other alliances. These can be pacts, non-aggression agreements, or wars.
If your rank is high enough, you can view, accept, and refuse diplomacy requests from other alliances.
Here you can change some of the settings relating to your alliance.
If your rank is high enough, you can change the alliance name and its description as well as accept or decline membership requests if your alliance is not open.
Here you can set which posts to display in your chronicle.
Glory points: you will be notified if alliance members win glory points.
Alliance funds: you will be notified if alliance members donate to the alliance funds.
Hierarchy: you will be notified if alliance members are promoted or demoted.
Diplomacy: you will be notified of any changes in your diplomatic status with other alliances.
Events: you will be notified of events that concern your alliance.
Your might points are calculated based on the number of buildings, the equipment, and the units you own. This means that the mightier you become, the more might points you will collect.

Castle lords with an experience level of {0} can travel to the Storm Islands and build a new castle there. You have to pay resources and coins to unlock the kingdom.
The Storm Islands are a treacherous archipelago in an endless ocean, and your armies and merchants can only travel to the islands by ship. However, the Storm Islands are also the only place where aquamarine can be found. The precious stone can be sold on the Storm Islands or brought to the nobles, who value it highly. However, once a month a moon storm lays waste to the islands, destroys castles, and washes away all of the riches collected there. Make sure you build cargo ships early on to protect your aquamarine from the storm so you can bring it to the nobles in exchange for valuable rewards. Keep in mind that the nobles only reward alliances for collecting aquamarine. Valuable rewards will be given to the alliances that collect the most aquamarine within the one month period. The most successful alliance is also granted a special honor. Their leader is declared the new Storm Lord and can then award special titles to other players.

The leader of the alliance which has collected the most cargo points by the time the next moon storm arrives is named Storm Lord for a month. The Storm Lord can then award special titles to other castle lords.
Each title can only ever be given to one castle lord at a time. Honorable titles can only be distributed within the Storm Lord's own alliance. However, dishonorable titles can be given to castle lords outside the Storm Lord's alliance. Each castle lord can only ever hold one title at a time. After a title has been awarded, the Storm Lord has to wait a while before passing it on to another castle lord. The titles will remain with their bearers until the next moon storm or until the Storm Lord awards the titles to other castle lords.
If a castle lord leaves the Storm Lord's alliance, he will also lose his title. If the Storm Lord leaves the alliance, all the members will be stripped of their titles automatically.
The overview of the Storm Island event shows you when the next moon storm will hit and lists some interesting options.

Here you can see a list of the rewards that your alliance can earn when the next moon storm breaks. Keep in mind that you will only receive the rewards if you belong to an alliance when the storm hits.

This list shows your castle and all the resource islands that you currently occupy in the Storm Islands. You can also see the defenders stationed there and how much time remains until the occupation has been successfully completed. Tap on one of the locations to jump directly to that position.

This list includes all the capitals, royal towers, and monuments controlled by your alliance. Tap on the jump-to button of one of these centers of power to view it on the world map.
Controlling these special places gives your alliance great advantages over other alliances. A capital in which a palace has been built allows all members of the alliance to recruit especially powerful units using the barracks in their castles. In addition, every royal tower controlled by the alliance will award all alliance members a combat bonus for attacks on capitals. Captured monuments grant the owner's entire alliance a glory bonus for all attacks.
There is no limit on the number of centers of power that can be controlled by one alliance. However, each castle lord can only own one capital. There is no limit on the number of royal towers that a single castle lord can own.
The various kingdoms have only a few centers of power. This means competition for them will be fierce! All alliance members must work together closely to capture centers of power and to defend their own centers of power from enemy conquests.

You can invite your Facebook friends to Empire: Four Kingdoms here. If these friends also connect to Facebook while they play, you'll be rewarded when they reach certain levels! In the friends list, you can see which of your friends have already connected to Facebook. The more friends you invite, the bigger the rewards coming your way! In addition, every 24 hours you can send each of your friends one gift and receive one gift from each friend as well.

The samurai invasion is a time-limited event. While the event is running, your castle will be surrounded by samurai camps on the world map.
Samurai camps can be spied upon or attacked. The strength of the samurai camps depends on the difficulty level chosen after the event started.
You will receive valuable prizes for glory won in battles against the samurai. The most successful castle lords and alliances can also look forward to additional rewards after the end of the event.
Scores are tallied for both individual castle lords and alliances. You need to gain a minimum of points to qualify for receiving alliance contest rewards.

These rankings show you the skills of all the castle lords in the entire kingdom.
You can select which criteria you want to sort them by.

Fight against the enemy faction's camps and towers to collect gallantry points and earn titles. However, you lose a certain amount of your gallantry points every day. From the title of "Ruler of the Battle" upwards, the proportion of points you lose will increase. The title of "Claw King" is unique in your game world. Every 12 hours, this title and all titles for the top 100, top 50, and top 20 castle lords will be reassigned to the castle lords with the most gallantry points.
Earn gallantry points and get great rewards! Once the Battle for Berimond is over, the castle lords with the most points will receive valuable prizes.

You can hire auxiliaries here. Simply click on a unit and then specify how many you would like. Their training can then begin.
The following special rules apply for auxiliaries: - They don't consume any food. - They don't take up any space in your tents but require an auxiliaries' headquarters instead. - They won't be brought to the military hospital and don't count among the minimum percentage of warriors who can immediately be deployed again after a defensive battle. - They will not travel to your main castle after the Berimond event ends.

Here you can buy gifts to send to your brothers-in-arms. ↵↵Each package contains a fixed number of resources, tools, or other rewards. When you click on one, you can select how many of them you want to buy.↵↵The size of your gift inventory limits how many gift packages you can own. If your inventory is full, send the packages you already have to your brothers-in-arms so you can buy more.↵↵You can send packages by selecting a lord's main castle and clicking on the corresponding symbol in the ring menu. You can also send the package via the player info screen.↵↵A gift reaches its recipient as soon as it's sent. Unfortunately you can't send yourself any gifts.
Here you can choose what gifts to send to your brother-in-arms. They will receive the gift immediately.

You can buy gifts from the gift peddler to send to your brothers-in-arms. Each gift package contains a certain number of resources, tools, or other rewards.
You can send gifts by clicking on the appropriate symbol in the ring menu of the castle lord's main castle. You can also send the package via the player info screen.

Here are the details of the sabotage that was driven off.
Your city guards succesfully caught the spies, and no information will be passed on to their employer.

Gems can also be embedded in your equipment items to add new stats and make them even stronger. Gems can be found in robber baron castles or are granted in different events. Like equipment, gems can be forged in the smithy to create even more powerful ones. One equipment item can only hold one gem at a time. If you want to embed another gem into an equipment item already containing a gem, the old gem will be destroyed. It is also possible to remove an embedded gem from an equipment item again without destroying either. Gems don't use the same inventory slots as regular equipment.

You can use research to improve your military and economic skills, and also unlock build items. Research topics more than once to boost their effect even more. To choose a topic to research, simply tap on it to select it. You can scroll through the research tree by swiping in any direction. If you want to have a better look, you can zoom in and out of the tree using pinching gestures.

Here you can manage your build items and assign them to buildings to improve their efficiency in various ways. Some build items can only be assigned to certain building types, and each building has a limited number of build item slots, so choose wisely!
You can also remove build items from buildings, or replace them with another build item, but this will either cost you a certain amount of coins, or destroy the removed build item.
Temporary build items: This type of build item is only active for a limited amount of time after being assigned to a building. When their time has expired, temporary build items are automatically removed from the building. Assigned temporary build items cannot be removed from a building until the time has expired.
Temporary build items in outposts are lost when the outpost is conquered by an enemy castle lord. You can also use build item boosters to increase the level of a temporary build item and reset its timer.
This is an overview of your personal progress in the contest. You'll be able to see the special tasks that you have completed in each event, as well as the season points you have earned up until now.

These rankings show the skills of every castle lord in the entire kingdom. Use the arrow keys to move between the different experience level leagues and view the rank of each castle lord. The name of the castle lord with the most season points will be written in gold, while the castle lords in the following positions will be in silver.

Here you can choose a mode of transportation to increase travel speed. The effect and costs depend on what you choose. You can also slow down the selected units so that they arrive exactly when you need them to.
In a support movement you can also decide how long your troops will stay at the target castle before returning.

Here you can choose a mode of transportation to increase travel speed. The effect and costs depend on what you choose. You can also slow down your army so that it arrives exactly when you need it to. You can also decide how long your troops will stay at the target castle before returning.
The drill instructor allows you to recruit troops faster.

Here you can craft new build items using blueprints. You can only craft one build item at a time. You can unlock new blueprints by completing certain tasks or researching new technologies in your research tower.
To craft items you will also need crafting materials, and sometimes a lower level build item. Crafting materials can be purchased or earned as rewards. - Available in random material bags containing a random range of materials: Fine sand, Bricks, Flint, Farming tools, Resin, Soul Stone - Available as single materials: Purified water, Clay, Timber, Straw, Paint, Rope, Nails, Glue, Precious metals, Cobblestone, Magma stone, Fabric
Here you can get an overview of all of the crafting materials in your stock. Crafting materials are needed to craft build items.

The alliance tournament is a time-limited event. The season points you win during the tournament will earn you and your alliance valuable prizes. Furthermore, the most successful alliances will win extra rewards at the end of the event.

The War of the Bloodcrows is a time-limited event during which Bloodcrow castles appear on the Great Empire's world map. Before you can attack a Bloodcrow castle you need to select a difficulty level.
Bloodcrow castle lords can be spied upon or attacked. The strength of the Bloodcrow castle lords depends on the difficulty level chosen after the event started. If you defeat a Bloodcrow castle lord, their castle will vanish and eventually be replaced with a new one.
There are separate scores for individual castle lords and alliances. In the individual contest, the glory you earn in battles against Bloodcrow castle lords will earn you valuable prizes. The pool of available rewards depend on which difficulty level has been chosen at event start.
All of the castle lords who participate in the event will be divided into leagues according to their experience level. When the event is over, the castle lords who have acquired the most glory points in their league will receive exclusive rewards.

The War of the Bloodcrows is a time-limited event during which Bloodcrow lords' castles appear on the Great Empire's world map. You will only be shown a limited number of castles with similar experience levels to your own.
Bloodcrow Lords can only be spied upon or attacked. The strength of the Bloodcrow castle lords depends on the difficulty level chosen after the event started.
There are separate scores for individual castle lords and alliances. The alliance score is equal to the sum of glory points collected by all alliance members during the event.
The glory points you earn in battle against Bloodcrow castle lords can earn you and your alliance valuable prizes. You need to gain a minimum of points to qualify for receiving alliance contest rewards. If you reach a certain number of glory points, you will immediately receive a reward. You and your alliance mates might receive different individual rewards, depending on the difficulty level each individual member has chosen.

Resource villages provide a production bonus for particular resources. Public resource villages are present across the world map and can be attacked and conquered. Although you can't construct buildings in a captured resource village, you can station your units there to protect it from enemy invaders. Private resource villages can only be seen by you and can not be attacked. You therefore don't need to station troops in them.
The resource villages dialog provides you with an overview of the public and private resource villages currently under your control. Here you can station troops in each village, as well as upgrade or remove private villages from your list. Additional private villages can also be purchased in the village shop.

Here you can buy private resource villages in exchange for village tokens. Private resource villages provide your main castle in the corresponding kingdom with a resource boost depending on which type of resource village you pick. You can buy the same village type with a different level. The higher the level, the better the resource boost.
Be aware that there is a limit to the amount of villages you can own, which includes public and private resource villages.

Invader castle lords can be exiled or forced to fortify their castle to provide you with a greater challenge.
If you choose to force an invading lord into exile, another will take his place. The new lord will differ from the previous lord in terms of military set-up and defense configuration. The strength of the new lords falls within the shown range and cannot be know precisely - he may be much stronger, but he may also be weaker.
By forcing a lord to fortify his castle, his army will receive an unknown amount of additional defensive reinforcements units.
Be aware that each invading castle lord can only have one supply of defensive reinforcements at a time. Fortifying an already fortified castle or fortifying after the castle lord was exiled will simply replace the current reinforcements rather than add to them.
You can filter your equipment inventory by rarity and effect name. You can also search for equipment items belonging to sets your commander currently has equipped.
You can filter your gem inventory by level, if they are unique, and effect name. You can also search for gems belonging to sets your commander currently has equipped.

Rewards of a certain type are stored in the "lost and found" if their respective inventory is full.
You have a certain amount of time to decide if you want to claim rewards stored in the lost and found before they are lost forever. Either you collect them after you have made space in your inventory, or you swap them for an alternative reward.
New rewards can still be stored in the lost and found even when it has reached maximum capacity. However, each new reward will replace an old reward. The oldest rewards will be removed first.
Rewards which will be stored in the lost and found:
- Equipment pieces (helmet, armor, weapon, artifact, look) - Heroes - Gems - Build items

You can save a lot of time planning your attacks by saving your preferred unit and tool set-ups as presets. Presets can be renamed to help provide a clear overview, while more can be bought to help improve your flexibility on the battlefield.

Alliance contracts are completed through the collective effort of your alliance. Each Daimyo castle and township has its own contract alliances can fulfill in order to receive war effort points. All alliances are ranked depending on the war effort points they accumulate during the event.
All alliances are ranked depending on the war effort points they accumulate during the event.

Townships need to be defended by your troops as they don't have any soldiers of their own. Each township can only receive support from one point of origin. The amount of troops a township can host is limited.

The Legion of the Daimyos is a special event where you and your alliance need to drive back the invading armies of the Daimyos.
Daimyo castles: - Appear on the world map of the Great Empire - Your goal is to attack them - Attacking will earn samurai medals and shogun points
Townships: - Appear on the world map of the Great Empire - Your goal is defend them against taunted Daimyo attacks - Defending will earn samurai medals and shogun points
Alliance contracts: - A contract exists for every Daimyo castle and township - Fulfilling contracts will earn your alliance war effort points
Alliance ranking: - Participating alliances are ranked together according to their accumulated war effort points - Alliances are rewarded with valuable prizes at the end of the event according to their rank

The Relicus enchantment allows you to improve the primary attributes of your relic equipment and strengthen their effects. You can improve all types of relic equipment: items, gems, and heroes.
Select a relic equipment from the inventory on the left. Use the search field to filter for specific types of relic equipment. In the attribute field on the right you will see how much the primary attributes will be improved. Each relic equipment has a fixed number of improvement levels, and the attributes are improved by a fixed value on each level. You can improve relic gems that are embedded in relic items. The relic item and its embedded relic gem have separated enchantment levels and need to be upgraded separately. Select below whether to upgrade a relic item or its embedded relic gem.
Use the standard button or premium button to improve your relic equipment. Each improvement costs you relic splinters and either coins or rubies. The cost of improving a relic equipment increases with each improvement level. In addition, the chance of a successful improvement decreases. If the attempt fails, you lose the relic splinters and coins you spent. However, the equipment item remains at the current level. If you pay in rubies, the improvement is guaranteed to succeed.

The Storm Islands are struck by the moon storm on a regular basis. When the storm hits, all of your resources and buildings are wiped away and all ongoing processes are canceled, such as recruitment, attacks, and occupation. All troops in your island castle will flee to your main castle and your cargo points will be reset. If you want to go back to the Storm Islands after the storm, you will have to pay the travel costs again.
You can keep samurai medals and samurai tokens that you haven't exchanged for rewards until the next samurai invasion.

You can station troops in outposts, city states, capitals, and observation towers to protect these places from enemy attacks. Soldiers in outposts, city states, and capitals get food directly from these sites, but soldiers in observation towers require food from your main castle.

You can store decorations that you don't need in the buildings storehouse. All decorations stored in the buildings storehouse are sorted by public order. You can also filter the decorations displayed by their size or name.
Decorations stored in this buildings storehouse can be placed in the following locations:
- Tangled Wilderness: main castle, outposts, and capitals.

Gems can also be embedded in your equipment items to add new stats and make them even stronger. Like equipment, gems can be forged in the smithy to create even more powerful gems. One equipment item can only hold one gem at a time. If you want to embed another gem into an equipment item already containing a gem, the old gem will be destroyed. It is also possible to remove an embedded gem from an equipment item again without destroying either. Gems don't use the same inventory slots as regular equipment.

The world map shows your castles and those of the other castle lords. The cultist shrines are represented by towers. Whenever you defeat one, the tower will burn. There are outposts that castle lords can capture. These contain valuable resources.

Beyond the Horizon is a new event where you and your alliance travel to a new world and fight against alliances from all over the world.
All ranking rewards will be granted to your main castle in the Great Empire within 10 days after the event has ended.
Nothing from the event kingdom will be taken back to the Great Empire. The only exception is rubies if you buy rubies from the shop at least once.
Details about the rules can be found on the "journey progress" page.

When first entering this event, you can choose a castle you would like to start the event with. The castle you choose will determine your starting level, as well as the quality and quantity of your starting buildings and resources.
Some castles will be free to use, while others will cost rubies.

Certain buildings can be placed inside a district to save space in your castle.
How to place a building inside the district: - Use the "place inside district" button in the ring menu of building. - Drag and drop the building onto the district.
Rules to placing buildings inside the district: - Not every building can be placed inside every district. A detailed list showing which buildings can be placed can be found in the district overview.
Rules for buildings inside the district: - Buildings and their effects behave as they normally would when inside a district. - Buildings can be removed from a district, but only if there is sufficient space available in the castle.

All members of your alliance can support the defense of a jungle shrine by stationing troops inside the shrine. Only a limited number of troops can be stationed at a shrine. The defense deployment of your units, as well as the ratio between melee & ranged defenders in your shrines are predefined. Troops will be placed accordingly. A jungle shrine's defenses can be boosted by upgrading defense effects and then activating the shrine boost. All purchased upgrades are valid until the event ends.

Upgrade defense effects to improve the defense of this jungle shrine. The effects only apply for a defense battle if the shrine's boost is activated. All purchased upgrades are valid until the event ends. Multiple upgrade levels can be purchased at the same time, the cost for each level is added to the total price.

Jungle shrines need to be defended by troops sent by your alliance members as they don't have any soldiers of their own. Each shrine can receive support from multiple alliance members, though the number of troops that can be stationed inside a shrine is limited.
An overview of all your troops stationed at this jungle shrine. The troops are supplied from your castle. You can retreat your troops at any time.
This is a list of all jungle shrines belonging to the selected alliance. You can see the status of each shrine and the status of the connected castles.
Time until refortification of all breached castles
Your troops stationed at this location

The barracks allows your to recruit soldiers to defend your castle and attack your enemies. Simply select a unit type and amount you want to add to your ranks, and a stack of up to five soldiers will be moved from the first slot in line to the recruitment slot. Now the recruitment can begin!
Once the soldiers from the first stack have been recruited, the next stack of soldiers will be taken from the line. This process continues until all the soldiers from the line have been recruited.
Remember: All soldiers consume food in your castle, so make sure there is enough to go around! Some units will also require different resources, so keep an eye on your resource stocks and production.
Every unit has its ideal counterpart in a different weapon class. For example, ranged attackers fight most effectively against melee defenders.
You also have the option to ask your alliance for help if you wish to recruit one additional soldier per recruitment slot. You are unable to request alliance help if you are recruiting less than 5 soldiers per line.

You can modify your coat of arms with different layouts, colors and symbols. Special symbols that grant an effect when selected can be unlocked and purchased after collecting achievement points. By using just one large symbol or by using the same one multiple times, you double its effect.

Here you can see the final ranking from the previous Outer Realms event. The list contains the final ranking position and score of all participants, which gameplay mode was active for the event, and the date and time at which the ranking was updated. Bear in mind that this shows the final ranking of the last event completed and NOT the ranking of an active Outer Realms event! If the Outer Realms event is active, you can find the current ranking in the event interface itself.

Here you can see the final ranking from the previous Beyond the Horizon event. The list contains the final ranking position and score of all participating players and alliances, which gameplay mode was active for the event, and the date and time at which the ranking was updated. Bear in mind that this shows the final ranking of the last event completed and NOT the ranking of an active Beyond the Horizon event! If the Beyond the Horizon event is active, you can find the current ranking in the event interface itself.

Instead of choosing a starter castle, you can currently enter the Outer Realms with a copy of your main castle from the Great Empire. The misty castle in the Outer Realms will contain all the buildings of your main castle, but not the stationed troops or tools, nor any resources, currencies, items, or equipment. Likewise, any progress in the research tower or in the hall of legends is not transferred to the misty castle. Your misty castle will contain a predefined amount of currencies and resources to start your adventure in the Outer Realms, and you will start the event with a predetermined legendary experience level.
Once you have entered the Outer Realms your misty castle is completely independent from your main castle. Progress in either castle will not affect its counterpart.
When the current Outer Realms event ends, your misty castle and all of its progress is lost. Only the rubies you purchased in the Outer Realms are transferred to your main account.

When first entering this event, you can choose a castle you would like to start the event with. The castle you choose will determine the quality and quantity of your starting buildings and resources.
Some castles will require resources, while others will cost rubies.

The Storm Islands is a time-limited event kingdom where you and your alliance can compete against other alliances.
Attack player and non-player targets to collect aquamarine, a precious resource exclusive to the Storm Islands. From your island castle, you can either trade your aquamarine directly for rewards, or use it to construct cargo ships. Each cargo ship will increase your personal and your alliance's cargo points. In the Storm Islands, battles against enemy castle lords have no impact on the honor system. No honor will be gained or lost.
Once a month, the moon storm sweeps through the Storm Islands and temporarily forces all participants back to the Great Empire. All progress in the event kingdom will be lost during the storm. The participating alliances are ranked and rewarded according to their final cargo score. You will also receive rewards for your personal cargo score.
Details about the Storm Islands and the event rules can be found in the Storm Island information overview.

Build cargo ships to transport aquamarine from the Storm Islands to the Great Empire. This will earn your alliance cargo points and improve their standing in the monthly cargo points contest ranking.
You can gain additional cargo points by defeating Storm forts, completing the occupation of an aquamarine resource island, and by constructing and upgrading the aquamarine hideout in your island castle.
You can also collect cargo points if you compete without an alliance, but will not receive any rewards. If you then join an alliance, your cargo points will be awarded to your new alliance.
Details about the Storm Islands and the rules can be found in the Storm Island information screen.

Here you can see all members of your alliance ranked according to their current cargo points. The sum of all members' cargo points determines your alliance's total cargo points score.
Members who are currently not active in the Storm Islands are listed at the bottom of the list and are marked gray. These members, along with those who have not yet collected any cargo points, will not receive any cargo points rewards at the next moon storm reset.
Details about the Storm Islands and the rules can be found in the Storm Island information overview.
The performance page lists a number of personal statistics based on your progress in the Storm Islands. With each moon storm your statistics are reset.

The Storm Islands are a time-limited event kingdom where you and your alliance can compete against other alliances for valuable rewards.
To join the Storm Islands, you need to unlock an island castle using either resources or rubies. The castle contains a selection of buildings and decorations, and will be available until the next moon storm.
Once you have unlocked your storm castle, you can send troops and resources from your other kingdoms to your storm castle. Troops and resources that do not make it to your storm castle before the reset will be sent back to their point of origin.
During the Storm Islands event, you and your alliance have to collect aquamarine and construct cargo ships to increase your personal and your alliance's cargo points score. The aquamarine hideout also grants cargo points. Once a month, the moon storm sweeps through the Storm Islands and temporarily forces all participants back to the Great Empire. When this happens, your alliance and all its members who collected a minimum amount of cargo points will receive rewards based on their final cargo score. Individual players also receive rewards based on their final cargo score. You can see a list of rewards and requirements in the overview. In the Storm Islands, battles against enemy castle lords have no impact on the honor system. No honor will be gained or lost.
Players who are not members of an alliance can participate in the Storm Islands, though they will of course not receive rewards from the alliance cargo point contest. Players can also trade their aquamarine for rewards at Luna's trade boat in front of the castle.
Details about the Storm Islands and the rules can be found in the Storm Island information overview.

Here you can see an overview of all resource islands under your control. Listed for each island are the resource type, remaining occupation time until resource payout, and the troops and tools you have stationed at an island. You can also use the buttons to change the island's defense settings and jump to the island on the storm island world map.
Keep in mind you always need to have troops stationed on a resource islands, otherwise your occupation of the island will end immediately. Troops stationed on resource islands consume food from your island castle's storage.

Storm titles are awarded at each Storm Island reset to members of the alliance which has collected the most cargo points.
Only one alliance will be rewarded with storm titles at a time, with the current holders losing their titles at the next reset (unless, of course, they are again the top-scoring alliance).
You can use this overview to see if your alliance is currently in a position to receive storm title.
The title an alliance member receives is determined by their position in the internal alliance ranking.
Each storm title grants a variety of special effects that will be active until the next Storm Island reset. When awarded rank 1, you gain the prefix title "Stormlord" and the suffix title "the Voracious". On rank 2 and below you gain one suffix title. On each rank you gain the title and effect from that rank, and also all title effects from all lower ranks.
Players can choose to display their storm title together with their player name via the title selection overview.

Use the unlock all button to purchase all additional pending rewards. The price for unlocking the all additional rewards will not be higher than unlocking the each extra rewards in their specific events individually.
Use the collect all button to instantly collect all pending rewards and add them to your inventory. The pending rewards will be removed from the reward hub. Any locked additional rewards will be lost.
Keep in mind that the list of all pending rewards is not updated while the dialog is open. Close the dialog to refresh the list.

These notifications inform you about activity and event rewards you have recently received. The rewards have already been added to your inventory. Select a notification to see details about the received rewards and your performance in the respective event.
The storage capacity for reward notifications is limited. Once the maximum capacity has been reached, the oldest notifications are automatically deleted.

These rewards have not yet been added to your inventory. You have to manually collect these rewards to receive them.
Select a notification to see details about the pending rewards and your performance in the respective event.
Certain pending rewards contain locked additional rewards, which can be unlocked by purchasing a reward pass. Once unlocked they will be added to your inventory when you select to collect the rewards from a notification.
Use the manage pending rewards function to quickly collect or unlock all your pending rewards.
The storage capacity for your pending rewards is limited. Once the maximum capacity has been reached, the oldest pending rewards are automatically collected. Keep in mind any locked additional rewards will be lost.

The difficulty selection overview allows players to select a difficulty level for the upcoming invasion event. The difficulty you select for the event will not only determine the strength of the invading targets, but also the quality of rewards you can win during the event. Keep in mind this applies to the alliance activity rewards as well; you and your alliance mates will still contribute together for the alliance scoring, but might receive different individual rewards.
You can access the difficulty selection overview at the start of each event by visiting the relevant event camp outside your castle, or by directly interacting with an invading target on the world map. Please note that you can't attack or spy on event targets until a difficulty level has been chosen.
Once a difficulty level has been selected, it can't be changed until the start of the next event, so be sure to take your time with your selection!
It is also possible to play the event in classic mode, with no difficulty level selected. In this scenario, the standard pool of rewards will be available to win.
Higher difficulty levels need to be unlocked, which can be done by earning achievements related to the event. For example, to unlock the "hard" difficulty level, you must first defeat a certain number of invading camps while playing on the intermediate + level. You can also temporarily unlock difficulty levels for active events with rubies. Please note that difficulty levels unlocked with rubies will only remain unlocked for the duration of the current event only.

The number of soldiers and total troop capacity in your castle keep. All troops exceeding the troop capacity of the wall's front and flank sections are stationed here. All troops exceeding the courtyard limit are placed in the reserve and do not participate in battle.
The defense bonus from your melee soldiers.

Mystery boxes can be won in events, purchased at traders or obtained through special offers. They are available in different rarities. The better the rarity of the box, the better your potential reward! A lot of luck is needed to draw the best reward from a mystery box.
